A French Gold Cup then a King George here next year is very much what we would be thinking, but whether we go to Cheltenham we would have to see. The first day we schooled him over a French fence he did it like an old handicapper. He adapts so easily. I was pretty confident, but you are never 100 per cent sure when you come across the Channel. Now we can dream that he is a real superstar - Noel George, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Fondeur (Chase) (Listed Race) (5yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I like teaching Il Est Francais and schooling him in behind but we had to make the running with him because nobody was going to try and take him on. That was his first time over those fences on heavy ground and he's done it very well. He's just got such a high cruising speed and it shouldn't be a problem for him adapting to Kempton. From the first day of him jumping fences, he took to it like a duck to water. He's a natural - Noel George, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Renaud du Vivier (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (4yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Il Est Francais has won his only four starts over hurdles and won them very impressively. The world is his oyster, really. He has a great attitude, jumps unbelievably well, will stay, has got speed. He didn't like the heavy ground, but he still won it, and he will cope with whatever he put in front of him. We have got to look at the big picture where he could end up. Further down the line, you will be seeing him over here (in England). This is the best young horse France has seen in a long time - Tom George, trainer.

runners.spotlight: He looked a superstar in the making when easily making all in the Grade 1 Kauto Star Novices' Chase over C&D (good) on this card in 2023; very up and down since and pulled up at Ascot last month following a break, but he was second to Banbridge in this last year (good) on the back of a poor run and it will be no surprise if he makes a bold bid now back at Kempton.

runners.comment: Won the Arkle despite the 2m trip; could relish first crack at 3m; firmly in calculations
runners.name: Jango Baie

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 1965 Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good. It turned out to be quite tactical, the lead changed a few times and I was aware we were going plenty quick enough. Jango Baie saw it out well. He always finishes his races well, as we saw in the Arkle last year, and I think he's turning into a really nice staying chaser. He'll step up to three miles now - Nico De Boinville, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: EBC Group Manifesto Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Like at Cheltenham, Jango Baie has finished very strong and I think we'll be starting next season over three miles. I had him in the three-miler here [Mildmay] and we tossed up between the two races and it was a difficult decision. He probably just hits a little bit of a flat spot and then he's got a bit to do. He was flat out all the way at Cheltenham, whereas he travelled today. He might well be a King George horse - Nicky Henderson, trainer

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We have said the whole way through that this is not a two-mile horse. If the Turners would have been here like last year then I suspect I know what we would have been in. Jango Baie wants two and a half miles. We thought we were going to make the running, but he had no chance because he couldn't go fast enough it was as simple as that. He was flat to the boards the whole way. I don't know if we will see him out again this season, but if we do it won't be over two miles - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My rule is to not come here first time over fences, but Jango Baie is very clever and it was beautiful. It was very good to watch - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That's the second time he's had to come out in really good races with a 5lb penalty, it stops them. You win a Grade 1 but you can't have your cake and eat it. You pay the penalty. Jango Baie is a good horse but he wants to go up in trip, two miles two round here is a bit tight for him - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Formby Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Formerly Registered As The Tolworth Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Jango Baie switched off and travelled well and I knew he would find a lot after the last. He's got a lot of improving to do again as he was a bit big at his hurdles, I'm sure he'll improve again. He finished his race off really well and will probably want further in time. I'm sure he'll probably be more of a two-and-a-half horse by then [the spring], hopefully he'll have big targets now - James Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: GL Events Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They just crawled and Jango Baie is rather exuberant. He's nice but I didn't really want it going that way - it's not our normal way of riding novices first time out but they weren't going fast enough for him. He's done bloody well to put his head down and get back up. He's very talented but just needs to learn to do it the right way round - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: The drop back to 2m was against him in the Arkle (good to soft) in March but he came from a very unpromising position to win; again stayed on strongly when third in the Grade 1 Manifesto at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) in April and powered clear for Grade 2 win at Ascot (2m5f, good) last month; he could relish this first crack at 3m and is firmly in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He was undoubtedly one of the stars, if not revelations, of last season as he won the Arkle at Cheltenham even though he was only running because of the unavailability of Sir Gino. He'd won at Cheltenham in December and was beaten a short head in the Scilly Isles over two and a half miles, but we dropped him back to two and, despite being nearly ten lengths down, he got up with a whirlwind finish to win going away. We went to Aintree after that but he finished lame and was sore, needing a screw in one of his joints. He's fine now, back in full work, and we've done his wind. He won't be going over two miles again and I would've thought three will be coming into the equation shortly, which could be seriously exciting. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Two-time 2m Grade 2 winner; 3m may be within range but a clear career best is needed
runners.name: Master Chewy

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Game Spirit Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Master Chewy was always going to run on and he probably needs further, so perhaps we'll go for the Ryanair - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a massive run. I'm heartbroken obviously but we are delighted to have put the Arkle run behind us, I don't think we'd have beaten Gaelic Warrior in a million years, but I think we might have been third or fourth. Master Chewy fell two out so ended up not having a hard race there, whereas some of those others did, but he had to back it up. He's run a cracker. The owners wanted to see if they had a Grade 1 horse and I think we can safely say they have. His jumping was brilliant. He learned from his fall a bit and he's learning all the time. We were getting there - Tom Bellamy, jockey.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Wayward Lad Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can't knock his form at all as Master Chewy has been very good. He has been called a few names, but I think it is important that he gets there late. He was beaten by a more experienced rival last time then at Aintree (on his second start) they took three fences out up the home straight and that completely mucked him up as his jumping is where he gets his air in his lungs and that helps him and that is why he is so much better over fences than hurdles. We will either look at the Kingmaker at Warwick or the Lightning with him at Doncaster before Cheltenham. We will then see how goes after that. The Arkle can often be a small field, so why not (give it a go)? - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won the Grade 2 Game Spirit at Newbury (2m, soft) in February and also kept on well when second in the Old Roan at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) in October; had wind surgery since disappointing at Ascot last month and it's possible that 3m will be within range but a clear career best is needed.

stable_tour.quote: We were very pleased with him in the Game Spirit, and he's always threatened to put up a performance like that. He was beaten only a head in a Grade 1 at Aintree, and was running a big race in the Arkle when he fell. We hope a step up in trip will bring out even more improvement.  17-2-25

runners.comment: Won Grade 1 C&D novice 12 months ago; has bundles of potential and could be serious force
runners.name: The Jukebox Man

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. Ben [Jones] said The Jukebox Man was a bit raspy in his wind after the line because he needed it that much. He's got this amazing way of attacking fences - short or long, he's quick and he's in and out. It was really good and he'll come on a bundle for it and all being well it sets us up perfectly for a few weeks' time. This horse is made for Kempton - he's got speed, stamina and jumps for fun - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Kauto Star Novices' Chase (In Memory Of Nigel Clark) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Jukebox Man got better as the race went on and I do think there's a lot of improvement to come. He's had a few sore heels in behind all week, so I've been working on that all the time. Going down to the start he was never moving with the exuberance he would've wanted and I was watching the race and wondering when he was going to let fly. Ben said he was so much quicker and accurate, and almost a better jumper today. He was probably feeling those heels early in the race before warming into it - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral John Francome Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Formerly Known As The Berkshire) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Jukebox Man was a bit close over the first few, was almost in hurdling mode. And then he became stupidly big and bold. Ben did well to rein him in. He's a big horse and it's his first run of the season, but he's going to improve a ton. I think he should've won the Albert Bartlett, but there's lots to look forward to - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Jukebox Man jumps like a buck and likes that ground. He copes with it really well so it probably gives him a little bit of an edge. He's obviously fairly classy. You could definitely see him jumping a fence next year. It's very exciting - Kielan Woods, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Dragonbet New Website Now Live Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: A few of ours have been needing it badly on this rain-softened ground we're experiencing, so it's nice The Jukebox Man did it despite that - Ben Pauling, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 over fences in the Grade 1 Kauto Star Novices' Chase over C&D (good) on this card 12 months ago; missed the rest of last season due to injury and reappeared with a convincing win in graduation chase at Haydock (2m5f, good to soft) last month; others have a lot more substance to their form but he has bundles of potential and could be a serious force today.

stable_tour.quote: He looks a million dollars. I couldn't be happier with how he's coming along but I don't think we'll quite have him ready for the Paddy Power. He's in the 1965 Chase at Ascot as I was quite keen to start over that sort of trip, but if those options aren't available the Coral Gold Cup would be a good option as he's well handicapped and supremely talented. The main aim is the King George, and once we've got that out the way he'll tell us if he's good enough for the Gold Cup or if the Ryanair might be better. He's got loads of speed, so a horse like Il Est Francais going up front would only help our cause at Kempton. 07-11-25

15:05.race_name: "Join Ladbrokes Bet £5 Get £30" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Runner-up in a bumper and won a point in 2023 but no show since; best watched after layoff
runners.name: Cooler Than Me
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Exeter bumper in March 2023 and won a two-runner point the following month, but failed to finish in three runs afterwards; returns for a new stable after a long absence and probably best watched.

runners.breeder: A D G Oldrey & G C Hartigan
runners.comment: Progressive dual winner on Flat; runner-up on hurdling debut; commands respect
runners.name: Gnomon
runners.owner: Andrew And Sarah Wates And Gt Racing

prev_owners.owner: A D G Oldrey & G C Hartigan

quotes.race: CopyBet Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: We went a good gallop and got racing early and we were able to skip out off the rail. Gnomon is only just starting to relax over this trip and he's coming up through the gears. The ground was probably too heavy from him last time at Ffos Las. He could end up being a nice horse next year - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won a bumper and showed progressive form on Flat for Ralph Beckett, winning 1m6f handicap in October off a mark of 79; beaten at odds-on in maiden hurdle at Hereford (2m, good to soft) on debut for new stable but shaped with some promise all the same, left behind only on the run-in and clear of the remainder; should improve for the experience and commands respect.

stable_tour.quote: I was very happy with his hurdling debut at Hereford last week - his first run for us since leaving Ralph Beckett, for whom he won twice this year. I wasn't too worried about getting beaten, as it was a slightly tactical race and we just lost out to a bit of experience really. The horse who beat us, Vol Royale, won nicely, and we were 16 lengths clear of the third. He'll be a nice horse, he'll improve on that first run and will definitely stay further in time. He wouldn't want the deep winter ground but I think he'll develop into a really nice handicap hurdler. 17-12-25

runners.comment: 0-4; some promise on hurdling debut at Huntingdon but others have more obvious claims
runners.name: Hans Lippershey
runners.spotlight: 0-4 but has made the frame on each outing, hooded when 9l third of 11 on hurdling debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) five weeks ago, fading after racing freely; should improve but others have more obvious claims.

runners.comment: Only sixth in Irish point in April but has joined top yard with a fine record here
runners.name: Ionian
runners.spotlight: 5-4 favourite when only sixth of ten in an Irish point in April; difficult to recommend on that evidence, but he's since joined a top stable with a fine record on this course; well worth a market check.

stable_tour.quote: He ran in a point-to-point in Ireland, finishing sixth, and he's a big, classy Blue Bresil gelding. He was very free, but I don't think that's his norm and therefore we're ignoring that. He jumps very well and he'll go straight over hurdles. I like him. 21-10-25

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Letoile & P Matzinger
runners.comment: Bumper winner; satisfactory start over hurdles when close second over C&D; respected
runners.name: Jimbo Sport
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three points before making all in Hereford bumper in March; satisfactory start over hurdles when close second of six in C&D novice (good ground; 6-5 favourite) last month, leading from two out until run-in and pulling clear of the third; open to improvement in first-time tongue-strap.

runners.comment: Point winner; building a solid foundation under rules; second at Exeter; may go one better
runners.name: Klub De Reve
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; building a solid foundation under rules, improving on form of hurdling debut when second of 16 in novice at Exeter (2m, good to soft) three weeks ago, always close up and beating the rest handsomely; sets the standard on form and looks the likeliest winner.

runners.comment: Headed only near finish at Market Rasen; pick of Ben Pauling's pair on jockey bookings
runners.name: Lock Stock
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on four of five starts under rules, headed only near finish at Market Rasen (2m1f, good to soft) six weeks ago; may still be unexposed; one of two runners for Ben Pauling and looks the pick on jockey bookings.

runners.comment: Promise in Irish bumpers in the summer, runner-up in big field at Galway; not ruled out
runners.name: Maskarvel
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in Irish bumpers in the summer, runner-up in a big field at the Galway festival (good ground) on latest start; will need to hit the ground running on stable/hurdling debut but he's not ruled out entirely.

runners.breeder: Mickley Stud & Mr & Mrs R A Green
runners.comment: Bumper win was back in October 2022; makes hurdling debut after mammoth layoff
runners.name: Mount Bonete
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point in March 2022 and won bumper at Worcester (good ground) the following October; the market may be the best guide to his chance as he makes his hurdling debut after a mammoth layoff.

runners.comment: Encouraging second on stable/hurdling debut at Lingfield; open to progress; leading player
runners.name: Zamek
runners.spotlight: Placed in Chepstow bumper for Paul Nicholls in April and again shaped encouragingly on stable debut when a clear second over hurdles at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) last month; open to progress and looks a leading contender.

runners.comment: Newbury bumper winner; fifth over hurdles there last month; more improvement needed
runners.name: Heron In The Park
runners.spotlight: £280,000 buy after winning an Irish point and easily dealt with her five rivals in bumper at Newbury (good) in March; better of her efforts over hurdles when fifth of 13 on same course (2m, good to soft; hooded) last month; further improvement possible but also necessary.

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De Lorne
runners.comment: Didn't progress in bumpers after debut win; plenty to find based on form of hurdling debut
runners.name: Kapability

quotes.race: Racing TV Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kapability is a nice filly to do that first time. Anthony [Honeyball] said he hadn't fully wound her up yet. She felt above average - Harry Cobden, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Didn't progress in bumpers after a successful debut and she finished some way adrift of Heron In The Park over hurdles at Newbury (18-1) last month; has plenty to find.

15:40.race_name: Ladbrokes "Best Odds Guaranteed In Racing" Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: 8yo who has had just five races but was competitive every time; absent another 755 days
runners.name: North Lodge
runners.owner: Mcneill Family & Exors Of Late N Farrell

quotes.race: Betway Mersey Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely run and North Lodge is an exciting young horse. He stayed on well and I would think we'll stick to the handicap route with him from an experience point of view. He's only learning and we've just scratched the surface with him - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Classic Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: North Lodge is a lovely horse. That was only his second run and he's exciting. We bought him from Sean Doyle's yard who has produced some great horses - The Worlds End being the flagship - and we've loved him from day one. When he won at Aintree we wanted to go small. We'd been looking at Fontwell on Sunday before Iain (Turner, racing manager) and Kingy said let's give him an entry here. We looked and looked at it and thought go for it, this is a bit better than Fontwell! I'd love to go to the Ballymore but I'll have to have a chat with Kingy first - Max McNeill, part owner.

quotes.race: Unibet Casino Deposit £10 Get £40 Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: North Lodge has had a lot of schooling and works with Clifton Bridge, who won yesterday (at Exeter). He's a horse we like a lot and it was a really good performance. I know the first two in the betting are well thought of, but I thought he'd run well. It was quite a hard race for him and maybe one run and we'll look where we go in the spring - Max McNeill, part owner.

runners.spotlight: 8yo who has had just five races; won one Grade 2 as novice hurdler, nearly a second and he was third in Grade 1 Aintree novice (2m4f, good to soft) in April 2022; creditable third in handicap at Newbury (2m4f) in December 2023 on sole start since, rallying strongly; 755 days off this time (yard runs two) but he's down 6lb and has been competitive in every race so far.

stable_tour.quote: He's back in strong work and looking terrific. He won't be out until at least the end of November and will stay hurdling this season as he's not had a lot of racing, having missed 2022-23. He's an exciting horse who was placed in Grade 1 company at Aintree the last time he raced. He could start over two and a half miles but he'll get three miles. 25-10-23

He's another exciting horse and was placed in Grade 1 company at Aintree the last time he raced. He missed last season but ‘s back in strong work and looking terrific. He won't be out until at least the end of November and will stay hurdling this season as he's not had a lot of racing. 10-11-23

runners.comment: Achieved little in last five races; blinkers instead of cheekpieces needs to work wonders
runners.name: Emailandy
runners.spotlight: Progress culminated in 2m4f win in March 2024 (same mark as today) but he's achieved little in his only five races since, pulled up in this contest last season; had wind surgery in July but pulled up again at Newbury last month; switching from cheekpieces to blinkers needs to work wonders.

stable_tour.quote: I had quite high hopes for him as a novice chaser last season but it was a disaster from start to finish and, like a lot of ours, he obviously wasn't right. We had his palate re-cauterised over the summer and hope he can bounce back when he goes novice chasing. Don't let the fact he was pulled up on his last two starts put you off; just look at Ken Roy, whose last three form figures were PPP but that didn't stop him coming out and making a successful chasing debut. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Has been very reliable but his progress may have stalled; now tries a slightly longer trip
runners.name: Georges Lad

quotes.race: Virgin Bet EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: George's Lad has just got better and stronger from run to run. We thought he wanted a step up in trip and they didn't go quick so he was a little bit keen. He was already qualified [for the EBF Final] but the reason he came here was that off 115 he wouldn't be guaranteed to get in. I wanted to make sure of it. - Emma Lavelle, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Second-season hurdler who's been very reliable and made the frame in smallish fields for his three handicaps this term; there are signs, however, that his progress may have stalled; now tries a slightly longer trip.

stable_tour.quote: He had a crashing fall when running a big race in the EBF Final at Sandown in March but he's  bigger and stronger this season. He was only just ready for his reappearance at Fontwell and took a couple of blows. He's come out of it straighter but Harry Cobden felt he might just have been thinking about that fall, so we'll do lots of gymnastic jumping to make sure he's confident. He'll certainly be further forward the next time you see him run. 05-11-25

runners.comment: 2m5f win last time made it 3-5 over hurdles (all on softer than good); progressing well
runners.name: Believitanducan

prev_owners.owner: Christopher Murray And Miss J R Macey

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was pretty good performance from the second-last. It's a good start. As soon as Believeitanducan jumped the first I thought he'd be all right and it's good to have a winner for the Owners Group again - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: 138th Year Of The Watt Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Believitanducan deserved that. He's been bumping into one and he loved the two miles, cut in the ground and 8st 2lb. He was really tough, he's so genuine - Jessica Macey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Same yard as North Lodge; second under Philip Armson on return; move up to this trip seemed to suit this 4yo well when he emerged on top in a sustained duel at Plumpton last time, the pair 15l clear; up another 4lb but he is 3-5 over hurdles (all on softer than good) and progressing well.

stable_tour.quote: He was bought privately as a dual-purpose horse by Anthony Bromley for the Owners Group, having won his last start on the Flat for Jessica Macey. He got a trip and he handled soft ground and I'd like to think he'll be one for juvenile hurdles later in the season. I've been very pleased with his schooling. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Totally dominant from the front on soft under E England in both starts this term; up 11lb
runners.name: Onewaywest
runners.spotlight: Eighth hurdle race when he made the breakthrough at Warwick (2m3f, soft) last month and he followed up off the same mark at Wetherby (2m4f, soft) one week later with another totally dominant display under Elliott England; has an 11lb higher mark and much more to prove if it's good ground (acts on good to soft) but the return to a right-handed track should suit (he keeps jumping out to his right) and he has to be prominent in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He goes well and isn't slow, so I think he'll hold his own. He probably needed the run when second again at Huntingdon last week, but there was promise in that run. 10-11-23

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Had a poor year until his good 2nd of six at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) four weeks ago
runners.name: Hamsiyann

quotes.race: Paddy Power Intermediate Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: All I wanted was for Hamsiyann to come back safe, it didn't matter whether he won or not. I was hoping he would avoid bad luck and have a bit of luck on his side. He was lucky that the horse who fell three out didn't bring him down. I gave a good bit of money for him a couple of years ago, but he's only coming to his milk now. That was sweet - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.spotlight: One useful Flat run (May 2024) and smooth 2m5f winner at Cheltenham (good) last November; struggled since until his good second of six at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) four weeks ago, 12l clear of the third; a career hurdles best is seemingly needed but he's back in serious calculations.

runners.comment: Solid record here; 3-10 over hurdles but he needs to find extra in this warmer race
runners.name: Paso Doble
runners.spotlight: Solid record here; 3-10 over hurdles, the latest win at Fontwell (extended 2m3f, good to soft) in October; creditable placings when claimer ridden in six-runner races on both starts since, the latest over 2m7f at Lingfield 13 days ago, but he needs to find extra in this warmer contest.

stable_tour.quote: The ground was a bit quick when he finished tailed off on his chase debut up at Ayr in April. We ran him back over hurdles first time up and he surprised us when winning nicely at Fontwell last month; we'll now look for something similar in the next couple of weeks and keep him to hurdling for the time being. 04-11-25

runners.breeder: H Lair, J Lair & F Champion
runners.comment: All starts on softer than good; serious each-way contender if the ground is okay for him
runners.name: Kap Boy

quotes.race: Unibet Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kap Boy is a nice, big baby. He'll be a future chaser one day, but we'll look after him and give him a couple more runs this season. McFabulous and Knappers Hill have won this race and it's a good race to run in and progress. We could find a nice race for him in the spring, there's plenty of improvement to come from him. Paul Nicholls, trainer

runners.spotlight: All starts on softer than good; waiting tactics for new yard this term, 11-8 favourite when reappearing with a 7l win at Perth (2m4f, soft) in October; creditable third of ten at Cheltenham (2m5f, soft) six weeks ago, never threatening the winner; serious each-way contender if the ground is okay for him.

stable_tour.quote: Harry [Cobden] thought he'd gone wrong when pulling him up on his hurdling debut at Chepstow, but he came back 100 per cent sound. He must have knocked something, but it didn't affect him for long. He'll reappear in another novice hurdle soon. This is something of an in-between season for this big baby, as he's a future chaser plying his trade over hurdles this winter, so we'll continue to look after him. 04-11-24

runners.comment: Unclear whether he'll be spot on for comeback, but highly unexposed and should do better
runners.name: Jus De Citron

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 British EBF 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's taken an absolute age to get Jus de Citron fit and he'll improve significantly for this. We won't go mad with him this season but I'd love to get him qualified for the EBF final at Sandown - Harry Derham, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a small-field novice at Doncaster (extended 2m3f) last December on rules debut; failed to improve, fighting a losing battle from the turn for home, when 19l third of eight in C&D novice (again good to soft) in February and not seen since, given wind surgery in August; due to go chasing and whether he'll be spot on for this comeback remains to be seen, but he's highly unexposed and should be capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: I like him. He'll go chasing after Christmas and won't be out until then as he's had a little setback. He jumps well and I think he could be a progressive novice handicap chaser. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Good second in this last year off 2lb higher; respectable at best since; cheekpieces go on
runners.name: King Of The Road
runners.spotlight: Three handicap wins last March-November before his good front-running second in this race; 2lb lower this time round, having run respectably in two of his four hurdle races since and had heavy/soft ground as an excuse in the other two; connections also now reach for cheekpieces, though, and others are a bit more persuasive currently.

runners.comment: Hat-trick bid failed but he made good late headway; this much longer trip is interesting
runners.name: Surrey Lord
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace for 2m wins at Ffos Las (soft) in October and Kempton (good) in November; not so good when unpenalised at Wincanton latest but made up plenty of late ground and, although he's 6lb higher today, this much longer trip is interesting, including on pedigree; one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a real fun horse, winning twice over hurdles for us this autumn. He just took his time to develop mentally but he's certainly got the hang of things now. It was  probably a bit quick to run him back the other day at Wincanton, especially around a track that's just far too sharp for him. I think he's still got plenty of improvement in him. At some point we will go up in trip as well - I think he will get plenty further. So I'll pick a couple of races for him post-Christmas and see what comes up - but he's definitely got more to come. 17-12-25

12:00.race_name: William Hill Daily Bet Boosts Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Qualifier)

runners.comment: Scored in clearcut style at Lingfield last time (second run for new yard); respected
runners.name: Broomfield Aderra
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who scored in clearcut style at Lingfield (2m3f, good to soft; second run for new yard) most recently and looks the type to improve further; respected handicap debutante.

stable_tour.quote: She had some nice form in Ireland and is a big, strong, scopey sort who finished third in a maiden hurdle at Fontwell on her first start for us. It was a good run and she took a good blow jumping the second-last, so I think there should be plenty of improvement to come and I'd hope she'd go well next time in a 2m4f mares' maiden hurdle. She should make a chaser in time. 10-11-25

runners.breeder: Elms Bloodstock & Miss A Gibson Fleming
runners.comment: Made all at Uttoxeter last time, beating Hard Dealt; may well remain competitive
runners.name: Analiese
runners.spotlight: Made all in similar event at Uttoxeter (2m4f, soft) last time, beating Hard Dealt (pair clear) and taking record to 2-7; this in-form filly may well remain competitive, despite 7lb rise.

runners.comment: Her two attempts over 2m4f were a win in May and good second to Analiese last time
runners.name: Hard Dealt
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage mare whose two attempts over 2m4f were a win at Worcester (good) in May and good second to Analiese at Uttoxeter (soft) last time; may improve further at this trip; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Has remained in form since April win; quite exposed but should give her running
runners.name: The Secret Pearl
runners.spotlight: Opened her account in April and has remained in form, second at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft) most recently; more exposed than some of these rivals but seems likely to give her running.

runners.comment: Opposed on the balance of her form this season; yet to win away from Carlisle
runners.name: Disco Annie
runners.spotlight: On a handy mark but the balance of her form this season, mostly over fences, suggests she can be opposed; furthermore, she has never won away from Carlisle.

stable_tour.quote: She's been hard to get settled at home but the penny really started to drop at the back end of last season and she was second at Cartmel. She's a bold front-running mare who wears her heart on her sleeve and she could be one for the Lady Buttons Go North Final. If she settles she'll get 2m4f. She runs on Thursday at Carlisle. 16-10-24

runners.comment: Maiden; went very close off just 1lb lower in this race last year; possibilities back here
runners.name: Sweet Magic
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but went very close off just 1lb lower in this race (good to soft) last year; possibilities in first-time headgear back here with Warwick reappearance under her belt.

stable_tour.quote: She deserves to have won a race and has just been unlucky. She's been in contention a few times, including when falling at the last at Warwick last season. She had a niggle from there, but bounced back to just get nutted on the line at Aintree on Boxing Day. We ran her at Ludlow last time but going right-handed didn't suit her at all. We'll go back the other way at Wetherby next week. 19-02-25

runners.comment: Maiden; latest effort suggests this return to 2m4f is worth exploring; could go well
runners.name: Jammy Jay
runners.spotlight: Maiden; fell twice in September but ran encouragingly at Hereford (2m, good) most recently, while shaping as if this return to 2m4f is worth exploring; could go well off bottom weight.

12:30.race_name: William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Sole effort this season took his record in the Old Roan over C&D to 213; solid claims
runners.name: Minella Drama

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'd say Minella Drama has been our flagship horse for a few years now and he deserved it. He's been placed in this race and a Melling Chase, so it's good he got his day in the sun - Brian Hughes, rider.

quotes.race: Jewson Fast Set Finish Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Drama ran a screamer and it's not sour grapes but the way he's gone through the race and jumped, you'd have to think he would have won if the fences were in. It's a shame because it's a great race with a lot of good horses, but it's not the best watch in the world with a bunch of good chasers off the bridle more than four furlongs up the straight. It happens every year, so they're going to have to do something. Whether they have it early or later, I don't know - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Marsh Chase (Registered As The Melling Chase) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It has to be the right conditions for Minella Drama to go against the others (if he is to win a Grade One). He goes on deep ground and goes on soft ground. You have to remember he was second in a Grade One as a novice hurdler, he's a smart horse. He is not the easiest to train. Adrian Lane lives with him and rides him every day and Brian makes it look a lot more simple than it actually is to be honest as he is a bit of a wild man. There will be a day when circumstances are right and we can capitalise on it.

quotes.race: Patrick Coyne Memorial Altcar Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Drama is a genuine Grade 1 performer. It's been a slow process with him because he is wild in everything he does. You keep him away from other horses, his tail goes round and he does this, that and the other, but he's very, very talented. It was always the plan to come here but we felt we needed to run him a few times over two miles first to get the freshness out of him. He's learning his job well and I'd imagine we'll be thinking of Aintree. Brian (Hughes) wants me to go to Ayr, which comes first this year, but it's all up in the air - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Sidney Banks Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Drama has always been a nice horse and his form has been solid. Every run has stacked up well, the horses he has beaten and who beat him first time have all come out and won and have good ratings now. He's progressing with every run and he's going to be a nice chaser next season. It was suiting us to run him over two miles because the right races were there but he does stay this trip and I dare say he might get three miles in time. But we'll take it one step at a time - Brian Hughes, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Ran creditably in sole outing this season, taking his record in the Old Roan over C&D to 213; retains lots of ability aged ten and looks a solid contender kept to this scenario.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a wonderful horse and has been there when we needed him. I was really pleased with his comeback in the Old Roan. He's a year older now but he ran another great race. The difficulty is where we go now, so we'll have to pick and choose right. He prefers a bit of better ground, jumps a little bit right but prefers to go left and he doesn't seem to like travelling to the south for some reason. He qualifies for veterans' chases and if he gets his sort of circumstances, he's still very useful. 30-10-25

A very talented horse who has won six of his 15 races and looks as good as ever. He was a decent third to Hitman on his penultimate run before running out an easy winner from Cooper's Cross, who gave the form a huge boost when subsequently winning the Sky Bet. I had wanted to see how he would cope over hurdles in the Champion Hurdle Trial at Haydock but that was frozen off, so with no similar options coming up he will stick to chasing. He is not a big flashy chaser, but he has an engine and I hope to run him in the Ascot Chase over 2m5f later this month if the ground is slow, as that race and track would be right up his street. 09-02-23

runners.comment: Came from difficult position for second-place finish last time; remains on a winning mark
runners.name: Heltenham
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham won over hurdles at the start of the season and maybe had a hard race, but he definitely had a hard race at Aintree after that on bad ground. Before Kempton in February, his coat massively changed and I knew he hadn't been right. He's come into form and is pretty effective round here and we'll look at all sorts of races. Maybe Sandown and the Oaksey Chase will suit him at the end of the season, a big galloping track. If a Bravemansgame turns up in that, he isn't in his league, but there's a race at Perth for him and options at Ayr and he's in the Topham too - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Dransfields CIU Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham was back over hurdles and it was a bit different for him. His jumping has never been his forte, back over hurdles he was knocking them but he's gone and done the job and that's the main thing - Tristan Durrell, jockey.

quotes.race: Run For Your Money At BetVictor Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heltenham is improving all the time and hopefully keeps improving. Chasing has helped him but time more than anything. I could see him one day coming here for a Coral Gold Cup, but that might be in 2024 rather than the autumn. More immediately, he could go to Sandown on the last day of the season for a novice handicap chase, but it would have to keep raining. He wants really slow ground, it's very important to him - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Came from a difficult position for second-place finish at Newbury (2m4f) last time; useful on his day and remains on a winning mark; clear possibilities if this race pans out favourably.

stable_tour.quote: He's done us proud over the years and hopefully there's another half-decent day in him. It all came together for him at the end of last season and he ran very well at Fontwell last time, although he's probably a little too high in the handicap at the moment. A big, strong-travelling horse, he wants to go left-handed on a galloping track on softer ground. He may go to Wetherby on November 15 and I hope there's another decent race in him. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Record of 211 since switched to chasing; open to further progress; warrants respect
runners.name: Josh The Boss

quotes.race: Wasdell Group Silver Trophy Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very insulting to see Josh The Boss priced up initially at 33-1 but a few people saw sense. He was very well handicapped on his form and we targeted this thinking he was very well in. He could go chasing but we'll see what to do -  Willy Twiston-Davies, assistant to trainer Nigel Twiston-Davies.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Supports Safer Gambling Week EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely over the moon. I was moaning when they took the hurdles out because that's John The Boss's strength. He's a proper National Hunt horse. I think we'll take it steady - we'll go and win the Challow and then we'll come back here in April for the Mersey Novices' Hurdle. It will be ten years since Splash Of Ginge got chinned in the Mersey by a length and we'd like to right that wrong - John Neild, owner.

quotes.race: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Brokers Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ever since Willy (Twiston-Davies) broke Josh The Boss in we thought he might be the one to bring us back to the big days. This is only a fraction of what he is capable of. It is hard to get back to where we were, but this could be the one that helps us cling on to that dream. We will give him another small run in a novice with a penalty to give both him and Jamie some more experience - John Neild, owner.

runners.spotlight: Record of 211 since switched to chasing includes a walkover; made all for comfortable win at Doncaster (2m3f, soft) most recently and is open to further progress; respected.

runners.comment: Respectable third in both starts this term; only 1lb above last winning mark
runners.name: Prairie Wolf
runners.owner: G R Orchard & Mrs J M Gray

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Prairie Wolf has gone over a shorter trip because of the ground. He was running a strong race at Carlisle , it was just one of those racing errors. I'd like to think he can go and win a couple more this season and the two-and-a-half mile handicap at the Cheltenham Festival would be the aim - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Respectable third in both starts this term, latest at Newbury (2m6f); has slipped to just 1lb above last winning mark; fighting chance, provided he's in peak form.

runners.comment: Consistent sort but is 0-9 over fences and likely set for another supporting role
runners.name: Inedit Star

prev_owners.owner: Dominique Vigneron, Nicolas Paysan Et Al

runners.spotlight: Ran respectably in novice handicap over C&D last time and remains a consistent sort but that defeat took his chase record to 0-9; likely set for another supporting role.

13:05.race_name: William Hill Formby Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made it 2-2 over hurdles with Grade 2 win at Haydock and he could make another bold bid
runners.name: Diamond Hunter

quotes.race: Betfair Supports Safer Gambling Week Newton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought we'd roll the dice with Diamond Hunter as he's a six-year-old who has been point-to-pointing and it's worked out really well. I thought he'd run a blinder but I didn't see him winning it. He won very nicely at Plumpton and he's a big strong horse, so we thought we'd have a go. It's all chasing next season as he's a proper chasing type - Chris Gordon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 0-4 in points but he won easily on his hurdle debut at Plumpton (2m, good) in October and followed up in a Grade 2 at Haydock (1m7f, good to soft); he's clearly a likeable prospect and he could make another bold bid.

stable_tour.quote: He's nothing flashy at home but, when you tell him to get on with it, Christ, he works well. I was delighted with him at Haydock on Saturday and we're keen to go for the Grade 1 Formby Novices' Hurdle at Aintree on Boxing Day. Timing-wise it fits really well, and natural progression will hopefully take him there. Along with Poet Laureate, Fortune Timmy and Kocktail Bleu, I think we've got some nice novice hurdlers in the team. 23-11-25

If he'd been four or five I wouldn't have rolled the dice and run him in the Grade 2 he won at Haydock on Saturday and instead would have found him a little novice hurdle somewhere. But as he's a six-year-old and had won very well at Plumpton the time before, I thought it was worth having a go at a good prize. It came off beautifully. He made quite a bad mistake going into the straight and lost a bit of momentum, but overall he did it really well against a good field. We'll probably head to Aintree on Boxing Day for the Grade 1 Formby Novices' Hurdle. Timing-wise it's perfect and it looks a natural progressive way to go with him. 01-12-25

runners.comment: Bumped into very classy prospect at Cheltenham but he may again be vulnerable
runners.name: Glance At Midnight
runners.spotlight: Good-ground bumper winner who scored by 6l on his hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) last month and produced another big run when 12l second at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; he bumped into a very classy prospect last time but may again be vulnerable.

runners.comment: Impressive on both hurdle starts; up in grade but he could play a leading role
runners.name: Idaho Sun

quotes.race: Remembering Sally Anne Malam Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Idaho Sun could only beat what he had to today, but it was another step up the ladder. He's clearly going the right way and it was good to get some more experience under the belt. All roads will lead to Aintree on Boxing Day now. He's really exciting to have and one of our leading novice hurdlers. He's one we've always liked and we hope he's still got more improvement to come to make himself known in that class. The Formby looks the right place to try him out next - Harry Fry, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: This was the start. Idaho Sun has obviously learnt a lot, especially at the second-last, but I'm delighted to get things under way and thrilled to see him come through that. That's been a good race for us in the past [a 30,000GBP race at Ascot in November] and a real stepping stone to better things - Harry Fry, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Berkshire Winter Million Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always really liked Idaho Sun and he's proved us right at Newton Abbot and again today. He's got a great attitude and takes everything in his stride, this was only his second time on the track but he seems very professional about it already. He's still got a lot to learn but he coped with the ground well, he travelled nicely did everything I wanted him to do - Bryan Carver, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Two-time bumper winner who was sixth in the big one at the Cheltenham Festival and is 2-2 over hurdles following wins at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) and Bangor (2m, soft); this is a much tougher test of his credentials but he's certainly impressed on his last two starts; could play a leading role.

runners.comment: Unbeaten 4yo who is ante-post favourite for the Supreme Novices' and has star potential
runners.name: Mydaddypaddy

quotes.race: Live Racing Streaming At CopyBet "Introductory" Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's been a nice experience for Mydaddypaddy. He was very quick and nimble-footed two out, which was very important and in the end he was authoritative. It's the jumping that is the most important and you have to give them experience. It could be one of the most important races he ever runs in and I'm glad we've done that. We'll see how good he is in the rest of the year and he'll go to the Formby now at Aintree over Christmas. Beyond that I don't know, but I want to run him in the Supreme. At the start of the year I thought he might want two and a half miles but now I'm very confident he wants two - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Bowel Cancer Screening Programme Saves Lives Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Mydaddypaddy is only as fit as all my novices are. I did explain to Dermot [Hanafin, owner] that he may take a blow and if he got beat, then he got beat, but it was class that got him through in the end. There was a bit of pressure because you want to go and see a nice clear round, but, with the support of the owners, we build into the season rather than set the fireworks off early, with the novices especially, which is a very helpful position to be in - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 11l win on debut in bumper at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) in March and also won with plenty in hand on both hurdle starts (2m1f/1m7f, soft/good to soft); faces a significantly higher calibre of opponent here but he's ante-post favourite for the Supreme Novices' Hurdle and has star potential.

stable_tour.quote: Out of a mare we trained, he won a bumper nicely at Huntingdon in the spring and looks an exciting novice hurdler for this season. He's only four and we tried our hardest not to run him last year, but he did everything so easily and naturally that we let him go and do what he did. We'd like to stick to two miles for as long as possible - he looks exciting. 10-11-25

runners.comment: 5l win on hurdle debut at Wetherby and it remains to be seen where his limitations lie
runners.name: Starmount
runners.spotlight: Point winner who made a winning start under rules in a novice hurdle at Wetherby (2m, soft) three weeks ago, making all by 5l having been backed into odds-on; takes a steep rise in grade but it remains to be seen where his limitations lie and his trainer continues to enjoy an excellent season.

runners.comment: Won by 12l at Doncaster on second hurdle start but others have stronger form claims
runners.name: Storming George

quotes.race: Eco-Power Group Novices' Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Storming George is a seriously nice young horse who's always done everything right. I couldn't be more pleased to see him do it in that way. The form of his Newbury run was boosted on Friday and he's proved he goes on all ground as well. That was really impressive and he could be quite special. I'm not sure where we go next, but it's wonderful to find another gem for Peter. I'll chat to him about where we go. It might not be a Graded race next just yet, but he could work his way up the ladder - Neil King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won big-field bumper (2m, good to soft) on debut and fifth of 15 in Grade 2 here (2m1f, good) next time; built upon last month's hurdle debut third at Newbury (2m, good to soft) for 12l win when 4-9 at Doncaster (2m, soft) last time; he can win more races but others have stronger form claims.

runners.comment: Close fourth in Grade 2 at Cheltenham last time but limitations may be exposed once more
runners.name: The Last Cloud
runners.owner: B Hague, Mrs W Duffus & Partner

quotes.race: Auto Services Perth Commercials Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I bought him at a dispersal sale of the late Trevor Hemmings. I was asked if I'd call this horse The Last Cloud, so we registered the name straight away and his owner Brian Hague was happy with that. I bought him as an unbroken horse at the sales and we worked away from there. He's turned into a smashing horse, although it's probably the last time you'll see him over a hurdle because he's going to go chasing. He's beautiful - Patrick Neville, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won at Perth (2m, good) in May on fourth hurdle start and handicaps there (2m, good) on next two outings; another good run when close fourth in Grade 2 novice at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft) in October but the limitations that were evident that day may be exposed once more.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse we're looking forward to - we think a lot of him. Being by Cloudings, he's probably going to take time. He had a lovely first run in a maiden hurdle and I liked the way he stayed on and finished out his race. He's a great jumper and a staying chaser in the making. 11-12-24

runners.comment: Useful, four-time Flat winner; third on hurdle debut but he would be a shock winner today
runners.name: Wahraan

prev_owners.owner: London Design Group Limited And Partner

runners.spotlight: Useful, four-time Flat winner who showed promise when third on hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month, albeit proving an awkward ride; has had wind surgery since; he would be a shock winner today.

stable_tour.quote: He's very talented and an absolute rogue. He runs the most extraordinary races. At Southwell last week he was probably 30 lengths behind the last horse. He decided to lock on and ended up finishing third having run the most inefficient and energy-consuming race of all time. He'll drop right at some stage and I've just got to unlock his brain. If we can do that there's a good race in him off 84. 'd like to keep him on next year as we might just have a reset over the winter. I could see him charging through the handicap because he's got a lot of talent. 11-09-24

13:40.race_name: William Hill Daily Bet Boosts Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 12yo who returned from long absence with promising fifth over C&D three weeks ago; chance
runners.name: Brewinupastorm

quotes.race: Rathbarry & Glenview Studs Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Brewinupastorm is a very, very good horse on his day. He really turned up today and I thought he outstayed Willie's horse from the back of the last. It's something I've always wanted to do, train a winner over here (Ireland), let alone a big winner - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Betgoodwin National Spirit Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was such a messy race, a horrid watch and I'd say a ghastly one to ride in. I'm just delighted Brewin'upastorm retains all of his ability because he travelled around really well in the Relkeel [at Cheltenham] then just flattened out but Aidan came in and said get his wind checked again. Fair play to Ben Brain who did his breathing operation but it was tight getting him here today. I've been negative for the last ten days, thinking I'd have loved another week but credit to everyone at home. He's in the Coral Cup but won't run at Cheltenham. Whether we look at Aintree again or Sandown at the end of the season I don't know but he's won his good pot again for the year and still retains his ability - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Cheltenham Festival Betting Guide Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Brewin'upastorm is a good horse and done me proud and it's nice he's turned up on the big day. Yes, there's only three runners but that's not our fault and well done to Lingfield for putting on fantastic prize-money. I'm over the moon. I'd imagine we'll probably freshen him up and go straight to Aintree - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a very good performance by Brewin'upastorm. He gave 6lb to the majority of the field. On his day he's very, very good. He can be very bad, he can put in a lackadaisical round of jumping but we've done a lot of work with him. His confidence was gone after he unseated in the Arkle and I'm chuffed. Everyone needs a good horse in the yard and when he's good he's very good. I thought he was very impressive today. He'll never jump a fence again. He's a hard horse to campaign in England because he's not a three-miler and he's definitely not a two-miler. He may go over the water for small-field Graded races in France or Ireland - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Loch Lomond Whiskies National Spirit Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I still think there's improvement, which is brilliant because Brewin'upastorm has won that with a bit in hand and I still think we're not the finished article. I think the fences earlier on in the season have taken their toll mentally on him and that's why I think he's on the comeback trail. I was quite anxious, I did want to follow McFabulous to the last but when I saw he was under pressure down the back, I didn't want to give him a chance so I committed sooner than I had planned - Aidan Coleman, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Mersey Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Brewin'upastorm is going to be a gorgeous horse to go jumping fences with next year. I don't know if we've been outstayed again or if it's the end of a long year but he did nothing wrong today. That's him finished for the season and 95 per cent certain he will go over fences now. One thing that is for certain is that we won't be going any further than two and a half - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: myracing.com Back In March Standard National Hunt Flat Race (Conditional & Amateur Riders')
quotes.quote: It couldn't have been a nicer ride to come back on as Brewin'Upastorm is a lovely, young horse and he did it very easily - Fergus Gregory, rider.

runners.spotlight: 12yo who has won three Grade 2s and returned from a long absence with a promising fifth behind Bear Market over C&D (soft) three weeks ago; 2lb lower today and he could show the benefit of that latest outing; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's going to miss the first half of the season due to a small problem and the plan is to have him back for the National Spirit, all being well. If he's not ready for that he'll be aimed at a spring campaign. He's been a star and hopefully there's still some petrol left in the tank. 24-10-24

He has been an absolute star for me and he'll have roughly the same campaign as he has had for the last three or four years. He'll start off at Aintree this month in a two-and-a-half-mile hurdle. He's very well and was an easy Grade 2 winner at Fontwell last season but didn't stay the three miles in the Liverpool Hurdle. I still believe he's got a nice race in him again, and while it's not going to get any easier for him as he gets older, he still retains plenty of enthusiasm and ability. 01-11-23

runners.comment: Ran well when third on stable debut in October but two lesser performances have followed
runners.name: Supremely West

quotes.race: Betfred Merry Christmas Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers' Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We've always thought a lot of Supremely West. He's got good form but was too keen last time at Hexham. He loves this ground and although he has the blinkers on, he's so game and honest - Charlie Hammond, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Supremely West is a good prospect. We gave him a squeeze along the back and he won well. He's schooled well at home and that was a good performance under a penalty - Charlie Hammond, jockey.

quotes.race: Garrarus Beach (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: It's unreal. I've four point-to-point winners but that's my first on the track so it's great. To be honest, Supremely West hung a bit that's why he raced wide. The lads said he'd stay so I made plenty of use of him and it worked out in the end. I wasn't hard on him, in fairness he picked up well, I'd say he still had a lot more left in the tank - Emily Cody, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Six wins from his 17 rules starts and he ran well when third of 17 off this mark on his stable debut at Cheltenham in October; however, two lesser performances have followed and he needs to get back on track.

stable_tour.quote: A new horse to us, he did well for his previous connections and pleased us when third in a 3m handicap hurdle at Cheltenham first time out this season, staying on well in a race where they went pretty hard. I didn't necessarily think that was an improvement on his existing form but the handicapper put him up a pound and I'd have to say we were very pleased with the run. I see him as a three-mile handicap hurdler for this campaign in his favoured slow conditions. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Stayed on for second over 2m at Newbury; this longer trip could prompt further improvement
runners.name: Indeevar Bleu

quotes.race: 1st Airborne Division Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was ideal. Indeevar Bleu is a beautiful one to look forward to if I can keep him trainable. Hopefully he's okay in the morning and it's just a case of slowly, slowly with him. We'll go small again now in three/four weeks time, he's very raw still  but he's got a lot of ability. Olly Murphy, trainer talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Thank You All Groundstaff For ~Groundsweek2023 Open NH Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always loved Indeevar Bleu but I haven't trained him for a bumper. He's taken so much time to come to himself but that was all pure raw ability today. He'll go novice hurdling next season and you won't see him until then as we want to look after him - Ollly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Ffos Las (2m, good to soft) in April and he kept on for second on last month's reappearance at Newbury (2m, soft), shaping as though this step up in trip could prompt further improvement.

stable_tour.quote: He had only one run last season before picking up an injury. He'll be back in a maiden hurdle and I hope he can progress into a smart novice. 24-10-24

I really love this horse and he'll start off over hurdles at Bangor or Wetherby in the next ten days. He won a bumper last season and has been jumping well at home. He'll probably want two and a half miles in time, but we'll start off at two and hopefully see him progress. 01-11-23

runners.comment: Won at Newcastle four weeks ago and remains feasibly treated back up 4lb
runners.name: Serious Operator

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Serious Operator is improving, his jumping was perfect. We were a bit worried about the ground. His hurdling is outstanding and he'll go chasing next season - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: When Serious Operator gets his ground and gets everything sorted he's a heck of a horse. He couldn't get out of the heavy ground last time. Today he travelled and I probably got there too soon. I hope he's turned the corner now - Patrick Wadge, rider.

runners.spotlight: He's worked his way back into form this season and won at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) four weeks ago; won on soft ground earlier in career; remains feasibly treated back up 4lb and could have a part to play.

stable_tour.quote: He needs good ground and wasn't quite right last season. The rain came at the wrong time at Aintree, but it was a really encouraging run. We could see him coming good in a big-field handicap hurdle over two and a half miles. 29-10-25

He came to us from Daniel Murphy in Ireland having won two point-to-points. He won first time out for us under rules at Kelso and, after an unhappy run at Cheltenham in October, returned this month with a win over 2m4½f at Newcastle. He's not over-big but has a nice engine and stays exceedingly well. He's better on good to soft. After his Cheltenham run Tom [Scudamore] suggested he had breathing issues and he was subsequently operated on. He won after the operation but genuinely seems better than ever and we could head back to Cheltenham this weekend. He's a strong galloper and jumps well and long term I can't wait to see him novice chasing. 25-01-23

runners.comment: Seventh of 18 in the Greatwood last time and the step back up in trip may be a positive
runners.name: Dedicated Hero

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We know Dedicated Hero is a nice horse but today was about finding out how nice he is, and he was very good. I was niggling at the end of the straight because he found the track a bit sharp but he stayed on all the way to the line. I just hope Ruby Walsh wasn't watching because I dropped my whip. The original plan was the Premier Hurdle at Kelso as he's won twice there and then maybe Aintree - we haven't really talked about Cheltenham - Ryan Mania, rider.

quotes.race: Racing Post Go North Jodami Series Final Open National Hunt Flat Race (Series Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dedicated Hero is a proper horse. When I rode him last time it was like I did everything I could to get him beat and he still pulled it out of the fire and won nicely. It's great to come and do that under penalty on ground he probably didn't love - Ryan Mania, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: He hasn't kicked on since winning a Grade 2 novice hurdle at Haydock (1m7f, soft) in January but didn't run badly when seventh of 18 in the Greatwood Handicap at Cheltenham (2m, soft) last month and the step back up in trip may be a positive; stable form has taken an upturn; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with his victory in the Rossington Main at Haydock on Saturday as he probably needs a bit further than 2m. He outstayed them, having got into a little bit of trouble, and it was a gutsy performance. He's quite difficult to fathom as he doesn't really show you anything at home. I thought 2m was going to be far too sharp for him, but he's won over that trip really well on his last two starts. We'll definitely go to the Listed Premier Hurdle at Kelso over 2m2f. He's unbeaten in three runs there and it has been the plan. Cheltenham won't be in the equation and I'm not a great lover of the handicaps at Aintree as they're very competitive and run at a hell of a pace. It'll be one race at a time and he's slightly ground dependent as soft is important to him. 22-01-25

runners.comment: Beaten on last nine starts but in good heart this season and he might not be far away
runners.name: Florida Dreams

quotes.race: Coral "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: His hurdling was good and Florida Dreams got the job done, but I don't think for a second he was liking the ground. He wasn't spectacular, but he's looking like he wants two and a half miles on better ground. Before we ran him over hurdles we half thought we'd give him a couple of runs and then head to the Formby (formerly the Tolworth) at Aintree, but he probably doesn't want winter ground. We'll see how he is in the next couple of weeks and make a plan - Nicky Richards, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a rough race but Florida Dreams was very tough. He has the speed for this trip but stays well and there's plenty of options for him. He's a really nice horse to go hurdling next season - Danny McMenamin, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Beaten on his last nine starts (finished fifth in this last year) with seven of those defeats coming at 7-1 or shorter; however, he's twice gone close this season (2m4f, good/soft) and again ran well at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft) last time; might not be far away.

stable_tour.quote: We were disappointed with with his start at Ayr - he was a bit keen and it was a falsely run race. I didn't think he jumped too badly and he'll have learned a lot from that. He went through the line well and hopefully he'll settle better next time. All's not lost by a long way with him, and we might take him to Musselburgh on Friday. 27-11-23

We're hoping to go to Ayr with him on November 4 and hopefully it'll be just nice ground - good to soft or similar. We're looking forward to him. He won his two bumper starts very well. First time at Musselburgh, there were a couple of talking horses in the race but he soon put them to bed. We gave him aeak and came back for Aintree, where we were fairly confident he'd run a good race. It was a bit of a messy race up the straight and there'll be half a dozen thinking they were unlucky but I'd match him up to any of them again. His schooling has gone well and there's the good race at Aintree on Boxing Day now [formerly Grade 1 Tolworth Novices' Hurdle], which would be an obvious first target if things go to plan. 25-10-23

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way over C&D recently but didn't see out the trip and finished fourth
runners.name: Rubber Ball

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Prices Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was probably asking too much of Rubber Ball today - it was only two weeks since Uttoxeter and he ran on the 2nd of January as well - but I wanted to come here. It's a big, galloping track and I thought it was made for him. I'd see no harm in stepping him up in trip if the ground was quick. This is the softest he's run on before, so perhaps stamina has won it for him - Neil King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo who ran well for a long way over C&D (soft) three weeks ago but didn't see out the trip, beaten 11l in fourth behind Bear Market; he could again prove vulnerable in the closing stages today.

runners.comment: Made it 3-3 at Aintree with C&D win 3 weeks ago; unexposed and could continue to progress
runners.name: Bear Market

quotes.race: New William Hill Racing Bet Builder Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bear Market's jumping was faultless and he keeps finding more - Mel Rowley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 for new yard, and 3-3 at Aintree, when making all over C&D (soft) three weeks ago, coming clear with an in-form runner-up; a 4lb rise isn't harsh and this unexposed 6yo could continue to progress; key player.

stable_tour.quote: This fellow has already made a good start to his career as he won his only point-to-point in England before going on to win the point-to-point bumper at Aintree. He'll probably start off in a two-and-a-half-mile novice hurdle. 22-10-24

14:15.race_name: William Hill Each Way Extra Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Soundly beaten last time but back down in grade here; has run well in this race previously
runners.name: Duke Of Deception

quotes.race: Tim Molony Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Duke Of Deception has been a different horse this year. He was really inconsistent last season for whatever reason but he seems to travel and jump a lot better. He handles the soft ground and he's going the right way - Oliver Greenall, joint trainer.

runners.spotlight: Second in this race in 2023 and third last year (both on soft); reappeared with a win from out of the handicap at Kelso (3m2f, good) in October; soundly beaten off career-high mark at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft) latest and just 1lb lower today, but he's back down in grade and not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Kelso last time and goes to Haydock on Saturday for a 3m1½f handicap chase. He's got a great record there. He does prefer slightly better ground, so he might be more effective in the spring, but he'll have a couple more runs while he's firing. 20-11-25

He's had two runs in point-to-points, the latter when a length-and-a-half third at Tralee in May with the first and second home being bought by Paul Nicholls and Nicky Henderson for six figures. Our fellow was a length clear at the last but was very green and was just run out of it. He's a classy, big horse and the plan is to start off in a bumper and then go straight over hurdles. 05-10-21

runners.comment: Won at Exeter last month on second chase start and could have more to offer over fences
runners.name: Blenkinsop

quotes.race: Coral Bet Bundles Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blenkinsop is improving and Henry fancied him. I rode him like I had a lot of faith in him, going wide and a few lengths back. We didn't go quick early and he ground it out. He won at Exeter last time when it would have only been good to soft and I'd say he's best on soft, but it's going heavy now. Henry's horses are flying and he's a very astute placer of them, so he gets the maximum out of what he's got. There could be more to come from him - Tom O'Brien, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner (including on soft) who built on his promising chase debut at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) to win at Exeter (3m, good to soft) last month when back up in trip; unexposed over fences and could have more to offer in this sphere; firmly in calculations up 5lb for last time.

runners.comment: Won this 12 months ago; lacks a recent run but returns with his stable among the winners
runners.name: Fortunate Man

quotes.race: William Hill Committed To Top Prices Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Fortunate Man can be a bit frustrating as he's good when he's good and awful when he's awful. He'll be a grand long-distance staying chaser - Jonjo O'Neill, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won this 12 months ago (soft); this is his first run since March but he returns with his stable among the winners; only six and this second-season chaser is open to further improvement this term; he's one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: I'd like to think he could improve a bit more with another year under his belt. I'm not sure where he'll start off yet, but he's better on soft ground and could be one for the regional nationals. 18-11-25

runners.comment: 11yo who runs off last winning mark but he tends to come good later in the season
runners.name: Dubai Days

quotes.race: Unibet Middle Distance Chase Series Veterans' Handicap Chase (Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Dubai Days usually takes a couple of runs to show his best so to do that first time out is good. He had a little niggle in the autumn so we thought we'd get him as ready as we could at home because he can be very hard on himself. He'll be back here next month for the final now - Bruce Lynn, jockey.

quotes.race: Seko Logistics Scotland Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dubai Days is a lovely, consistent horse. He takes a chance with one or two but I think he'll be better as a second-season chaser. He's declared tomorrow but I don't think he'll run. There's a race back here for him in ten days but I may put him away - Nick Alexander, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Defied absence to win off this mark at Haydock (2m4f, good to soft) in February and second of four at Carlisle (3m, good) next time; he could improve for last month's reappearance fourth of five at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) but this 11yo has tended to come good later in the season in recent campaigns.

stable_tour.quote: He unfortunately had a setback but he's due to be back in training at the end of this month. He's always shown his best form in the spring anyway, so I'd be targeting similar races that he ran in last year. He's a veteran now too, so he can run in that 2m4f veterans' series. He certainly retains all of his ability. 21-11-24

runners.comment: Won this in 2023; ran well at Ascot last month and failed to stay 3m5f there subsequently
runners.name: Snipe

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Boost Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Snipe is going the right way and could be one for marathon distances in the spring - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won this in 2023 (soft) on sole visit here and ran well when fourth of 12 at Ascot (3m, good) last month; failed to stay 3m5f there next time and he continues to edge down the weights; could have a part to play.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well at Kelso, despite being unsuited by the removal of six jumps because of low sun, and stepped up on that when fourth in a valuable 3m handicap at Ascot. He'll go back there on November 22 for the 3m5f race - I think he stays any trip. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Reappeared with close fourth at Cheltenham; heavy ground may not have suited there since
runners.name: Kelce
runners.spotlight: Progressive over fences last season (wins on soft/good) and this front-runner reappeared with a close fourth of 18 at Cheltenham (3m1f, good to soft) in October; heavy ground may not have suited there next time and there is every chance he will bounce back with a bold bid today.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken well to fences and is a great jumper. He ran a cracker on his comeback at Cheltenham and will probably go back there on Saturday for the amateur riders' chase we won last year with Transmission. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Pulled up four weeks ago following long absence but he's one to watch in the betting
runners.name: Snowy Evening

quotes.race: SBK Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Josh Guerriero decided after Newcastle last time that we were going to drop him back in trip, he was very adamant that was the right thing to do and we put some cheekpieces on. Snowy Evening needs this ground and that was his best round of jumping for a long while - he wouldn't jump a hurdle, he was ignorant, he smashed through them and chasing has made him. There will be plenty more to come from him in years to come - Henry Brooke, rider.

runners.spotlight: Progressive novice chaser in 2023-24 season; first run since when 13-2 and pulled up in small field at Doncaster four weeks ago; needs to prove how much ability he retains but he's only eight and showed up well for a fair way last time; one to watch in the betting on second run back.

stable_tour.quote: We've always thought he was one of our nicer horses. He just got beat by the smart Maximilian in a bumper and then he went the wrong way slightly.
