He's probably got himself quite well handicapped and has come back stronger. He was unlucky not to win on his comeback and once he gets his head in front, he'll keep progressing. 01-11-23

runners.comment: 3rd at Hexham last month but soundly beaten at Newcastle since and needs to prove stamina
runners.name: Sunset Hill

prev_owners.owner: Ian Turnbull And Susan Corbett Racing

runners.spotlight: Ran well when third at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) last month on second chase start but soundly beaten at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) since and she needs to prove her stamina now back up in grade.

14:50.race_name: William Hill Extra Places With B.O.G Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Rallied gamely at Carlisle on chase debut, taking overall record to 4-5; respected
runners.name: Juby Ball

quotes.race: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts 'Chasing Excellence' Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Juby Ball is a big baby but he's been crying out for a fence. He's a horse who wants to jump and the more fences the better. He had to learn a lot today when he came off the bridle, it was a long way up that hill to come off the bridle. His attitude was very good. He only just fell in today, he didn't win hard held, so he's got an awful lot to learn and improve. Soft ground is very important to him - Evan Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Let's Bet Personal With Fitzdares Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Juby Ball is just a proper horse, a gorgeous big stamp and is doing everything the right way. He is not the easiest at home and they have done a good job to get him here and be so professional on track - Adam Wedge, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: DragonBet Supporting British Racing Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I came down last night and had a walk round the place because I've missed so many opportunities for Juby Ball. He was great, it was nice to get him out and even better to get the win - Evan Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Rallied gamely to justify favouritism at Carlisle (2m, soft) on chase/seasonal debut and take overall record to 4-5; still open to further progress and commands respect in first handicap attempt.

stable_tour.quote: He's a big, strong horse for the future who won a bumper at Ffos Las and ran very well in defeat at Sandown. That'll probably be it for the season as he'll benefit from a good spring at grass and will go novice hurdling next term. 28-02-24

runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Record of 3-3 since switched to chasing; shooting up the weights but his roll may continue
runners.name: Chuggy

quotes.race: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Chuggy is going the right way and could drop back to two miles - Harry Skelton, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Record of 3-3 since switched to chasing and he's gained the wins by progressively bigger margins, latest by 12l at Warwick (2m, soft; made all); shooting up the weights but his roll may continue.

stable_tour.quote: At around 17 hands, he was always going to improve on what he'd done over hurdles, and he duly won on his chasing debut at Uttoxeter last month. That was a lovely performance and he should continue on an upward trajectory as he steps up in trip. 10-11-25

runners.breeder: R F Broad & R S Bebb
runners.comment: Has failed to show his form in two starts since switched to fences; opposed
runners.name: Roysse
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner who has failed to show his form in two starts since switched to fences, beaten long way at Warwick (behind Chuggy) latest; something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite keen on his chase debut at Chepstow on Wednesday and I'd be keen to get him out again as soon as I can. He jumped well on the whole, if a bit exuberantly, so hopefully he'll learn on the job. He took a blow when he pecked on landing four out and Ben just looked after him from there. 07-11-25

runners.comment: Won at Wetherby on seasonal debut, taking overall record to 2-5; may improve further
runners.name: Throatlash

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV In HD Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Throatlash is probably the biggest horse I've ever trained. Ballabriggs was 17.1 or 17.2 and this lad's enormous. I think a lot of people didn't buy him because he was so big. But he's the kindest you've ever seen and he jumps like a buck. He should improve for his first run of the season as well - Donald McCain, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery prior to scoring at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) on seasonal debut, taking overall record to 2-5; may be capable of further improvement; receives weight all round; possibilities.

15:25.race_name: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB)

runners.comment: Close second at Newcastle and went one better in clearcut fashion at Sedgefield
runners.name: Grazeon Sunshine
runners.spotlight: Close second in a bunch finish at Newcastle (good) and went one better in clearcut fashion in six-runner race at Sedgefield (soft) three weeks ago; defying a penalty today will probably require a fair bit more.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Pipped by a good one in Irish point; narrowly justified 5-6 favouritism in Chepstow bumper
runners.name: No Walkover
runners.spotlight: Pipped by a good one in his Irish point (3m, heavy) in February; justified 5-6 favouritism in 11-runner bumper at Chepstow (soft) five weeks ago on rules debut, in an even tighter finish (runner-up Half Hoping runs in today's 3.27 Fontwell); markedly better may be required under a penalty today but he's made a promising start.

runners.breeder: Tommy James, Eoin Banville & Lucy Norton
runners.comment: Two Irish points and bumper at Market Rasen suggest he is best watched
runners.name: Bargain Hunter
runners.spotlight: Third of four finishers in his second maiden point in Ireland; last of five when 33-1 for bumper at Market Rasen (good to soft) one month ago, not beaten far but he set a slow pace; again best watched.

runners.comment: A well-related newcomer to note from major yard
runners.name: Capital House
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; closely related to 2m/2m1f hurdle/chase winner Defan, half-brother to 2m6f hurdle winner Ushuaia Dancer; dam point winner, half-sister to winners Long House Hall (smart 2m1f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Willyanwoody (useful 2m7f chase); a newcomer to note.

runners.comment: Won Irish point by 10l shortly before his sale for £30,000 in November; needs a check
runners.name: Double Indemnity
runners.spotlight: £13,000 yearling, £12,000 3yo; second foal; dam unplaced in bumper and 2m-3m hurdle races, half-sister to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Havana Hermano, out of useful bumper and 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner; ran in two Irish maiden points this autumn, winning one by 10l shortly before his sale for £30,000; interesting if he's strong in the market.

runners.comment: Irish point win in March; joined top stable and market strength would be highly noteworthy
runners.name: Moments In Time
runners.spotlight: 20,000euros 3yo; third foal; half-brother to fairly useful 2m5f/2m7f hurdle winner A Perfect Day; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m3f/2m6f hunter chase winner Burning Ambition; left clear at the last when he had the upper hand in an Irish maiden point in March; has joined top stable and market strength would be highly noteworthy.

stable_tour.quote: A big, striking grey who bolted up in his Irish point-to-point, he'll want soft ground and will probably stick to bumpers this season. He won't be out for a while but looks quite exciting. 10-11-25

runners.comment: First race of any description and probably up against it
runners.name: Racscopic
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam once-raced half-sister to sprint winners Bollin Billy and Bollin Franny, out of 5f-winning half-sister to St Leger winner Bollin Eric; first race of any description and probably up against it.

runners.comment: 5th of 11 and 8th of 13 but both were at Cheltenham; the form gives him a big shout
runners.name: Wonder Flying
runners.spotlight: Fifth of 11 and eighth of 13 when 33-1 and 18-1 in his two bumpers, but they were both at Cheltenham (good/soft) and in a Listed event last time; the form of both races gives him a big shout.

11:52.race_name: Watch William Hill Inside Track Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Sixth in bumper; 1-14 in points; others appeal more
runners.name: Callmesusie
runners.spotlight: Sixth in an Aintree bumper in May 2024; 1-14 in points, last seen in April of this year; now goes hurdling and has stacks of jumping experience but others still make more appeal.

runners.comment: By Telescope out of 2m4f-3m1f chase winner; worth market check in first race of any kind
runners.name: Ciao Bellisima
runners.spotlight: By Telescope out of a 2m4f-3m1f chase winner; worth a market check in first race of any kind.

runners.comment: 80-1 and showed little in maiden hurdle at Hexham in October
runners.name: Courtcorrespondent
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd & Mrs S Morrell
runners.spotlight: 80-1 and showed little in maiden hurdle at Hexham in October; yard won this race 12 months ago but this one is difficult to recommend.

runners.comment: Beaten 27l on hurdling debut and will need to jump with more fluency if she's to progress
runners.name: Dillys Gunner
runners.spotlight: Some promise in bumpers but was beaten 27l on hurdling debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft; 66-1) and will need to jump with more fluency if she's to progress.

runners.comment: Promising second in Irish point and fourth in Carlisle bumper; interesting contender
runners.name: Halftheworldaway
runners.spotlight: Clear second in soft-ground Irish point in April and sold for 130,000euros afterwards; might have needed the run when 16l fourth in bumper at Carlisle on rules debut, fading after pressing the leader 3f out; has some potential and may well make an impact on today's first attempt at hurdling.

stable_tour.quote: She needed the run in a bumper but looked capable of winning one as it was a strong race. She might run in another and then go novice hurdling. We really like her and it would be nice to get her to the good mares' races. 20-11-25

runners.breeder: M L Besnouin & J M Feuillet-Besnouin
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two races last season, including this one; hard to fancy
runners.name: Jolie Maresca
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in two races last season, including this one; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Well held in bumpers; reappears after wind op and with the addition of hood/tongue-strap
runners.name: Just Jane
runners.spotlight: Well held in bumpers; needs to have been transformed by wind surgery and the addition of a hood and tongue-strap.

runners.comment: Promise in two bumpers, close fifth here on latest; should be competitive on hurdles debut
runners.name: Laffer Curve
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in bumpers but there was promise on both occasions, just unable to sustain her effort when a close fifth here (soft ground; 5-4 favourite) on stable debut last month; makes her hurdling debut in an ordinary race and should be competitive.

stable_tour.quote: Fourth in an Ascot bumper before we bought her, she's a big, strong, scopey mare who will qualify for the GBB bonus if she wins a bumper, so we'll try and get a few quid in the pot for the team. It's early days but all's well so far. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Three places behind Laffer Curve in bumper here last month but bred to make a hurdler
runners.name: Midnight Bella
runners.owner: G R Orchard And C Clarke
runners.spotlight: Came home three places behind Laffer Curve in bumper here (12-1) four weeks ago, but bred to make a hurdler and can't be ruled out completely now tackling obstacles.

runners.comment: No encouragement at long odds in a bumper and novice hurdle
runners.name: Moonlight Trail
runners.spotlight: No encouragement at long odds in a bumper and novice hurdle.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; rallied when third at Southwell 12 days ago; commands major respect
runners.name: Rosie Baloo
runners.spotlight: Won a good-ground bumper at Southwell in the summer and has made an encouraging start over hurdles, rallying when third of eight on the same course (2m4f, good to soft) 12 days ago; from a decent jumping family and should not be long in opening her account in this sphere.

runners.comment: Stuck to her task well when second on hurdling debut; no surprise if she goes one better
runners.name: Rosie Mahler
runners.spotlight: Stuck to her task well when 2l second of seven in maiden hurdle at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy; 11-2) last month; likely to improve for the experience and it would be no surprise were she to go one better.

runners.comment: Sometimes looks wayward but she's the form pick judged on her third at Doncaster
runners.name: Scavengers Reign
runners.spotlight: More experienced than most of these and her third of eight at Doncaster (2m3f, soft) four weeks ago is the best piece of form; sometimes looks wayward (ducked sharply left and unseated rider on penultimate start) but she ought to make her presence felt.

stable_tour.quote: She was placed in two bumpers last season and wasn't beaten far on her debut over hurdles at Huntingdon just over two weeks ago. We'll keep her to mares' races for now but she'll get further and is a chaser in the making. 24-10-25

runners.comment: Last in Listed bumper on rules debut; more needed on switch to hurdling but this is weaker
runners.name: Shinealight
runners.spotlight: Finished alone in Irish point in May, after which she changed hands for 30,000euros; last of 12 in Listed bumper at Cheltenham (80-1) on rules debut; more needed on switch to hurdling but at least this is a weaker race.

runners.comment: No threat in Carlisle bumper (28-1) last month; hood (worn in a point) is refitted
runners.name: Shouldvebeenshav
runners.spotlight: Not far behind Halftheworldaway and Midnight Bella in Carlisle bumper (28-1) last month, although she never posed a serious threat; wore a hood in her only point and that goes back on today.

runners.comment: Folded tamely in bumper here in November; best watched on hurdling debut
runners.name: Ten Off Fifty
runners.spotlight: Third in Irish point in April 2024 but then off the course until folding tamely in bumper here (22-1) in November; best watched on hurdling debut.

12:27.race_name: William Hill Racing Bet Builder Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Qualifier)

runners.comment: Fourth on chasing debut at Sedgefield; may still be unexposed and should be thereabouts
runners.name: Bo Cruz
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in all three of his handicaps, fading when fourth of seven on chasing debut at Sedgefield (2m5f, soft) on latest; may still be unexposed and should be thereabouts.

runners.comment: Beaten neck over C&D three weeks ago; going the right way and looks a strong contender
runners.name: Athair Mor
runners.spotlight: Has improved with each run for current stable, collared close home and beaten neck over C&D (soft) three weeks ago; nudged up 3lb but going the right way and looks a strong contender again.

runners.comment: Has become disappointing; no promise on chase debut; now wears cheekpieces and tongue-tie
runners.name: Wolfburg

prev_owners.owner: G R Orchard And Annie Mania

runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and disappointing since winning a Catterick maiden hurdle (1m7f, soft) in February 2024, with no obvious promise on chasing debut last month; tumbling in the weights but needs the new cheekpieces and tongue-strap to make a big difference.

stable_tour.quote: He came back from his last run at Carlisle with a bit of an injury, so he's had some time off. He'll be back in work shortly and we'll keep him hurdling now. He needs a bit of time between his races. He was good in a bumper and very good the day he won over hurdles at Catterick last season and you can probably give him excuses for some of his other runs, which have been disappointing. He'll be a cracking novice chaser next season. 22-01-25

runners.comment: Going backwards when unseating rider on British/chasing debut; probably best watched
runners.name: Aill Dubh
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point last November but his rules form is not particularly strong and he was going backwards when unseating his rider three out on British/chasing debut at Hexham (25-1) two weeks ago; probably best watched.

runners.comment: Quickened clear to make winning chasing debut at Market Rasen; 9lb rise fair; major chance
runners.name: Florita
runners.spotlight: Dual point runner-up; didn't achieve much over hurdles but she made an immediate impact on chasing debut at Market Rasen (2m3f, good to soft) three weeks ago, making smooth headway and quickening clear; that came off a basement mark and a 9lb rise does not look insurmountable; major chance.

runners.comment: 0-17 under rules, mostly in Ireland; hopes rest on a change of stable; watch the market
runners.name: Ivar The Boneless
runners.spotlight: 0-17 under rules and yet to trouble the judge in 11 chase starts, most of them in Ireland (often highly tried); hopes rest on a change of stable and market support would be significant.

runners.comment: Well-held last of five finishers at Catterick ten days ago; hard to fancy on that evidence
runners.name: Mr Mahler
runners.spotlight: 0-14 under rules and he was disappointing when a well-held last of five finishers at Catterick (7-2) ten days ago; hard to fancy on that evidence.

runners.comment: More miss than hit over hurdles but some promise on chasing debut over C&D; not ruled out
runners.name: Mademewhatiam
runners.spotlight: More miss than hit over hurdles but there was some promise in his fourth on chasing debut over C&D (soft; 18-1; faded after making smooth headway) last time; 6lb better off with runner-up Athair Mor and not ruled out.

13:00.race_name: William Hill Each Way Extra Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Modest third of four finishers on handicap debut over fences; now back hurdling
runners.name: Big Boy Barney
runners.spotlight: This point winner could manage only a well-held third of four finishers when switched to fences for last month's 2m Ludlow handicap debut; improvement will be needed quickly now returned to hurdles.

runners.comment: Unexposed making a quick switch to handicaps but his mark isn't obviously generous
runners.name: Milan Park
runners.spotlight: Unexposed now making a quick switch to handicaps but his mark isn't obviously generous and some of the other handicap newcomers make more appeal.

runners.comment: Struggled since a maiden hurdle win in Ireland in July
runners.name: Nitty Gritty
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle at Killarney (2m4f, yielding to soft) in July for Joseph O'Brien but well beaten on final run for that yard and it's been the same story on all three outings for this stable.

runners.comment: Modest form in three hurdles but potentially well treated on bumper win in March
runners.name: Oneinthewell

quotes.race: QuinnBet (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Oneinthewell is very lazy at home but he's worked well away a few times with some nice horses. He has ability alright; it's just a matter of getting it out of him. He has plenty left in the tank and doesn't overexert himself. The nice ground helped him. He's a Mastercraftsman and the dam is a sister to Altior so it's a right page. We might look at the Listed race in Limerick - Tom Cooper, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Yet to build as might have been expected on March's Leopardstown bumper debut success but he hasn't been with the excellent James Owen stable for long and the way he made late headway for fifth in 2m Huntingdon maiden hurdle last time points to him making more of an impact now handicapping up in trip; very interesting, particularly if backed.

runners.comment: Huntingdon win for new yard last month but only seventh there off this mark since
runners.name: Tigga Time
runners.spotlight: Drew a blank for Sandy Thomson but won a good-ground Huntingdon handicap over an extended 2m4f last month on only his second start for Sarah Humphrey; a 4lb rise proved enough to find him out back there since and there's a suspicion he might be vulnerable to some of the less exposed sorts today.

stable_tour.quote: An English point-to-point winner we bought at the Cheltenham sales and I think he'll run well in a bumper. 15-11-23

runners.comment: Best run over hurdles when fourth latest; there should be better to come now handicapping
runners.name: Fast Work
runners.spotlight: Third in a bumper last winter; best run over hurdles when fourth of seven in 2m1f Newcastle maiden (good to soft) four weeks ago and there should be more to come from him now he's handicapping and up in trip.

runners.comment: Only minor promise in qualifying runs; tongue tied now handicapping
runners.name: Vinnie Oneil
runners.spotlight: First flicker of promise when 400-1 fourth at Uttoxeter (2m, good) in October; had wind surgery after and failed to build on that when down the field at Southwell 24 days ago; has more of a chance now handicapping but others still look more obvious; tongue tied first time.

runners.comment: Likely improver now handicapping for top yard; market confidence likely to be significant
runners.name: Brookside La
runners.spotlight: Never better than midfield in three qualifying runs at about 2m in recent months but rates a likely improver in handicaps for top yard that had a handicap newcomer justify favouritism in a similar race at Huntingdon on Monday; market confidence is likely to be significant.

stable_tour.quote: He was a little frustrating last year but ran better on his reappearance in a 2m maiden hurdle at Kelso. He was beaten far enough but he was running through the line in a way that suggested he was a stayer in the making. A step up in trip should suit him. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Jumped poorly on handicap chase debut but offered some promise over hurdles last season
runners.name: Sams Falcon
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who displayed promise in the second of his three 2m1f hurdle runs towards the end of 2024; switched to fences for his handicap/seasonal debut but jumped poorly; would need to see market support if he's to be considered on this quick return to hurdles.

runners.comment: Four point wins but 0-8 over hurdles and likely to find at least one too strong again
runners.name: Wise Move
runners.spotlight: Four-time point winner but 0-8 over hurdles, including four handicaps; may come on for his recent Newcastle fifth after a break but others in this line-up have much greater scope for improvement.

runners.comment: AW Flat win in October; has reached frame in handicap hurdles since; place shout
runners.name: Lillistar
runners.spotlight: 2m AW Flat winner in October; three creditable in-frame efforts in handicap hurdles since, including here; place chance.

13:35.race_name: William Hill Rowland Meyrick Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: G Codre & Mrs A & K Kepa
runners.comment: Back to winning ways in 3m4f Cheltenham handicap last month; should be competitive up 5lb
runners.name: Marble Sands
runners.owner: Dl Adams, Ja Adams & G Mcpherson

quotes.race: Oddschecker Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's feels unbelievable to have a winner here, it really does feel good. I'm thrilled for his owners, David and Jackie [Adams], who are massive supporters of the yard, as they've been dying to have a winner at Cheltenham for so long.Marble Sands had a bit of a question mark about the stamina, but we didn't need it. I was happy enough with how he was going and Kielan's given him a great ride. I'm delighted. We'll get him home and have a think about where to go next. We had been thinking about the Rehearsal Chase, but we'll see. Fair play to the team, they're doing a great job. We've had a slow start to the season but this makes it a lot better - David Killahena, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Colin Parker Memorial Intermediate Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aintree was the plan [last week's Old Roan] but this was the second option. The ground probably wasn't ideal as it was on the slower side of good and Marble Sands likes a sounder surface, but he's done it nicely. He had his two runs on the Flat to get him ready for it. This was the target and he won't be running on too soft ground and we'll have a look at what's about. The owners are very patient and if there's nothing for him the next few weeks they're happy to give him a break - David Killahena, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: M1 Agency Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We will go back and have a look but Marble Sands has done plenty this season to deserve a go at the Ballymore probably so fingers crossed. We will go back and speak to Graeme, David and Jackie )owners) and see what they want to do - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Fit from a good run on the Flat when making it 4-11 over fences in valuable 3m4f Cheltenham handicap (soft) in November; should remain competitive off 5lb higher.

runners.comment: Returned from absence to finish 4th in smart Haydock contest; entitled to come on for run
runners.name: Knappers Hill
runners.owner: Chris & Giles Barber And P J Vogt

prev_owners.owner: P K Barber And P J Vogt

quotes.race: Boodles "Rising Stars" Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was brilliant. Knappers Hill could possibly go to Newbury next (for the John Francome Novices' Chase) - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Select Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were a bit worried about the ground and we were in one mind whether to run him or not, because the only time Knappers Hill has been disappointing was here in the EBF Final on soft ground. We rode him different today and just took our time, I said to Bryony to let him creep into things and hope they don't go too quick and see if he gets the trip and he did. He'll go chasing next year, he'll be a nice type for things like the Rising Stars at Wincanton so we're looking forward to that now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Elite Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was fairly obvious the only way we were going to win was by going a gallop. Knappers Hill jumped well, which was brilliant. He stays well. He is a good horse and he is improving. He obviously stays and we took the race to them. I was just worried a fraction about his jumping, but he is brilliant now. He is obviously a smart horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Wasdell Group Silver Trophy Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Knappers Hill is quite sharp. It's good to see him gallop all the way to the line over two and a half [miles] and the horse is not short of speed so where we go next, I don't know. He's going to go up now and I always half had in my mind to go to Wincanton [Elite Hurdle] with him. I just think a fast-run race and of the horses I've won with before he'd favour with those. The faster they go the better he'd be. I don't know what we do but he's quite progressive and looks an interesting hurdler. He won't go chasing just yet - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Championship Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Knappers Hill is a really nice horse. We knew we had to qualify at Newton Abbot last week so I kept him fresh for that and that race brought him on a bit today. He has done that nicely off top weight. He was sixth in the Betfair Hurdle of 135 and a bit of inexperience that got him behind and on that form he was going to be hard to beat today. He loves good ground and running him in the EBF Final was an error but the owners were keen to go as they didn't want to go to Cheltenham with him. It didn't do him any harm and we just waited for better ground. Something like the Gerry Feilden would be a good starting point next season - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a racecourse school for Knappers Hill really but we've got a bit more experience. He needed it as he's been a bit fresh but he's learning all the time. We'll now go in a better race somewhere where he can get a lead. The Kennel Gate [at Ascot] would suit him and is an option. I always thought we'd have a couple of runs then go there but we'll see. I'm not convinced he'd want the ground too deep as he's a speedy horse. That would be a perfect race for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Andy Stewart Racing's Great Friend Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Knappers Hill will go to Wincanton on November 6 for another novice hurdle. He needs experience and was a bit keen and green there. He's a bit of a baby and two miles is fine for now. He's got enough boot, but just needs to sharpen up his jumping. He'll be better in a bigger field, getting a good gallop and he can follow them. He'll keep improving, but I honestly wouldn't know how far because he surprised me last year. He'll go on any ground - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Enter ITV7 Tonight Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry Cobden chose to ride Stage Star because he'd won on the soft at Chepstow, but if he'd have run on quicker ground at Chepstow - like Knappers Hill did - he'd have won as well. There isn't much between them and the idea with Knappers Hill would be to go to Aintree for the Grade 2 bumper at the Grand National meeting and not do anything in between. I think they want three bumper runs and then go hurdling. He's schooled already and does everything nicely - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Wasdell Group Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Knappers Hill is one of loads of 4yos we've to run. He'll stay in bumpers this season and go hurdling this time next year - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 2 hurdle winner in the 2022-23 season and he won the Grade 2 Rising Stars novice chase at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) in November 2023; absent for two years after but offered enough when 8l fourth to The Jukebox Man and recent Ascot winner Iroko in graduation event at Haydock (2m5f, good to soft) five weeks ago to suggest he retains all of his ability.

stable_tour.quote: It's great to have him back after the best part of two years off the track. He's been in since the start of July and we had hoped to run him back over hurdles in the Silver Trophy at Chepstow last month but conditions had quickened up. Although he does act on any ground, you wouldn't want to take any risks after the problems he's had. He'll be back chasing now, although after two runs he won't be the easiest to place. His handicap mark is definitely on the high side for what he has achieved over fences. Graduation chases are a real help to a horse like him who lacks experience, and there's one at Haydock on Betfair Chase day I've got my eye on. Understandably, after such a long time off he was pretty rusty to begin with, but he's starting to come together nicely now and we took him to Newbury for a racecourse gallop a week ago. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Smart 10yo who is feasibly handicapped and might come on for last month's Ascot sixth
runners.name: Our Power

prev_owners.owner: Walters Plant Hire & James & Jean Potter

quotes.race: Coral Trophy Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've got no real faith in the runners at the moment just with how the form of the yard is. However, this lad stays forever. I was a bit worried down the back straight but when I saw Our Power turning in, I was quietly confident. He would have run in the Ladbrokes Trophy at Newbury but he had a little setback and we had no other option but to train him for this, which is a fantastic race itself. I'd say he would be doubtful to get in at Aintree so it will be Cheltenham for the Ultima then he will either go for the Scottish National or the bet365 Gold Cup - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: Bateaux London Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Our Power will never win by too far. He's your typical horse off the Flat - he's streetwise and is not ever going to over-exert himself. But he's genuine and we'll aim him at the Coral Gold Cup. We wouldn't have got in off a mark of 137 so he had to win. Fingers crossed that will sneak us in. You'd think a flat track like Newbury will suit him. Sam Thomas, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There was a lot of pace on (at Doncaster) and Our Power reached for the first but didn't quite get there. Sam (Thomas) had said he had been fantastic since and thankfully he was right. It was very tacky holding ground and I'd say he would get a bit further. He has a good way of racing as he doesn't use energy up and his jumping is getting better - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

quotes.race: St. James's Place Juvenile Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was slightly disappointed with Our Power at Exeter, but I think he's a better horse this way round; he went badly left at the first at Exeter, but we've done a lot of schooling since. That was much better and he probably outstayed the second. I'll speak to the owners but we might look at Cheltenham at the end of January. The Finale comes too soon and Wayne said he wouldn't want it any softer than today; he's handled it only just - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 10yo who has held his own in several top handicap chases, including third in the 4m Scottish National in April; fell early on Aintree reappearance, so his subsequent sixth of 12 at Ascot (3m5f, good) was effectively his first start of the campaign; entitled to strip fitter now and he has been given a bit of a chance by the handicapper.

stable_tour.quote: He had a nice prep run and then ran in the Coral Gold Cup. He was in a good rhythm and Adam Wedge was very happy with him before he fell - it was too far out to know how he would have fared. He came back sore from that and we're trying to get him back to 100 per cent before deciding on where to go next. I wouldn't have thought we'll be aiming him at the Grand National at the end of the season as he didn't quite get the trip last year. 05-01-24

runners.comment: Useful but he was miles behind Knappers Hill on last month's return from wind surgery
runners.name: Butch

quotes.race: On The Fourth Day Of Christmas Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very pleasing. Butch hasn't had a straightforward autumn and early part of the winter health-wise, so it's nice to get him back on track and he jumped well. Itchy Feet started off over fences here and then went for a Scilly Isles, but I'm not sure where this lad will go next. We'll take a look at the Scilly Isles or the Reynoldstown at Ascot before looking at some spring targets for him. He's a lovely horse and will be a brilliant staying chaser, and this was a great starting point - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Butch is a big shell of a horse and there is loads of improvement. I said to my assistant Ger (Tumelty) while watching it that I cannot wait until he jumps a fence next season. He has got a great attitude. I don't like talking horses up, but if they all had an attitude like he has then it would be great. There will be three horses in that race that will be graded horses in 12 months' time. He is obviously a real strong stayer that is a big honest horse by Kayf Tara, who is crying out for a fence. I will not bottom this horse, and he will come nowhere near this place in March, albeit he has a love for this place. He is a horse for next season and I don't know where the ceiling is. I will probably go to Haydock Park for the Rendlesham. As daft as it sounds that could be him. If he was to have a spring target you could potentially look at Aintree - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Weekend Free Bet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sean (Bowen) gave Butch a fantastic ride and he just had that little bit extra. We were the only one to have gone over three miles and I think that told in the end. I think they are two good horses, and we were giving the runner up three pounds. Credit goes to Olly (Murphy) and the team because last season this horse wasn't right, with ringworm and ulcers - Max McNeill, part owner.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Stallion Book Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and a nice starting point to the season. We've always liked Butch and it's great to get a little bit more experience into him before he loses his novice status. He's looked better the further he's gone. He stayed well on this first try over three miles and he's out of a real proper staying chaser pedigree. He's going to be a lovely staying chaser in time and he's one to hopefully look forward to as he'll handle proper winter conditions as well. We'll see what the handicapper does and then make a plan, but we'll get one more run in a nice novice hurdle somewhere and see what's what, and I'd imagine he'll go novice chasing - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Enjoy Food- The White Lion Weston "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Butch is a nice horse. He came back sick after his run at Chepstow, and Huntingdon was the wrong track for him. He wants a nice, big galloping track and is a staying chaser in the making. We'll look to get him out once more this season - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Quickly translated his useful hurdle ability to fences last winter, easily winning a three-runner novice at Leicester (2m4f, soft); however, he was a long way behind Knappers Hill when tailed-off last of five on last month's Haydock reappearance after wind surgery, leaving him with a bit to prove here.

stable_tour.quote: I struggled to keep him healthy last season and he burst blood vessels on a couple of occasions, but touch wood we've had a clean run with him so far. We might go to Haydock on Betfair Chase weekend for the graduation chase. 23-10-25

I've always thought a lot of him and we got him out early to get a bit more experience before he lost his novice status at the end of October. He won the three-mile novice hurdle at Cheltenham on Saturday and he now goes chasing as he's got chaser written all over him. 01-11-23

runners.comment: C&D winner; bolted up in Rehearsal at Newcastle last month and can make light of 10lb rise
runners.name: Konfusion

quotes.race: BetMGM Rehearsal Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Konfusion is a lovely horse and the soft ground has helped him. It was a bit of a freak at Haydock last week but it's kept him fresh and if he'd won that he wouldn't have run today so it's worked out - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Entertain In Style At Wetherby Racecourse Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Konfusion got a slight strain, nothing serious, which was why he's been off since Sedgefield and we hoped he'd be fit enough. He's a nice horse - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has advanced his form on all completed chase starts; won reappearance over C&D (good) in October and impressive 15l winner of the Rehearsal at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) on his completed start since; a further 10lb rise seems unlikely to stop this progressive 7yo from a yard in tremendous form.

14:10.race_name: William Hill Epic Boosts Daily Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won at Uttoxeter in July; not disgraced at Aintree last time; others have more potential
runners.name: Icare Allen

quotes.race: Norman Colfer Winning Fair Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Icare Allen jumped better today and was just a lot better than he was last time. He will go to Cheltenham but we have yet to make up our minds as to which race - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Not quite the force of old but he still won at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) in July and he wasn't disgraced when seventh of 12 at Aintree two months ago; not ruled out but others have more potential.

stable_tour.quote: It's a pity the three hurdles were taken out at Aintree on Saturday. They would have benefited him if they'd stayed in. I thought he ran well and I would imagine the Pertemps Final will be on his agenda. 13-11-23

runners.comment: Arrives on a hat-trick; commands major respect despite 7lb rise since latest win
runners.name: Glen Road

quotes.race: Boyle Sports Now Open In Wetherby Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Glen Road is probably a three-miler, that's why we made plenty of use of him. He did it nicely. He'll probably have a go at chasing but I'm not entirely convinced he's a chaser - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Thriving this season following wind surgery, winning over C&D and over 2m6f at Kelso on his last two starts, both on soft ground; a 7lb rise for his last success means another personal best is required but he keeps finding more and seems sure to go well.

runners.comment: Third to Glen Road at Kelso; 7lb better off with the winner but beginning to look exposed
runners.name: Malicash
runners.spotlight: Reliable type who performed up to his best when third to Glen Road at Kelso (2m6f, soft) three weeks ago; 7lb better off with the winner but beginning to look exposed, so first-time headgear needs to have a positive effect.

stable_tour.quote: It took him a while to get to grips with jumping but he ended up having a really good campaign. I think he'll get long distances over hurdles and could turn into a Pertemps horse. He has an engine. We had to back off him as he got cast in his box, but he's in really good nick now. 30-10-25

runners.comment: Has had excuses this season, out of handicap last time; quite interesting in tongue-strap
runners.name: Sunray Shadow
runners.owner: S T Racing - The Founders Syndicate

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sunray Shadow looks like a progressive horse. He's only a baby and wants plenty of time. He's a hard horse to assess and he's always keeping a bit back - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hasn't gone on from the smooth maiden win at Aintree (2m4f, good) in October 2024 but there have been excuses; 2m was probably too sharp on his reappearance and he was out of the handicap and in a stronger race than this when seventh of nine back at Aintree three weeks ago; still has potential and he's quite interesting with a tongue-strap fitted for the first time.

stable_tour.quote: Won a novice hurdle at Aintree last year but unfortunately got a problem later in the campaign and had some time off. He came back in looking bigger and stronger, and ran really well on his reappearance, just behind the principals in a handicap hurdle at Newbury. We'll look for another hurdle in a few weeks, although he has the option of going chasing at some stage. That latest run was a nice way into the season. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Fifth at Cheltenham when last seen but will need to be right at her best after long break
runners.name: Golden Glance

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Caroline Dingwall Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Golden Glance is an improving mare. She has form behind Greyval of Fergal O'Brien's - she was still a bit green that day and she's improved again today. She might go to Cheltenham for a mares' race - Henry Brooke, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Had some solid handicap form in 2023-24, including when fifth in a big field at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) on her final start, but she's been off since; will need to be right at her best to add to her sole win after such a long layoff.

runners.comment: 1-1 in points and has shown promise in maiden hurdles; this step up in trip should suit
runners.name: Daylatedollarshort
runners.spotlight: 1-1 in Irish points; clear promise in maiden hurdles at Plumpton and Bangor, one-paced each time; gets more of a test of stamina here and open to further improvement now tackling a handicap.

runners.comment: Three wins in recent weeks; back up in grade but hard to rule out in current form
runners.name: Be The Difference

quotes.race: AJA Membership Includes Insurance Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Qual')
quotes.quote: Shay [Halton] rides Be The Difference every day at home, so it was nice to give him a chance on him because he's not the easiest of rides. I told him not to be afraid to go on if they weren't going fast enough as he's a bit keen, but it turns out they've gifted him the race more or less. He wasn't going that fast - Phil Kirby, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 9yo with six wins to his name, three of them in recent weeks; justified favouritism at Sedgefield (2m5f, soft) three weeks ago in clearcut style; back up in grade and 8lb higher but hard to rule out in current form.

14:45.race_name: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Impressive chase debut success in February; goes well fresh and can follow up on return
runners.name: Big City Roller

quotes.race: Bangor-On-Dee Occasion Package Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've loved Big City Roller since I won on him over hurdles at Carlisle. Fair play to Charlie [Longsdon] for a great training performance - Lilly Pinchin, jockey.

quotes.race: Rhino.Bet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Big City Roller is a big galloping horse who just thrived off that ground. He's a nice prospect. Lilly Pinchin, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Point winner who made a successful hurdle debut in late 2023 and made an impressive winning start to his chase career in a Bangor handicap (2m4f, heavy) in February after 15 months off; absent since but evidently capable fresh and could still be ahead of his mark after an 8lb rise.

runners.comment: Good third on chase debut and subsequent Haydock fifth came in a warm race; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Gentleman Bill
runners.spotlight: Point, bumper and two-time hurdle winner who ran well when a clear third of six on chase/seasonal debut at Aintree (2m, good) in October; failed to build on that when last of five finishers over 2m at Haydock the following month but it was a strong handicap; cheekpieces are added now he's stepping back up in trip for a yard that looks to be finding good form again.

stable_tour.quote: A very nice horse who made a really pleasing chase debut at Aintree. He goes to Haydock on Saturday for a valuable handicap chase. He'll have come on plenty and will keep improving. He could have a nice pot in him - whether he's up to Cheltenham Festival level, we'll see. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Solid in-frame efforts both starts this term, latterly C&D; cheekpieces added; thereabouts
runners.name: Cerendipity
runners.spotlight: Consistent sort who won over 2m7f at Newcastle (good to soft) in March and has returned with solid in-frame efforts at Stratford and over C&D (soft); won't have to pull out much more in first-time cheekpieces for yard that continues to go well.

runners.comment: Progressive in first half of last term; makes belated return but could still have big say
runners.name: Get Up Mush

quotes.race: Glyn Hall Wealth Management Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Get Up Mush did it nicely. He was clever at his fences and got me out of trouble three out when we met it all wrong. He doesn't do much when he hits the front but hopefully he can keep going forward - Harry Skelton, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Get Up Mush made a really nice start then we found he had ulcers after his next run at Warwick. We treated them and he was a different horse. We won't overface him and we'll try to win a race under a penalty and then have an end-of-season target, possibly at Ayr. Then it will be chasing next season - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressed well over fences in the first half of last season, scoring three times between 2m4f and 3m1f on good/good to soft (also second on soft); not seen for 15 months but fitness isn't a big concern with this excellent yard.

runners.breeder: P Noue & S A R L Ecurie Silgezam
runners.comment: Third on chase debut in February but pulled up at Cartmel three months later and off since
runners.name: Great Pepper
runners.spotlight: Point winner who showed some spark when third on chase debut at Carlisle (2m, soft) this February but pulled up at Cartmel in May on sole run since and returns with something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: I love him, he's a little dude. He's not the biggest but he's really well put together. He's owned by Darren Mills Racing and he owned Rapid Flight, who we've just had to retire due to an injury he picked up in last season's Becher Chase. It's nice he's got another good horse. This one ran a little bit green when winning at Hexham and then won well enough at Kelso. He's a brilliant jumper, he's tough and he stays three miles all day long. He's peaking now and I'm really pleased with him. He's from the same family as Princess Zoe, so it's a lovely pedigree. He'll go to Haydock on Saturday for the Albert Bartlett trial, a race we won with Chief Dan George, and we'll dip our toe in the water to see where we are. He's got the entry in the main race at Cheltenham and will go there if he comes through his test at Haydock. There's a possibility we might look at the Sefton at Aintree, but it's one step at a time. He'll go chasing next season when his jumping will stand him in good stead. 14-02-24

runners.comment: Below par when last seen in July but won over C&D off 10lb higher last year; check betting
runners.name: Genois

quotes.race: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Genois had plenty of form and a good first run for Jonjo. He stepped up on that and it was a nice prize to win. He's so straightforward, you can do anything you want on him - Sean Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Livestream UK & Irish Racing On The App Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Genois is a nice horse. The nicer ground today suited him. He'll get further and we might end up going to Punchestown with him, but he's a real chaser down the line - Enda Bolger, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Out of sorts when last seen in the summer but the fact he won over C&D (good; also successful on soft) off 10lb higher last November makes him one to keep a close eye on in the betting for a yard back among the winners.

stable_tour.quote: For a £40,000 race it was probably a weak affair that he won at Wetherby on Friday, but he did it nicely and I'd imagine something like the Sir Peter O'Sullevan Memorial Handicap Chase at Newbury would suit him quite nicely. If he kept improving he might be a grand horse for the Topham in in the spring. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Taken well to chasing in recent weeks, including third in a handicap; tongue-tie added
runners.name: Joecooker
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner who has taken quite well to chasing in recent weeks, reaching the frame in 2m Carlisle maiden (soft) and 2m4f Newcastle handicap (good to soft); tongue tied first time, with Charlie Maggs taking a handy 5lb off.

stable_tour.quote: He won a Wexford bumper and was fourth over hurdles at Punchestown. He was bought to go chasing but should have a productive season as a hurdler. He's a big, strong horse who'll improve with time and hasn't shown his best yet. He has a very likeable attitude. 16-10-24

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Ma
runners.comment: Second in novice chase last Christmas but below par since; cheekpieces are added
runners.name: Abbeydale
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in a maiden hurdle in Ireland in March 2023; runner-up in a Leicester novice (2m4f, soft) last Christmas but hasn't come close to reproducing that, including on last month's 3m Bangor reappearance after wind surgery; has first-time cheekpieces added to his regular tongue-tie.

stable_tour.quote: It wasn't a bad maiden hurdle he won at Gowran and hopefully there might be more to come from him when he goes chasing. The last time you saw him at Naas it certainly wasn't his true form. 24-10-23

runners.comment: Good second over C&D last month but inconsistent and well held over 3m here since
runners.name: Geryville

quotes.race: William Hill B.O.G Is Back Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He likes it here. Geryville jumped well and travelled and it was our day today - Micky Hammond, trainer

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (Challenger Middle Distance Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We were just hoping for a nice run from Geryville. The ground has been so firm he hasn't been schooled over fences, he's just been over French-style hurdles on the all-weather. He jumped a bit big early on but hopefully he can win again-Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Course regular who ran well when second over C&D (soft) last month but he merely underlined his inconsistency when well held over 3m here since; much depends on what mood he's in.

runners.comment: Completed hat-trick in early 2024 but pulled up all three starts since
runners.name: William Of York

quotes.race: Mark Nield Wealth Management Go North Monet's Garden Series Final Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We always fancied William Of York as a chaser and just hope he gets three miles in time. He's not Third Time Lucki or Captain Chaos, but he's going the right way - you haven't seen the best of him yet and will improve. He'll come back to us for a good summer holiday too - Mike Newbould, owner.

runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick in early 2024 but has pulled up on all three outings since, so arrives with plenty to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He got a lot stronger last season and continued to improve as a chaser, ending up by winning the Monet's Garden Go North final at Carlisle. He jumps very well - he's bold and quick but very rarely gets one wrong - and will be entered for the Grand Sefton at Aintree. 16-10-24

15:20.race_name: William Hill Daily Bet Boosts Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Didn't get home at 2m4f on handicap debut; may well have more to offer down in trip/grade
runners.name: Avalon Beach

quotes.race: Canine Premier Flex Plus Joint Supplement Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Avalon Beach looks every inch a chaser in the making. It was his third run for us and all he's kept on doing is improving. He'll make a good chaser next season but he'll give us some good fun over hurdles first - Chris Grant, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Good-gound maiden winner at Sedgefield (2m1f) in November but he didn't get home over 2m4f on handicap debut there on soft last time; down in trip/grade and it's likely he has more to offer.

runners.comment: Useful Flat winner but ordinary form over hurdles; down in trip and cheekpieces back on
runners.name: Animato

quotes.race: Net World Sports 15th Anniversary Handicap
quotes.quote: Animato has his quirks but did it well the last day. I'd have liked to be handier today but he's got the talent and they went an honest gallop - Jason Watson, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Useful (at best) multiple Flat winner who ran respectably on first two outings over hurdles; hasn't matched that since but now back at 2m and may do better in handicaps; cheekpieces return to replace first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Plenty of chances since last win but running respectably in blinkers; claims down in grade
runners.name: Mojo Ego
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins; has had plenty of chances since last success in March 2024 but blinkers seem to have made a difference and his last run, when fourth of 12 at Aintree, threw up winners; player down in grade.

stable_tour.quote: He's a new horse from Highclere who starts next Sunday at Kempton. He's a juvenile hurdler who had a couple of runs in France over hurdles. He had some good Flat form for Jean-Claude Rouget and he goes nicely. 18-10-23

runners.comment: Hinted at ability over hurdles but ran out (hung left) on handicap debut; best watched
runners.name: Yapper Hill
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability on first three hurdle starts but hung left and ran out at Newcastle on handicap debut 15 days ago; probably one to watch this time.

runners.comment: Stepped up on reappearance when 6th on most recent start but needs a jump forward to win
runners.name: The Resdev Tyke
runners.spotlight: Stepped up from reappearance effort when sixth at Doncaster (2m3f) last month but needs to raise his game back at 2m if he's to figure.

runners.breeder: E A R L Patrick Jobert Et Al
runners.comment: May do better now handicapping but pedigree suggests he'll be suited by further
runners.name: King Horse
runners.spotlight: 0-3 in points and hasn't achieved much over hurdles; may do better now handicapping but pedigree suggests he may be suited by further.

runners.comment: Has not won since 2023; respectable effort last time but he's more of a place prospect
runners.name: Hourless
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner in 2023 but hasn't added to his tally; stepped up from Kelso run in November (first run since wind surgery) with a respectable effort over C&D last time; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Good-ground C&D winner; should appreciate the step into handicaps; one to keep an eye on
runners.name: Genbu
runners.spotlight: Good-ground C&D winner in October; below best on two of his next four outings but this step into handicaps should suit and stable is among the winners; one to keep an eye on.

stable_tour.quote: He was cheap and likes his jumping, although he was fortunate when he won at Wetherby last time. He's still got some learning to do. He's quite keen, so we put a tongue-tie on him there and he didn't jump very well - he'd jumped a lot better without it at Sedgefield, where he was allowed to make the running. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Moderate Flat maiden who turned in best effort over hurdles on handicap debut; interesting
runners.name: Toby Two Scoops
runners.spotlight: Moderate Flat maiden whose best effort over hurdles was when second on handicap debut at Sedgefield (soft); probably capable of better.

runners.comment: Posted best effort over hurdles over C&D in March; more needed on first run since
runners.name: Genies Girl
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on previous hurdle form when fourth over C&D (good) in March; off since and she'll have to raise her game if she's to register a first win.

runners.comment: Has won twice on the Flat but hasn't shown enough over hurdles to make him of interest
runners.name: Gold Ring
runners.spotlight: Low-grade performer on the Flat (has won twice) and over hurdles; soundly beaten in February when last seen and makes no appeal back at 2m; no cheekpieces this time.

13:12.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Promising 2yo; easy 6f win here 18 days ago; up 8lb but likely there is more in the tank
runners.name: Stratusnine
runners.spotlight: Promising as 2yo, including in one 7f run; absent for 402 days prior to his Newcastle reappearance last month; showed the benefit of that run when scampering clear in a 6f handicap here 18 days ago, a performance that was foretold by the betting; hit with an 8lb rise but unlikely we have seen the best of him just yet.

runners.comment: Had a good year and latest Lingfield third was another solid effort; in the mix once again
runners.name: Legal Reform
runners.spotlight: Four wins, three on Tapeta, in a productive 2025 campaign; another solid effort when third at Lingfield 23 days ago (Flag Of St George second); one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice horse who has not done a great deal wrong. He won at Southwell in the spring and was a little unfortunate not to win at Chester in the summer when a head second to Praxeology. He is a genuine horse who likes the all-weather surfaces and appreciates cut underfoot. There are several races coming up in the next few weeks but I am waiting for the softer ground. The only all-weather track I will try and avoid with him is Kempton as he did not appear to enjoy his run around there last month. I am sure he will pick up a race or two this winter 23-09-21

runners.comment: Closely matched with Legal Reform on a couple of formlines; should be involved again
runners.name: Flag Of St George
runners.spotlight: Chased home Legal Reform at Haydock in September but reversed those placings at Lingfield 23 days ago; still seeking a first AW win but likely to make another bold bid.

runners.comment: Good third over C&D last month but finished behind Flag Of St George last time
runners.name: Diamondonthehill
runners.spotlight: Not a prolific winner but he is back to his last winning mark and ran well over C&D on his penultimate start; not so good at Lingfield last time (behind Flag Of St George) and needs to bounce back to his best.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit frustrating because he's got a lot more ability than he cares to show. The race didn't really pan out and they didn't go quick enough for him at Haydock last time when he finished seventh of nine. On his previous start at Thirsk he travelled like the best horse. He moved into contention and I think he would have won if he'd just put his best foot forward, but he finished second, beaten a neck by Cerulean Bay. He has a lot of ability if he'd just use it all. He's entered at Thirsk on Friday. 28-08-24

runners.comment: Not seen to best effect last week but thriving beforehand and Billy Loughnane 4-6 on him
runners.name: Tribal Wisdom
runners.spotlight: Firmly on the up since a tongue-tie went on and last week's Newcastle fourth was in a race that didn't see him to best effect; he will need a good pace back at 7f but Billy Loughnane has ridden him six times, winning four and runner-up once.

runners.comment: 5.7f maiden winner at two; tailed off at Kempton in March; gelded since; tough mark
runners.name: Obsidian Dream
runners.spotlight: 5.7f maiden winner as a 2yo; seen only once this year, tailed off in a 1m conditions event at Kempton in March; had wind surgery in July; looks on a tough mark on this return.

13:50.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Nursery Handicap

runners.comment: Won debut before sixth of seven in the Group 3 Acomb; makes his yard/AW/nursery debut
runners.name: Sovereign Ocean

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Iain [Jardine, trainer] and I went over to Fairyhouse last September and we were looking for quick two-year-olds. Sovereign Ocean has just taken a bit longer. He's by Ten Sovereigns and even though he was a six-furlong horse, most of his progeny are seven furlongs to a mile, so we waited until today. He stayed on fantastically well and he's done it really nicely against some nice horses. I think that was a good race - Ian Jones, owner, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Overcame greenness to make a winning debut at Musselburgh (7f, good; 33-1) in July before sixth of seven in the Group 3 Acomb at York (7f, good to firm; pulled hard); has since left Iain Jardine having been purchased for 50,000gns and now makes his AW/nursery debut for his new stable; watch the betting.

stable_tour.quote: He went to Musselburgh for his debut and went off at 33-1 but we went there thinking he'd run well and we weren't surprised when he won. He wasn't showing us a lot at the start of the year but we were really chuffed with the way he was working before his first run and then he took a massive step forward. Going for the Acomb at York was a tough ask but we'd had an offer after his debut, which wasn't quite enough, and we were looking to increase his value. He'll have an entry in the horses in training sale. 10-09-25

runners.comment: Has progressed with each start and got off the mark at Southwell latest; nursery debut
runners.name: Heart Beats True
runners.spotlight: Progressed from her debut outing when runner-up behind a promising newcomer at Newcastle (7f, AW) before going one better at Southwell (7f, AW); now switches to nurseries and she's open to further improvement.

runners.comment: Runner-up in two starts on the AW since dropping back to 7f with blinkers on; contender
runners.name: Sovereign Wealth
runners.spotlight: Wasn't suited by the step up to 1m2f at Nottingham on nursery debut but he was back to form in first-time blinkers at Chelmsford (7f, AW), finishing second to a subsequent winner, and was beaten only a neck at Lingfield (7f, AW) 23 days ago; tongue-tie is now added and he's a contender.

runners.comment: Sprung a surprise on heavy ground at Salisbury in September; struggled on her h'cap debut
runners.name: Grimeses Special
runners.owner: J A Grimes, C Lacey, G Lacey & Partner
runners.spotlight: Sprung a surprise with her 66-1 win in a Salisbury seller (7f, heavy; first-time blinkers) in September but she failed to back that up in a nursery at Southwell (1m, AW) 84 days ago; off since and now drops back to 7f with a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Won on soft ground at Catterick; good run on stable debut latest; 7f isn't sure to suit
runners.name: Grey Horizon
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the eighth attempt when winning at Catterick (6f, soft; first-time visor) in October on his final start for Richard Fahey and ran well at Newcastle (6f, AW) a week ago on his stable debut, although he was no match for the winner; the step back up to 7f isn't sure to suit in this higher grade.

14:25.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Second on debut (6f) before a 5f novice win 17 days ago; respected despite penalty
runners.name: Dolos Dream
runners.spotlight: Confirmed the promise of her debut second at Newcastle (6f) last month when winning a 5f novice at Newcastle 17 days ago; that form has been boosted by the third; a contender despite her penalty.

runners.comment: Similar form in two novices (6f and 7f) this winter; needs more for the drop to 5f
runners.name: Five Cay
runners.spotlight: Similar form in a 6f novice at Newcastle and a 7f novice at Lingfield, finishing fourth in both; has a bigger performance in him but perhaps not at 5f.

runners.comment: 66-1 and well beaten on his Kempton debut 25 days ago (6f); gelded since; hard to fancy
runners.name: Pedros Dream
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and well beaten on his Kempton debut 25 days ago (6f); gelded since; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Poor form in two 5f novice runs this winter; drawn widest and makes no appeal
runners.name: Exhibition Match
runners.spotlight: Poor form in two 5f novice runs this winter; drawn widest and makes no appeal.

runners.comment: Consistent maiden; won't need much improvement for addition of blinkers to break her duck
runners.name: Green Dame
runners.spotlight: Hard to fault her consistency and she has run well over 6f at this track; good draw and strong claims with blinkers now joining the tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Did a lot wrong at Southwell and ran on for a promising 4th; open to plenty of improvement
runners.name: Harmonised
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly; did a lot wrong on her Southwell debut (5f) five weeks ago, missing the break, taking a fierce hold early and looking green through the race, but she still ran on to take fourth having met some trouble in running; could leave that run well behind her today.

runners.comment: Exposed 13-race maiden; will need others to underperform if she is to win
runners.name: Havin A Flyer
runners.spotlight: Exposed 13-race maiden; no problem with the conditions but she will either need a big surge of improvement, or several of these to underperform, if she is to make it 14th-time lucky.

runners.comment: Poor form in two fillies' events over further; no appeal
runners.name: Miss Magic Dragon
runners.spotlight: Poor form in two fillies' events over further; no appeal.

runners.comment: Finished last in two runs in the summer (5f/6f); stable second string here
runners.name: Rai Rogers
runners.spotlight: Finished last in a 5f maiden and a 6f novice in the summer; hard to fancy back from a 197-day break; stable also runs Dolos Dream.

runners.comment: 2nd in two runs in June, behind a useful filly last time; absent six months but unexposed
runners.name: Shes Divine
runners.spotlight: Second in two small-field events in June over 6f here on debut and 5f at Carlisle two weeks later; the second run was behind a useful opponent and she remains capable of better; back from six months off, market can guide.

15:00.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap

runners.comment: Hit hard for his C&D win last month; one good run and one lesser effort have followed
runners.name: Beaumadier

prev_owners.owner: Paul Cullen & Joseph E Keeling & E J Dwyer & M C Grassick

runners.spotlight: Everything went like clockwork when winning easily over C&D last month and he made a bold bid to defy his 10lb higher mark at Lingfield on December 3rd; only fifth at Southwell two weeks ago, however, and he needs another career best.

runners.comment: In the money on last two starts; returning to 5f no issue; more appealing than many
runners.name: El Bufalo
runners.spotlight: Solid efforts for his new yard on last two starts, second of 11 at Lingfield last month when wearing cheekpieces for the first time; returning to 5f shouldn't harm his prospects; contender.

runners.comment: Thriving filly with conditions to suit; up in the weights but tops the list
runners.name: Hint Of Humour
runners.spotlight: Thriving filly who has been first past the post on her last four starts (disqualified on penultimate run); 3lb higher than for the latest but well drawn and should get a good tow into this; tops the list.

runners.comment: Beat subsequent winner at Lingfield latest (6f); probably well in but has the widest stall
runners.name: Lazzar
runners.spotlight: Bled from the nose when flopping as favourite here (6f) in October; 2lb higher that day and has since won a small-field novice at Lingfield; it's likely he is favourably treated but he will need to be to defy the widest stall.

runners.comment: Creditable 3rd in the circumstances on Monday; drawn wider than ideal now back up in class
runners.name: Level Up
runners.spotlight: On a good mark now and he ran a creditable race at Lingfield on Monday given the blindfold was slow to be removed; this looks a stronger race though and he is drawn wider than ideal.

runners.comment: Has low mileage; made all at Nottingham in October; more to come and well drawn to attack
runners.name: Westgate Warrior
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 3yo; made all in a 5f Class 6 handicap at Nottingham in October and although he wasn't so good back there two weeks later, the ground was testing; shaped well in his only AW start, in the spring; one to consider from a handy draw.

runners.comment: 11-race maiden; has shown promise over C&D but needs to find more to break her duck
runners.name: Peregrine Falcon
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; effective over C&D but she finished behind reopposing rivals here on her last two starts; others are more appealing.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit; recent efforts haven't been his best but the handicapper is helping
runners.name: Phoenix Beach
runners.spotlight: Well suited by the conditions and he has quickly dropped back down the weights after some lesser efforts; has won for today's rider Mikkel Mortensen and can't be discounted; stable also runs Candy Warhol.

runners.comment: On a good mark and this C&D winner may have been freshened up by a three-month break
runners.name: Catch Cunningham

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly/EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That wasn't ideal. We wanted to take a lead but Catch Cunningham jumped well and no-one wanted to go on. We reverted to plan B and that's hard to do here. But he's very game and genuine. He'll be better in a better race -  Kevin Ryan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hold-up sprinter; several good runs this year, including over C&D, but his form cooled when last seen; it's possible he will have been freshened up by a three-month break and he is on a dangerous mark; will need luck in running from stall 1 though.

stable_tour.quote: He's fast and extremely genuine. He ran well first time out and will go for the five-furlong handicap at York, though he'll get six. 10-05-22

runners.comment: Conditions suit and he's been in form; 2lb higher than for latest 2nd and in a better race
runners.name: Candy Warhol
runners.owner: Homecroft Wealth, Paul J Dixon & Partners
runners.spotlight: Three course wins this year, the latest over this trip in June; two placed efforts over C&D following a wind operation in October; 2lb higher than for the latest and this is a stronger race too; stable runs two.

15:35.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Easy winner of this race last year; absent since May but can go well fresh; contender
runners.name: Paradias

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: We're not going to give hurdles another go at the moment. There are two pretty valuable mile-and-a-half handicaps coming up, the first of which is in about a month's time, so we'll look at those. It was a lovely performance. I'm delighted with Paradias and I don't know why he's not run on the all-weather until recently, but we tested the waters last time and that was strong form, so we thought we'd roll the dice again. He's not been over raced and he's learning to relax better. The step up in trip has helped him too - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Readily accounted for his five rivals in this race last year (4lb lower mark) before a hard-fought success at Kempton off today's mark in January; solid efforts in defeat on his next three runs; absent since May but has gone well fresh in the past.

stable_tour.quote: He had a good summer on the Flat, winning at Goodwood and finishing second at Epsom, and has a very workable mark back over hurdles so could be interesting. He won't want any further than two miles and he'll handle good to soft ground but not heavy. 25-10-24

He could be interesting in handicap hurdles. He had a good summer on the Flat, winning at Goodwood and finishing second at Epsom, and has a very workable mark. He won't want any further than 2m and he'll handle good to soft ground but not heavy. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Won at this fixture (9.5f) in 2023 and 2024; arrives in fine form but the trip is a query
runners.name: Kings Code

quotes.race: Unibet London Middle Distance Series (Final) Handicap (Qualified Horses Only) (GBBPlus)
quotes.quote: King's Cove was qualified and those finals are good races to have because I wouldn't win many £80,000 handicaps. There was prize-money down to sixth, so I thought he'd get some of it. He's had a fair few runs and he's had a bit of a break, but he came back and won at the track last month, and his last three races have been good. He likes the all-weather - he prefers that to the grass - so we might get him back out in two or three weeks - David Evans, trainer.King's Cove was tough. He jumped good and I didn't really want to lead but I felt like I had the race in control from where I was. It took a while to build him up but once he got his head down and the more I asked him, the more grit he showed me - Neil Callan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Mitchell & Co. Building Services Handicap
quotes.quote: King's Code is a big lad and, with the ground as quick as it was, I thought he might struggle a bit, which he did early doors. The cheekpieces helped him concentrate, the penny dropped late and he closed really well - Sean Levey, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Now rated too highly to bid for his hat-trick in the 9.5f Class 3 handicap on the card (4.35) and his stamina for this trip is still not fully established; he comes here having been in peak form though and a tactical affair at Lingfield 11 days ago didn't see him to best effect.

runners.comment: 6-8 over C&D; arrives on the back of a win; only 4th behind Paradias in this race in 2024
runners.name: Haku

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Tools At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Haku is a legend, he's gone up through the ranks and he always gives his all. He's a favourite in the yard and it's great that he can come and do his job here - Mark Loughnane, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Ten-time winner over this trip on AW, including 6-8 over C&D; one of the defeats was when only fourth behind Paradias in this 12 months ago and this 6yo is 6lb higher this time around; on the plus side, he has won three times since, including a hard-fought Southwell win four weeks ago; should go well.

runners.comment: Improved for step up to this trip at Lingfield nine days ago; not well in, but respected
runners.name: Brasil Power

quotes.race: Unibet More Boosts In More Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Brasil Power was drawn 13 and George Boughey left it up to me. It was only in the stalls that I decided to drop him in and I'm surprised how quickly he got to the front. He's obviously a horse with ability and he likes the AW. It was a good performance - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Most of his racing has been over shorter trips but he is 2-5 at 1m2f+ and stepping up to 1m4f for the first time saw him record a personal best RPR when winning at Lingfield nine days ago; 6lb higher today (2lb wrong) but it is easy enough to envisage further progress at the distance.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fun horse who could go to the All-Weather Championship Finals day. He's on a workable mark at the moment and I think he could be some fun through the summer. 07-04-25

runners.comment: Can go well fresh but looks high in the weights on this rare AW run
runners.name: Knightswood
runners.spotlight: Goes well fresh so a 200-day absence since his Pontefract win in June (1m4f, good) is not necessarily an issue; this is his first AW start since December 2022 and he's perhaps a shade high in the weights.

runners.comment: Impressed on AW debut last month; up 7lb but should have more to come over 1m4f
runners.name: Aeolian
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 3yo; made debut in July and has won two of her six starts, taking well to the AW with her ready Kempton success last month (1m3f); up 7lb but could well have more to offer on AW and this extra furlong should suit too.

16:05.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Effective over C&D, on a fair mark and dropping back down in class; contender
runners.name: Powdering
runners.spotlight: Three wins this year and she has also run well in defeat over C&D; drops back down in class today and a big run should be forthcoming.

runners.comment: Fine course record and arrives chasing a five-timer; high on the list
runners.name: Maris Angel
runners.spotlight: The winner of six of her seven handicap runs here, including her last four starts; beat Court Drive by just under 1l last time but that was in spite of a wide trip and racing too freely; up another 4lb but likely to make a bold bid.

runners.comment: Conditions no problem and this race is easier than her latest; each-way claims
runners.name: Queue Dos
