runners.spotlight: 7f win here in September off a 3lb lower mark; good run at Lingfield on her penultimate start and defeat here last time came in a good race against male opposition; this should be more suitable; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: She's for the same owners as Queues Likely and I think she's going to be very good. I think she'll definitely end up a black-type filly, most likely over a mile or seven furlongs. I was pleased with the way she ran at Bath because I thought she'd run a nice race as she'd been working lovely at home. Her half-brother was second in the Brocklesby and was sold to America straight away after that. He has run well in a big race in America and it's going to end up quite a nice page. She's got the size and scope. 04-07-24

runners.comment: Better known for 5f exploits; solid 3rd against males latest; others appeal more
runners.name: Secret Mistral

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: All year Secret Mistral has had bad draws. Today was a perfect draw but she ended up jumping a bit slow. I had a nice position just behind the leaders and she dug deep - Jack Doughty, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Stays this far but better known for her 5f exploits; creditable third against male opposition 11 days ago; others appeal more for the win.

runners.comment: Two promising runs here this month (6f/7f); respected despite the widest stall
runners.name: Lady Wingalong
runners.spotlight: Finished third to Maris Angel and Court Drive over C&D on December 1, coming from off the pace; another solid effort over 7f here 11 days ago and dropping back in trip won't hurt; wide stall but she has the ability to feature.

runners.comment: Latest front-running third (7f) was better; dangerous mark if building on it back at 6f
runners.name: Searchingtheblues
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly over 7f but latest effort, when a resurgent third here, suggests this return to 6f is worth exploring; 0-6 since winning her first two starts but is on an attractive mark.

runners.comment: Two good 7f runs here for her new stable; should be in the thick of it back at 6f
runners.name: Bella Bisbee
runners.spotlight: Two runs for her new stable, both over 7f here, have yielded a win and a second; should be fine back at 6f, still has handicapping scope and likely to be in the thick of it again.

runners.comment: Solid runner-up efforts on last two starts; should give her running once again
runners.name: Court Drive
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who has been knocking on the door at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) and over C&D (behind Maris Angel) in her last two starts; nudged up another 1lb but there's no obvious reason why she wouldn't go well again.

stable_tour.quote: She won at 50-1 on her first run at Wolverhampton, over 7f, in early April. I paid very little money for her but I just liked her as she was walking around the paddock. She had a little bit of an ugly right-handed ankle but that didn't bother me as I bought her off my own bat and turned her out for two months. She has very good owners in Premier Racing, who own 60 per cent of her with two of my other owners. They've had five horses with me and they've all won- three of them, including her, won first time out. The thing is that by winning first time out the handicapper will take a dim view of that, so my view, like my dad's, is that you're better off going to a decent fillies' race, so we ran her in a 6f Listed race at Chelmsford last week. 08-05-24

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Saint-Vincent & E A R
runners.comment: On a winning mark but below her best of late and others arrive with less to prove
runners.name: Mersea

quotes.race: Fred Says Don't Fall 80th Birthday Handicap
quotes.quote: We loved Mersea at two and she got a little bit of an injury at York when she was giving weight to The Platinum Queen. She wasn't training with her usual exuberance earlier on in the year so we've been patient. We could see her drop back to five furlongs as she did everything wrong today - Sam's instructions were to sit fourth or fifth but he couldn't! I've got her pencilled in to return to Carlisle for a five-furlong race on September 1. I think she'll win again before the end of the year - Nick Bradley.

quotes.race: No.1 York By Guesthouse Hotels British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mersea's attitude is probably her best attribute and she was never going to be beaten, I always had my rivals measure. It's so impressive she's that tough, especially as a juvenile - Sam James, jockey

runners.spotlight: Back to her last winning mark today but well beaten in her three runs back from a short break; others arrive with less to prove.

stable_tour.quote: A horse we bought off Nick [Bradley] as we thought there were more races in her and she's won twice this year. She won at 50-1 at Newcastle over 6f in February after a break and at Musselburgh over 5f last month. I think 6f is more her trip and she'll be running through the rest of the turf season and on to the all-weather. 04-09-25

16:35.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Won here over 8.6f in October; did best of those held up at Kempton last time
runners.name: Unassuming

quotes.race: Paul Corrigan Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Unassuming could get an entry in the Kensington Palace at Royal Ascot. I'm not sure if she will get in, but with a penalty she might. She's a filly who has done well off a break and it was her first try on turf for us. I'm delighted to get her back in the winner's circle. She's a pretty easy horse to train, she makes my life easier and is going the right way. She travels very strongly and will be suited to turf racing way better than the all-weather - George Boughey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: All five wins achieved since last September, the latest coming here in October over 8.6f off an 8lb lower mark than today's; beaten a nose at Newcastle (1m, AW; 3l clear of third) last month and did best of those from off the pace at Kempton nine days ago; solid claims if the return to this longer trip doesn't count against her (yet to prove herself fully over this far).

runners.comment: Ran well at Chelmsford but he didn't beat a rival at Lingfield on latest; visor now tried
runners.name: Whitcombe Rockstar

quotes.race: Unibet Support Safe Gambling Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Last week we had a bad draw and they didn't go very quick but he appreciated the stronger gallop here. I think Whitcombe Rockstar could be a better horse on turf with some cut in the ground - Josephine Gordon, winning jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet More Boosts In More Races Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile & London Mile Series Qual')
quotes.quote: I think Whitcombe Rockstar is going to be better again on turf and last year he was probably a bit weak. He's quite a big horse but he's obviously grown up and has come on a ton - Josephine Gordon, jockey, taking to RTV.

runners.spotlight: All five of his wins on the AW have come over 1m at Kempton and he's now 4lb lower than the most recent of those; ran well at Chelmsford last month, despite hanging left, but he failed to beat any of his five rivals at Lingfield (1m2f; first-time cheekpieces) 11 days ago; visor now tried.

runners.comment: Six-time AW winner but he was well beaten following a break latest; trip's a question mark
runners.name: Bravo Zulu
runners.spotlight: Has scored six times on the AW and exploited his lower turf mark with wins at Doncaster and Windsor in the summer; may have needed the run when last of 12 on his first start for 116 days at Kempton (1m, AW) nine days ago but he's yet to prove effective over quite this far; cheekpieces discarded.

stable_tour.quote: He went to Newmarket recently as something of a big hope, but it was his first run on turf and the ground was holding, while Richard Kingscote thought he was very green about it all. He thought he'd come on mentally for that, while he's got a great action so probably wants the top side of good ground. He works like a good horse and I'd like to think he could be a Royal Ascot horse for the Britannia or Golden Gates Stakes. We'll aim for a mile race on fast ground before that and he's quite similar in terms of ability to Outgate, who was a star for us before being sold to Hong Kong. 02-05-24

runners.comment: Gained his first win for this yard over C&D 13 days ago (third has won since); 3lb higher
runners.name: Zryan
runners.spotlight: Won twice in France and gained his first success for this stable when landing a C&D handicap 13 days ago; steps up in grade but the third has won since so he holds solid claims off this 3lb higher mark.

runners.comment: Returned to form here last time following two lesser runs on turf; fourth behind Zryan
runners.name: Arcadian Nights

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Arcadian Nights has got form with a lot of the horses he was taking on. His only quirk is in the stalls and he was a bit slow getting out but he found the prominent rhythm and has a good turn of foot - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Ten-time AW winner who completed the final leg of a hat-trick over C&D in March; ran a lot better returned to the AW 13 days ago following two lesser efforts on turf, finishing fourth behind Zryan over C&D; each-way contender.

runners.comment: Readily gained first AW win last week; up in grade but 3lb well-in under a penalty
runners.name: Parlando

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a really nice performance by Parlando on debut, it's pretty soft ground out there but he saw it out well to the line - William Buick, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Caught the eye of the stewards here over slightly shorter last month and he was strong in the betting when readily gaining his first AW win at Chelmsford (1m2f) eight days ago; back up in grade but he still looks nicely treated under a 5lb penalty (due to be 3lb higher).

runners.comment: Won here over 1m4f and at Ascot over 1m6f; off since July; likely to find this too sharp
runners.name: Trojan Storm

quotes.race: King Edward VII Ascot Membership Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: We ran Trojan Storm yesterday but he walked out of his box this morning and he'd eaten up and trotted up really well, he was happy and relaxed so we thought we'd let him take his chance. The step up in trip has really benefited him - Ian Williams, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won here over 1m4f in February and added to that success over 1m6f at Ascot 167 days ago; absent since and he's likely to find this trip too sharp on his switch back to the AW.

17:05.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Just held on from fast-finishing favourite at Southwell; highly respected under penalty
runners.name: Hackney Diamonds

quotes.race: Enterprising Women Eileen & Jean Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Hackney Diamonds broke smartly and the tailwind behind us took me through the last furlong. I felt like I was on fumes but she was tough and managed to fend them off - Billy Loughnane, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Posted some good efforts here (7f-1m4f) before a lesser run this month, but she bounced back when narrowly holding on at Southwell (1m3f, AW) eight days ago to land her first AW success; 2lb wrong under a penalty but she's highly respected.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; beaten neck at Southwell in September but he was below his best on latest
runners.name: Back From Dubai

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports Injury Time Loser Insurance Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Back From Dubai broke well and I just let him use his stride and he's toughed it out to the line - Jordan Williams, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, most recently in May off a 2lb lower mark; best effort this year came when beaten a neck at Southwell (1m, AW) in September before a below-par effort over same C&D 56 days ago; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Dual turf winner in Ireland at 1m1f; disappointing stable debut and did not build on that
runners.name: Silkies Sib
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on turf in Ireland over 1m1f; caught wide when disappointing at Southwell (1m3f) on stable debut but he wasn't able to build on that at Lingfield (1m2f) 18 days ago; dropped another 2lb.

runners.comment: Won a classified event at Ffos Las in August; respectable run over this C&D 32 days ago
runners.name: Fifty Sent
runners.spotlight: Won a classified event at Ffos Las (1m, soft) in August on his second start for this yard; lesser effort at Southwell in October but he ran respectably over this C&D 32 days ago; place chance.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival home on her handicap debut (1m6f); wind surgery ahead of yard debut
runners.name: Petra Grey
runners.spotlight: Beaten 12l or more at big prices in three qualifying runs (7f-1m2f) and she failed to beat a rival when upped to 1m6f on her handicap debut at Southwell 57 days ago; has since left Ollie Sangster and drops back in distance having undergone wind surgery.

runners.comment: 1-13; caught the eye on her stable debut here over 7f but well held over this C&D
runners.name: Scenario
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 13 starts came at Lingfield (7f, good to soft) in July; caught the eye when a close third on her stable debut here over 7f last month but she was well held over C&D 32 days ago; may bounce back.

runners.comment: 0-18; second at Nottingham in July but well beaten there last time; back on the AW
runners.name: Bondi Man
runners.spotlight: 6yo who is an 18-race maiden; second at Nottingham (1m2f, good to soft) in July and ran respectably over this C&D in October, but he was well beaten at Nottingham (1m2f, soft) last time; back on the AW.

runners.breeder: R C Dollar & Hellwood Stud Farm
runners.comment: Six-time course winner; struggled in recent starts but she was caught wide last time
runners.name: Port Noir
runners.spotlight: Six course wins over 6f-9.4f and she's now 6lb lower than for the latest in October last year; has struggled in recent starts, albeit caught wide here last time; others preferred.

runners.comment: Unplaced in all ten starts but her best efforts have been at this track; each-way claims
runners.name: Keep Talking
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all ten starts but her best efforts have been at this track, including when a keeping-on fifth 20 days ago; each-way claims back up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: She's starting to show up nicely at home. I think Mohaather will be a nice sire but I think they'll all need seven furlongs to a mile. Dane O'Neill said Mohaather and Battaash were two of the best horses he ever sat on. He hasn't hit the ground running, but I think this stallion will come good in the second half of the year. 04-07-24

17:35.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: 2-33; ran with credit when fourth in first-time cheekpieces at Kempton; each-way claims
runners.name: Law Supreme
runners.spotlight: Two wins from 33 starts; ran with credit when fourth of ten in first-time cheekpieces at Kempton (1m)  this month and the winner has gone in again since; each-way chance down in class.

runners.comment: 0-16 but he's been shaping quite well for this yard; unlucky not to go closer last time
runners.name: Warrnambool
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden but he's been shaping quite well at Lingfield since joining this yard; caught the eye finishing well there over 1m2f on his penultimate run and he was denied a clear run at a crucial stage of the race last time; returns to a slightly longer trip and he's interesting from a career-low mark.

runners.comment: 0-6 for William Haggas but ran well when last seen; steps up in trip on her stable debut
runners.name: Seconds Count
runners.spotlight: 0-6 for William Haggas but she ran well here over 8.6f when last seen 81 days ago, shaping as if this longer trip would suit; has since switched yards having been bought for 6,000gns and she's worth a market check.

runners.comment: Shaped well over 7f at Kempton on his stable; should be suited by the return to this trip
runners.name: Galaxy Wonder
runners.spotlight: Made all at Ballinrobe (9.5f; visored for the first time) in July and shaped well at Kempton (7f, AW) on his stable debut 16 days ago; the return to this trip should suit and he's a leading contender.

runners.comment: Sole win came in a C&D classified event; may have needed the run when seventh here latest
runners.name: Desiderata

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's Desiderata's first run for us. We worked him up in Lambourn in the week and he went very well with a 60-rated horse so we expected him to run a nice race - Thomas Faulkner, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Sole win from 12 starts came in a classified event over this C&D in January on stable debut; has posted a couple of fair efforts since but he has also refused to race on one occasion; weakened here last time but he may well come on for that first outing in 220 days.

runners.comment: 0-27 but he went close here last month and his last two efforts have been solid
runners.name: Rampant
runners.spotlight: 27-race maiden but he went close here over 1m4f last month and has posted solid efforts on his last couple of outings; should give another good account, back down in trip.

runners.comment: Course winner over 1m4f in 2023; below his best in three starts since a break
runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.spotlight: Course winner over 1m4f in 2023; placed here twice in June but he's been below his best in three starts since returning from a break; cheekpieces return.

runners.comment: 0-16 but fourth on her last three outings, including over C&D latest; e-w chance
runners.name: Spinning Dancer
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 16 starts but she's finished fourth on her last three starts, including over C&D 25 days ago; place claims.

runners.comment: 0-7; yet to built on his handicap debut effort; up in trip with cheekpieces removed
runners.name: Sold Out
runners.spotlight: Beaten 4.5l at Newcastle (7f, AW) on his handicap debut but he's not gone on from that in three starts since; cheekpieces (worn on his last two starts) are discarded now back up in trip.

12:53.race_name: pricedup.bet EBF Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Mares' Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Unable to land any sort of blow on either run for new stable this autumn (2m4f/3m)
runners.name: Popova

quotes.race: Kerry Group Irish EBF Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: Popova is a nice mare and stepped forward from the last day. She battled well to the line. She travelled much better today and stuck at it well - Rachael Blackmore, rider

runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler/chaser in Ireland for Henry De Bromhead but unable to land any sort of blow on either run for new stable this autumn (2m4f/3m).

runners.comment: Off since second on chasing debut last autumn but could still have significant potential
runners.name: Alfies Princess

quotes.race: Chepstow Construction Equipment EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' Series) (GBB)
quotes.quote: March is a million miles away but we'll take it one step at a time. We learnt a lot about Alfie's Princess last season in terms of conditions and she certainly handles this ground going forward. I look at the way Love Envoi did it and think we could plot our way through the season like that. She should improve enormously for this run - Sam Thomas, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Promising novice hurdler in 2023-24 season and a creditable second on chasing debut at Ffos Las (2m5f, good to soft) last autumn; has fitness to prove after 439-day absence but could still have significant potential.

stable_tour.quote: She's got plenty of ability and won her first two starts this season at Chepstow and Exeter. I was then slightly disappointed with her last run at Haydock, where she finished fifth. They went really quickly and I think we rode her a little bit wrong. She probably wants a little bit further and we'll ride her more patiently next time. 05-01-24

runners.comment: Held on well to win over 2m on seasonal/chase debut and can improve over 2m4f
runners.name: Blacksamssenorita
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who held on well to make winning seasonal/chase debut at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) six weeks ago; will be suited by the less testing ground here and her pedigree offers significant hope she can improve over the longer trip.

stable_tour.quote: She won a novice hurdle at Exeter at the end of last season and gets all the bonuses, which is good. We'll head to Uttoxeter next for a mares' handicap over fences. That's a qualifier for the Queen Boudicca, which could be an option. She jumps well enough even if she isn't the biggest. I think she's still on a nice mark. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Did not get competitive on either hurdle run this autumn; now makes her chasing debut
runners.name: Sams Amour
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner (2m2f-2m5f; good/good to soft); did not get competitive on either appearance this autumn and needs a much more dynamic performance on this chasing debut.

runners.comment: Creditable second on last month's British chase debut at Exeter; must be considered
runners.name: Clotilda

prev_owners.owner: Mme H Devin, Mme Geraldine Reille-Villedey & Butel & Beaunez

quotes.race: Trustatrader Fully Vetted Tradespeople Juvenile Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We expected Clotilda to win and we'll go to Taunton on the 30th either for a juvenile hurdle or a fillies' race. She should give her owner some good fun through the winter. She'll gallop all day, loves the mud and she'll get further as well. She'd been jumping fences and doing all sorts before we got her, so we had to get her jumping a bit sharper. She'll be better in a race where they go flat out and she can follow them rather than lead as well - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made solid start to chasing career in France last year and returned to fences with creditable second at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) last month; could still have a bigger run in her; must be considered.

stable_tour.quote: Having arrived from France just over a year ago she seemed to take the whole season to acclimatise properly. She failed to progress for several outings, and as a result her rating fell from 127, which was way too high, to 114, when she put up easily her best effort in a Grade 3 mares' handicap at Cheltenham. She needed the run quite badly on her return when down the field at Chepstow last month; a year ago she came from France all lean and light, but this autumn it's taken an age to get the weight off her and she still needed it at Newton Abbot last week. The plan is to switch back to fences [she ran three times over them in France] I'm keen to use her four-year-old and fillies' allowance in a novice handicap chase as she will look attractively weighted. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Front-runs; won this in 2024 and reverts to chasing after a decent hurdle run last month
runners.name: Another Day Out
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins, the latest in this race one year ago (good to soft); ran quite well over hurdles at Ascot (3m, good to soft) last month and switches back to fences on a good mark; can make a bold bid from the front.

runners.comment: Suffered heavy defeat on last month's chasing debut and has lots more to prove than some
runners.name: Asian Spice
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles towards the end of last year (2m2f/2m) but has lost her way since and suffered a heavy defeat on last month's chasing debut at Warwick (2m4f, good); others have much less to prove.

13:28.race_name: PricedUp The Jumps Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Listed bumper winner; clear second in that grade on seasonal/hurdle debut; hard to beat
runners.name: Charisma Cat

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charisma Cat didn't seem to handle the bends very well, but she has come back on the bridle. She wouldn't want this ground as it is hard work on the hurdle track. We all felt the one at Market Rasen was one that got away, but she didn't handle the track at all. She got shuffled well back, but she would have won in another couple of strides. We made up for it today, and we got a win, and some black type. If we are happy she will go to Aintree - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 3-5 in bumpers last season, with latest win gained in Listed event at Sandown (good to soft); clear second in Listed novice hurdle at Newbury (2m, soft) on return last month and ought to be very hard to beat.

stable_tour.quote: She's a homebred of the Waley-Cohen family, by Nathaniel, who's one of the most exciting stallions out there, and she won well at Southwell in the summer. She had a break but has come back into strong work and will have another run in a bumper, but we definitely think she's above average. 25-10-24

She's a homebred of the Waley-Cohen family, by Nathaniel who's one of the most exciting stallions out there, and won well at Southwell in the summer. She had a break but has come back into strong work and will have another run in a bumper but we definitely think she's above average. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Low-grade Flat winner; safely held when fourth over C&D on recent stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Innisfree Pearl
runners.spotlight: Won off a lowly Flat mark for Tom Ward in September (1m4f, soft; RPR 57) but was safely held when fourth of seven over C&D (good) on last month's stable/hurdle debut; yard has much stronger claims with Charisma Cat.

runners.comment: Placed in three Irish bumpers; also showed clear promise in three maiden hurdles; new yard
runners.name: Lau And Shaz
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo who was placed in three bumpers last season and also showed significant promise in three maiden hurdles (2m-2m4f); seems quite versatile regarding ground and has a part to play on this stable debut.

runners.comment: Ran well when second of five on recent hurdle debut but has quite a bit to find here
runners.name: Pollyannas Dream
runners.spotlight: Placed in two bumpers last season (one here) and also ran well when second of five on recent hurdle debut at Fontwell (2m3f, heavy) but will find easier opportunities than this in due course.

runners.comment: Just a respectable third in a run-of-the-mill bumper last December; now with new stable
runners.name: Wassailing Along
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to stable's smart jumper Bob Bob Bobbin; just a respectable third in run-of-the-mill Fontwell bumper (heavy) for Anthony Honeyball last December; makes stable/hurdle debut after one-year layoff.

stable_tour.quote: She was third for Anthony Honeyball in a bumper at Ffos Las in December. She's got a big, round action so will want a bit of soft ground. She goes well at home, doing everything we've asked of her. 12-11-25

14:03.race_name: Happy Birthday Racing Blogger Handicap Chase (For The Lord Stalbridge Cup) (Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.comment: Useful hurdler; steps up in trip after satisfactory chase debut over 2m3f
runners.name: Saint Anapolino
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler at up to 2m5f who made a satisfactory start to chasing career when third of six at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) three weeks ago; will need to build on that performance but the step up in trip is an interesting move.

stable_tour.quote: He was a bit disappointing at Kempton last time - he didn't jump as well as he can. He seems to plug on well at the end so we could look at going over slightly further or possibly switch to fences. We need to get him back on track before we start thinking about what's next. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Inconsistent over hurdles and made a low-key chase debut; cheekpieces on; hard to predict
runners.name: Go To War

quotes.race: Balfours Llp And Lycetts Insurance Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: The wind-op has definitely helped. Go To War came under pressure a little bit sooner the last day, but today he travelled, jumped well and I was very pleased with him. The way he did it from the second-last was very good - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well handicapped if judged on best two of four hurdle runs last season but his record is very mixed and he made a low-key chasing debut when fifth at Kempton (3m, good) last month; sports first-time cheekpieces; still very unexposed as a stayer but not easy to predict; tongue-tie removed.

stable_tour.quote: He won two hurdle races the season before last but then found it quite hard last season, although he was always threatening. We thought he'd go well on his last run at Newbury but he finished lame and we found he had a fracture in his near-fore joint. He's well now though, and will likely go novice chasing. He stays well. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Low-mileage 6yo who held on well to score on seasonal/chase debut at Taunton last month
runners.name: Wicked Thoughts

quotes.race: Howden Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Wicked Thoughts liked that back down in trip and, like a few of ours, he wasn't quite right before, but he looked great in his coat. He's not a big, heavy horse, but he skipped off that ground and he loved it. He jumped really well. His form at Exeter on fast ground, when he gave weight away to Nicky's [Henderson's] horse [Kingston Pride], who was actually all right, it made me think he'd have a good chance - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who held on well to make a winning seasonal/chase debut at Taunton (2m7f, good to firm) last month; only 3lb higher here and should be fine on soft ground; high on the list.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't right in the middle part of last season but had the good ground that he needs when getting off the mark over hurdles at Ascot in March. He's close to a run and should win novice handicap chases provided we keep him in the right company. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Left disappointing seasonal debut behind when clear second in Exeter marathon this month
runners.name: Jupiter Allen

quotes.race: Paul Ferguson's Jumpers To Follow Best Mate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We're at the end of a really horrible period in our lives. In the summer I felt things would improve but Jupiter Allen was the one that made us stop after his last run. We know he's a nice horse and he's won there so I think we're back on track. It gives us that bit of confidence. I don't think he was fully tuned up but he's won really well and the beauty of it was that he got headed but came back. That tenacity and fight was really pleasing and he's going to be a proper staying chaser - Jane Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Junior "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Horses that run second time have that extra bit of experience and I thought the race at Newton Abbot, when Jupiter Allen came second, was good. He was a bit green that day, and the ground would've suited him better today. His jumping kept him in the race and he's a really brave horse - Jane Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner (3m/2m7f) for Jane Williams last season; well beaten on last month's reappearance but fared much better when clear second at Exeter (3m6f, soft) three weeks ago and remains on a workable mark.

stable_tour.quote: He has made a fine start to his career, finishing second at Newton Abbot on his debut and then winning a junior hurdle at Kempton in November. After that I ran him in the Grade 1 Finale Juvenile Hurdle, a race I always like to try to have a runner in, but everything that could go wrong did. He got mullered and couldn't get a run. It was a write-off but he has come out of the experience well. He was due to run last week at Carlisle before the elements intervened. We'll find him a race again soon and he's very much one for the future. 15-03-23

runners.comment: Ran a big race when second at Ascot last month; player if he copes with soft ground
runners.name: Muskoka
runners.spotlight: Didn't fire at Kempton in October, after a break, but arguably posted career-best performance when a clear second in first-time visor at Ascot (3m, good) last month; contender if coping with today's ground (handles good to soft but has avoided soft).

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't right last season but he came out and travelled like a nice horse on his debut over hurdles at Hereford. He's going to need further than two miles but I think he's got a chance of winning a novice and his fair share of races. 22-11-23

He had a good blow at Kempton, which isn't his track as everything happens too fast. He has plenty of ability and there's definitely an element of him not wanting to share it all. We might try a visor on him. He'll run in proper staying handicaps and should pop up in one of them. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Chase winner in spring 2024; back from long layoff with respectable run last month
runners.name: Broomfields Cave
runners.spotlight: Launched chasing career with two good runs in spring 2024, the latter a small-field win at Newton Abbot (3m2f, good); not seen again until respectable third of five at Doncaster (3m2f, soft) last month but has possibilities if that outing has brought him on.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second and then first on his last two runs over fences, then had a year off with a bit of an injury. He's in good order now and I thought he galloped well when we took him for an away day. He'll be back out in a staying chase when we get some decent ground. 12-11-25

He'll probably have a couple of runs over hurdles before going chasing after May 1. He'll be out in a couple of weeks. He's a consistent three-miler. His jumping has let him down on a couple of occasions but he's been schooling well over fences. He won his first start last season and then looked like he was going to win again at Uttoxeter before he fell at the last. He looks like a nice staying chaser in the making. 06-03-24

runners.comment: 3-7 over fences after this month's 2m4f course win; not bred for this much longer trip
runners.name: Pilsdon Pen

prev_owners.owner: Highbury Stud And Willingham House Stud

runners.spotlight: Kept on well to make winning seasonal debut here (2m4f, good to soft) three weeks ago and is now 3-7 over fences; not bred to benefit from this hike up in trip but recent 2lb rise is manageable if his stamina holds out.

runners.comment: Dual course winner last season (2m4f/3m1f) and ran well when back in action last month
runners.name: Pedley Wood
runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f chase on this card one year ago (good to soft) and followed up over today's trip here in late January (heavy); last month's seasonal reappearance at Exeter was perfectly respectable and he's sure to be suited by the return to this track; might be the answer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great season, winning two nice races, and when he's on song he's good. We'd like to work back from Wincanton on Boxing Day, where he won last year. If we can win a couple more with him, then that's great. 12-11-25

14:38.race_name: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts Handicap Chase (For The Harry And John Dufosee Memorial Cup) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 2-2 on good ground over fences this season; hard to beat if coping with soft going here
runners.name: Rip Wheeler
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles last season but 2-2 over fences this term, winning with a bit left in the tank under Robert Dunne at Huntingdon and Lingfield (both 2m4f, good); not sure to be as effective on soft  ground here but still commands respect.

stable_tour.quote: A nice big horse who was immature last season. His best run came on his last start at Huntingdon, but he was too gangly to do himself justice. He's a well-handicapped horse who will improve for a fence this season. 28-10-25

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way on seasonal/chase debut and drops in grade today
runners.name: Geturguccion
runners.spotlight: 0-9 under all codes and has a tendency to race too freely but ended last season with good fourth of 14 over hurdles at Newbury (3m, good to soft) and ran well for a long way on last month's chasing debut at Warwick (2m4f, good to soft; jumped right on occasions); drops from 0-120 grade today and the switch to a right-handed track ought to suit; worth a second look.

stable_tour.quote: She ran very well in her first bumper at Newbury and was an encouraging second on her hurdling debut at Ludlow. She'd been schooling very well and should win mares' novice hurdles, probably at 2m4f-plus. 07-11-24

runners.comment: As good as ever since swapping usual cheekpieces for a visor this month, winning twice
runners.name: Atreides

quotes.race: Southern Cranes And Access Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm very happy with Atreides and he showed a good attitude out there today. He jumped and travelled well and the visor seems to be having a good effect. We were always confident he'd handle conditions, as he has in the past. He's always given a good account of himself and he's done it nicely today - Neil Mulholland, trainer.

runners.spotlight: As good as ever since swapping usual cheekpieces for a visor this month, winning at Plumpton (2m4f, good to soft) and Fontwell (2m3f, heavy); up 8lb to career-high mark today but makes obvious appeal in current mood.

runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but ran well when third here last month; makes chasing debut today
runners.name: Staff Sergeant Len

prev_owners.owner: Acorn Builders Dorset Ltd & David Tye

runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but bettered low-key seasonal/stable debut when close third of 14 in refitted cheekpieces here (2m4f, good) in November; also suited by slower ground and can feature if able to transfer that form to fences at the first attempt.

runners.comment: Back from break with three good runs this autumn (one over C&D); won't be far away
runners.name: Begin The Luck
runners.spotlight: Back from break with three good runs this autumn, including C&D second (good) two starts ago; recent 2lb drop helps and he's versatile ground-wise; probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Kept on stoutly to win by 9l at Fontwell this month; still very lightly raced for her age
runners.name: Mutley Crew
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at third attempt, keeping on stoutly to win by 9l at Fontwell (2m5f, heavy) this month; 7lb higher in a stronger race here but remains very lightly raced for her age.

15:13.race_name: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: S C E A Hamel Stud
runners.comment: This is a rare run these days away from Graded events but there have to be some doubts
runners.name: Botox Has

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Rendlesham Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Botox Has enjoys a flat track and has won very well. I think we'll probably bypass Cheltenham, he's in the Stayers' Hurdle but won't go there, and we might consider the Grade 1 at Aintree [Liverpool Hurdle]. We may also consider going to France in the spring and early summer, there's the French Champion Hurdle and others race there as well - Josh Moore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The West Yorkshire Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Botox Has is unbelievable. What a performance that was. He was giving weight away to a lot of them. The one thing he has on his side is he's very tough. When push comes to shove he digs deep. I don't think he enjoyed the ground today. It's an unbelievable training performance (by Gary Moore) - he's an absolute genius. This horse has had his problems. He had a little niggly problem hence he didn't go to the Cheltenham Festival last season and he's been off ever since but he has got him back as good as ever and I'm very grateful - Caolin Quinn, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Stayers' Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Botox Has is a tough horse, I just tried to keep him on the bridle as long as I could. I was handy enough the whole way, I winged the last and he really stuck his head down and battled for me. The more you ask him, the more he gives you. He's still unexposed, there's still plenty of improvement in him - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle
quotes.quote: Botox Has won nicely. He picked up quicker than I was expecting him to down the hill. He saw it out well. I was hoping it wouldn't turn into a test of speed, so I kept him as close as I could to Harry and he galloped out well. I was quite confident we could give Allmankind a race. We minded him after he won in December - and what happened, happened - but it wasn't the end of the world. He's not an overly big horse but he was developing all of the time - Joshua Moore, rider.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: There was no pace in the race so Botox Has had to make his own running. To win by five lengths, having only had a length lead at the last, shows he's an out and out galloper and I think he's a better horse coming off a fast pace. It wouldn't bother me stepping this horse up to two and a half miles against older horses. The one thing he does do so well is jump - there aren't enough hurdles out there for him - Gary Moore, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two Grade 2 wins over about 3m on testing ground in the 2023-24 campaign; there was only one performance of a similar calibre last season, however, and he fell early on reappearance four weeks ago; this is a rare run these days away from Graded events but there have to be some doubts.

stable_tour.quote: He'll start back in the West Yorkshire Hurdle on Charlie Hall day at Wetherby. He hasn't got the Grade 2 penalty this season, which for a small horse has made life tough for him in the past. He's getting a bit long in the tooth, but he's come back looking better than ever and we still hold out some hope for him. 28-10-25

I made a mistake of running him on good ground at Plumpton first time out and he then had a mishap on his first run over fences, at Cheltenham in November, so we reverted to hurdles immediately with a view to trying again next season. He has run very well in two Cheltenham handicap hurdles since finishing second and third. He is in good order and the plan is to go for the £100,000 handicap hurdle at Sandown on Saturday. 02-02-22

runners.comment: Pulled up in five of his last six races; cheekpieces (tried once, pulled up) return
runners.name: Stay Away Fay

quotes.race: Betfair Esher Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stay Away Fay digs deep and stays and gallops. He is a proper horse. I knew he would stay and gallop all the way to the line. It is a hard in front as he doesn't do a whole heap in front. In those better races when you have loads of company and they go a true gallop, it helps him. No one was going to takes us on so we were left in front and we had to do the donkey work and you are a sitting duck, but one thing he does is gallop all the way to the line and he stays on strong. He is a good horse.   I'm definitely not going for the National Hunt Chase and if he runs anywhere it will be the Brown Advisory at the festival. We might look at something like the Reynoldstown at Ascot, but there are no real plans. He will not go to Kempton (for the Kauto Star) that is for sure as he will have a little break now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway 'Future Stars' Silver Bowl Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stay Away Fay stays, he jumps and he gallops. He is classy and that is what you want. I'm thrilled with that. I was a bit worried all week as I thought he looked big and round and that he would improve for a run. You almost expect too much from these horses and you have got to have them ready to do that, but also have them ready to improve. There is lots to come from him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was only Stay Away Fay's fourth run over hurdles so he has got a bit more experience today and he will have a lovely holiday now and then go chasing. He will be an awesome chaser. We had thought about staying over hurdles with him but he probably lacks a little bit of class for that. I'm not saying that we won't start him over hurdles next season at somewhere like Wetherby but that is for us to discuss - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stay Away Fay is a very smart young horse. He's going to improve for a summer. I knew he'd win turning in because he's a very strong stayer. He wasn't going to stop - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Get Closer To The Action Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've been patient as Stay Away Fay has been big and weak. He hadn't shown a lot at home, but his point-to-point form was fine and he's a nice horse. He'll improve a bit and he stays really strongly. I think Hermes Allen will go for the Challow, but Harry Skelton [who rode the second] said that was the best novice hurdle he's ridden in all season. We'll find a nice race for him and we're only just learning about him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart in his pomp; however, pulled up on five of his last six appearances (despite wind operations) and one of those was in this race last year on his only hurdle start since 2023; cheekpieces (tried once, pulled up) return.

stable_tour.quote: I'm glad we got him back at the Chris Giles dispersal sale. He looked like developing into a leading novice chaser last season, but he scoped dirty after disappointing at the festival and by the time we tried him over a trip in the Scottish National he was clearly struggling with his breathing. So he's had a summer breathing operation that has left him a bit behind the others in terms of fitness. I was hoping we might have him ready for the Coral Gold Cup, but we've have a few little issues with him and Newbury will come too soon, so I doubt we'll see him this side of Christmas. I'm in no rush. The handicapper dropped him 6lb at the end of last season - I'm still not convinced he's on a good mark - and as the new owners are keen to go for the Grand National, we'll work backwards from Aintree. We might start back over hurdles. 04-11-24

runners.comment: Handicapped up to his best but should be of renewed interest back over hurdles
runners.name: Tiny Tetley
runners.owner: R J Hodges & Mrs S L Hobbs

quotes.race: In Memory Of Ian Chambers Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a step up in grade but Tiny Tetley stepped up well. He keeps going up through the rankings and he keeps answering the questions. Callum said that was as tight a track as you'd want for him - Johnson White, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Had a largely superb campaign over about 3m as a hurdler last season; has run respectably this term, despite not really taking to chasing on last two outings (pulled up after sprawling badly two out last time); handicapped up to his best but should be of renewed interest back over hurdles.

stable_tour.quote: His name suggests he's not very big, but he seemed to jump well on his chasing debut at Exeter at the start of the month. The problem we're facing is there are very few races he can run in as he's quite high in the handicap from his success over hurdles. We'll keep him over fences for the time being and see where we end up. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Not entirely disgraced last time, albeit struggling before stamina at 3m became an issue
runners.name: Classic King

prev_owners.owner: Will Davies, Tom Davies & Tessa Grundy
Exors Of The Late Sarah Davies, & Family

runners.spotlight: Did well at 2m3f-2m5f when reverting to hurdles for last three starts last season; comeback at Cheltenham (2m4f) in October was satisfactory and he was not entirely disgraced at Newbury on latest outing, albeit struggling before stamina at 3m became an issue; others have more pressing claims.

stable_tour.quote: I think if the horses had been healthy, he'd have been an easy bumper winner last season. He was very impressive on his debut over hurdles at Wincanton last month and I thought he ran a lovely race when second to Queens Gamble at Kempton. I think in time he'll probably want a bit further but he doesn't want a bog. He's a horse we think a lot of and I'd expect him to win a normal novice with a penalty. 22-11-23

I was delighted with his comeback run at Cheltenham - he just needed it. He travelled and jumped well but took a blow between two out and the last. That race showed us how he's relaxing so much better now and he looked as though he wants further. For the moment I'm going to get my way and he's going to stay over hurdles next time and try a longer trip. After that we'll decide whether Barry has his way and he goes chasing again. 05-11-25

runners.comment: 5th in this 2024 in latest hurdle race; interesting on initial chase form but flop latest
runners.name: Largy Poet

quotes.race: Salisbury Hospice Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Largy Poet idled most of the way round but will make someone a nice chaser next season. He'll end up in the Doncaster May sales but he'll stay three miles and we might look at that good novice hurdle at Perth in April - Paul Nicholls, trainer, talking to RacingTV.

runners.spotlight: Fifth in this last year in latest hurdle race; won at Exeter (3m, heavy) and second at Fontwell (3m2f, good to soft) in first two attempts as a chaser; flop at Ascot five weeks ago was not due to the 3m5f, so he reverts to hurdling today and is well treated if initial chase form is transferred.

stable_tour.quote: We always saw him as a chaser and he got off the mark first time, in a 3m novice handicap at Exeter in February. I wanted to run him again in the spring but couldn't risk him once the ground dried up. I was anxious to get an outing into him before going for his long-term objective, the Badger Beer Chase at Wincanton on Saturday. We squeezed one in at Fontwell eight days ago and I was very pleased with his effort in second. He hasn't got long to recover but we'll stick to our plan; he looks on a fair mark and loves going right-handed. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Below form lately and this fifth attempt at about 3m gives him even more to prove
runners.name: Ike Sport
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in this last term; last won in April 2024 and his most competitive displays since were in the spring this year, all at about 2m4f; tailed off on return from a summer break, then below form (with his usual tongue-tie removed) on latest start, and this fifth attempt at about 3m gives him even more to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good form after winning a big handicap chase for us last time out. Like Any News, we won't be running him on the winter ground but the plan will be to have him back out again before the end of the season. He's done very little wrong for us and I think he can step up again. 27-11-23

He's solid and very consistent. He'll go chasing after May 1. There's nothing major jumping out for him at any of the festivals. He had a rating of 116 before he last ran. He's done very little wrong and it was a £70,000 race he won last time out. He's a six-year-old who jumps, stays and has a big heart, so now is the natural time to go chasing. He cost only £16,000. We could end up targeting him towards the Summer Plate or something similar. 06-03-24

runners.comment: Up 8lb but on a roll and open to further improvement; no shock if he scores again
runners.name: Absolutely Doyen

quotes.race: Remix Dry Mortar Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Physically, Absolutely Doyen is improving, but more than anything, mentally he's improving. He's settled into a routine now, is jumping better and I think he'll keep improving. He'll make a nice chaser in time - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden prior to completing a hat-trick this term for new stable, scoring readily at Ascot (upped to 3m, good to soft; handicap debut) on latest outing; second of those wins was under Freddie Keighley; up 8lb but on a roll and open to further improvement; no shock if he scores again.

stable_tour.quote: He joined the yard over the summer, still a maiden after eight starts. He'd been running over two miles but showed improvement when we stepped him up to two miles six on his first run for us and he won a maiden hurdle at Stratford last month, where he had little to beat. It was the same race we landed three years ago with Hermes Allen before he went on to land the Grade 1 Challow. I'm not suggesting for a minute this fellow will go on to do anything like that but he's perfectly capable of winning again if we keep him in the right grade. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Good 4th of 18 at Cheltenham (2m5f, soft) with encouragement for 3m; 4lb out of handicap
runners.name: El Capitaine
runners.spotlight: Won seven point-to-points in a row before returning to hurdles with a handicap win by short head at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good to soft) in October; good fourth of 18 at Cheltenham (2m5f, soft) since, never nearer and giving encouragement for 3m; 4lb out of the handicap but considered each-way.

runners.comment: Brings potential as a stayer but he's also 4lb out of the handicap for this reappearance
runners.name: Moonset
runners.spotlight: Ended last season winning a maiden at Market Rasen (extended 2m4f, good to soft) and handicap debut at Newton Abbot (3m3f, heavy); he was rather handed the latter race, when clear leader faltered at the final flight; this 7yo is more lightly raced than most of today's rivals and brings potential as a stayer, but he's also 4lb out of the handicap for this reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: You wouldn't mind having a yard full of horses like him. He's a lovely horse who keeps finding and keeps improving. He goes chasing and will be out when we get a bit of safe ground. He'll stay as far as you want and could be a decent novice. 12-11-25

He's a nice horse for the future. He ran in a couple of Irish point-to-points and only narrowly missed out on winning his bumper at Uttoxeter in November, when he ran really well. He'll go hurdling after May. He just needed a bit of time to strengthen up and we think he can make a nice novice hurdler. 06-03-24

15:45.race_name: Download The PricedUp App Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Jc Laisis
runners.comment: Back in good form for new stable this season; eased in grade today; major player
runners.name: Haas Boy
runners.spotlight: Back in good form for new stable this season, winning twice (chase/hurdle) before creditable second in quite valuable Huntingdon hurdle (2m, soft) 19 days ago; eased in grade here and remains of strong interest.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden hurdle at Huntingdon last season and a subsequent second at Sedgefield earned him an opening mark of 115. This season he had his opening race, at Ludlow, won before falling when clear at the last. His stupid trainer then thought he would quickly run him before he got another new mark and eight days later he ran a lifeless race, which in hindsight was to be expected. He is a lovely big horse who will be better over a fence, but we have given him loads of time to get over his last run and I may even send him to Marcus Foley who would give him some intensive jumping and loose schooling. Hopefully, that will help him get to enjoy his jumping again as he has a lot more to offer. 11-01-23

runners.comment: Pulled up in first two handicaps but returned to form with front-running win this month
runners.name: Zainy Champ
runners.owner: I F Gosden And Dj Coles
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in first two handicaps but bounced back to form with front-running success at Exeter (2m2f, soft) three weeks ago; 8lb higher here but could easily have more to offer; respected.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Michel Sardou
runners.comment: Kept on well for clear second at Leicester this month; this less testing ground will suit
runners.name: Aggagio

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: All credit for this goes to Josh (Moore), he was adamant we should come up here with Aggagio today. He gave me my instructions, to pop him out and be very positive on him, and it's worked - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

quotes.race: Royal Sussex Regiment Handicap
quotes.quote: I don't know if there's another race back here for Aggagio. If there was he might come back, but the ground would have to be soft enough. Otherwise, he'll go jumping because his handicap mark is what it is now. He wouldn't want it bottomless over jumps - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Sussex Roof Garden Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: Aggagio is a lovely horse. We didn't know he'd get the trip, but he's done really well. I was a bit worried about the ground if it was soft, which Goshen wants and we don't really. Gary Moore will place him where he wants and Aidan said he might get slightly further - Gary Robinson, owner.

runners.spotlight: Still fairly useful on the Flat; this is his level over hurdles and he kept on well for a clear second behind Thankyouandplease at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) this month; will probably be better suited by the less testing ground here and is still on a workable mark; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: He did a bit of damage when he fell over fences at Plumpton in April. He's had a couple of runs back, including a spin on the Flat, and shaped okay at Wincanton over hurdles a couple of weeks ago. We'll stick over hurdles and, providing we can get his confidence back, he should do okay on slow ground. 29-10-24

runners.breeder: Ashtown B/S, O B Sarl, E Puerari, G Bozo
runners.comment: Well handicapped on early-season form but not firing on all cylinders lately
runners.name: Chicago Storm

prev_owners.owner: Anthony Carey & Martin W Walsh & Derek Dunne

quotes.race: #90 January & February Hospitality Offer Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chicago Storm's work has been very good at home, I can't fault him, and he'll probably go on to better things. I have nothing in mind yet, but he's a very straightforward and easy horse, and he has plenty of ability - Daisy Hitchins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season form but not firing on all cylinders lately; reverts to hurdling after falling in a chase this month; swaps cheekpieces for refitted visor; would appeal more on better ground; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles when trained in Ireland and absent since June; makes stable debut here
runners.name: Queenie St Clair
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on the Flat at her best; 0-8 over hurdles in Ireland and absent since some disappointing efforts in the spring; sports refitted hood for stable debut; considered only if lively in betting.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Honguenet
runners.comment: Well beaten on recent handicap debut; needs big boost from first-time blinkers
runners.name: Good For You
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in soft-ground C&D maiden in February but yet to build upon that performance; well beaten on recent handicap debut at Exeter (2m2f, soft; race won by Zainy Champ) and needs big boost from first-time blinkers.

runners.breeder: Sarl Igep Haras Du Chateau De Rabodanges
runners.comment: Won cosily at Leicester this month but held since; needs to prove himself off this mark
runners.name: Thankyouandplease

quotes.race: Racing Excellence Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Handicap Hurdle (Part Of The RE Series)
quotes.quote: Thankyouandplease didn't come off the bridle. I've always thought a lot of him but it didn't go his way at Plumpton. He's in the zone at home, so we got him back out quickly, and we'll do the same again as he can go off 95 at Exeter next Thursday. He's in at Taunton [on Thursday] and it's tempting, but the ground would be too quick for him. Logically, a bit of time to Exeter should help and he can go in again hopefully. We've been knocking on the door, hopefully we're hitting a purple patch now and he can add to it next week - Syd Hosie, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Unextended when beating Aggagio at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) this month but had to settle for second when effectively 1lb below that mark at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) one week ago and is now 7lb above his winning mark.

runners.comment: Won this in 2024 and has performed well on all four starts for new stable; new headgear
runners.name: Ugo Bingo

prev_owners.owner: A K Hosie J P Romans W Van Der Horst

runners.spotlight: Won this race for Anthony Charlton in 2024 and has performed well on all four starts for Joe Tizzard, most recently when fifth in 17-runner Exeter handicap (2m, good) won by Haas Boy last month; untested on ground slower than good to soft but has a fighting chance if he handles today's conditions and responds well to first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Good-ground winner in the spring but well below that form on both starts this autumn
runners.name: Castle Quarter
runners.spotlight: Came good in today's headgear combination at Uttoxeter (2m, good) in the spring, his ninth start over hurdles, but well below that form on both starts this autumn and the ground may be too soft for him again here.

runners.comment: Back from break with two disappointing runs for new stable this autumn
runners.name: Mach Ten
runners.spotlight: Back from break with two disappointing runs for new stable this autumn, the latter here (2m4f) in refitted cheekpieces; on a good mark now but needs to turn things around; refitted visor the headgear of choice today.

runners.comment: Second over C&D in new headgear last month but 9lb wrong today and good ground suits best
runners.name: Prince Rhinegold
runners.owner: Mrs D Robinson Mrs & Mrs Livesey-Van Dorst
runners.spotlight: Responded well to first-time cheekpieces when second over C&D (good) last month but is effectively 11lb higher from out of the weights today and the slower ground is probably not ideal.

runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles and can't be recommended from 13lb out of the weights
runners.name: Talap
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last month and now 0-6 over hurdles; can't be recommended from 13lb out of the weights here.

runners.comment: Winner of a point and a Hereford novice hurdle; remains open to further improvement
runners.name: Four Springs
runners.spotlight: Picked up for 82,000euros after winning an Irish point by 22l in May and comfortably made a winning hurdle/stable debut at Hereford (2m, good; evens) last month; remains open to further improvement and respected; stable also runs Caliach Point.

runners.comment: Dual bumper winner and narrowly made a successful hurdle debut over C&D last month
runners.name: Japetus
runners.spotlight: Landed bumpers at Newcastle and Hexham in the spring, but had to work a bit harder to get the better of a stablemate of Four Springs and Caliach Point on his hurdle debut over C&D last month; still looks a nice prospect and has to be high on the list.

runners.comment: Runner-up on his second start over hurdles, but still finished 12l behind the winner
runners.name: Caliach Point
runners.spotlight: Improved from his underwhelming hurdle debut when second of eight at Doncaster (2m1f, soft) last month, but still finished 12l behind the winner; Beau Morgan (who was aboard then) is on stablemate Four Springs.

runners.comment: Poor in four starts on the Flat for Grant Tuer; makes no appeal on stable/hurdles debut
runners.name: Destination Unkown
runners.spotlight: Poor in four starts on the Flat for Grant Tuer; changed hands for £1,000 in July and makes no appeal on stable/hurdles debut after 200 days off.

runners.breeder: S C P Haras Des Coudraies
runners.comment: Won an Irish point last year, but has since disappointed in a bumper and a hurdle
runners.name: Korkoran
runners.spotlight: Bought for £240,000 after narrowly winning an Irish point in February last year, but has since disappointed in an Exeter bumper this February and (following wind surgery) in a Lingfield novice hurdle (2m3f, good to soft) last month; may be best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: He did well to win his point-to-point. He's a beautiful horse and I see him running in a couple of bumpers this season, hopefully starting this side of Christmas. He's a big, beautiful animal and we want him to be a high-class chaser in two or three years. 01-11-24

runners.comment: May have won had he not unseated last time; receives 7lb from the previous winners
runners.name: Quaviste
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who was a bit disappointing on hurdle debut at Stratford in October, but was in with every chance when unseating at the last over C&D (good to soft) last month; shortlisted in receipt of 7lb from the previous winners, with the stable having won five of the last nine runnings.

stable_tour.quote: He took us a bit by surprise when he won a Huntingdon bumper last season, having had to go very wide, and he was probably over the top by the time he got to Aintree. He ran nicely first time out over hurdles but travelled a bit too well and just took a blow. He has loads of speed, two miles is his trip and I think you'll see him to much better effect next time, but I think he may be the type to get it all together in the spring, and when he does he'll be a tidy horse. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Cosy winner of his sole Irish point in April; watch market on hurdle/stable debut
runners.name: Red Rubio
runners.spotlight: Cosy winner of his sole Irish point in April; market informative on hurdle/stable debut after 257 days off.

runners.comment: 0-7 on the Flat and not much in two starts over hurdles; others more convincing
runners.name: Sugar Road
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on the Flat and not much in two starts over hurdles, reportedly having bled from the nose when pulled up at Southwell this month; others are more convincing.

13:15.race_name: Rand Farm Park 30th Anniversary Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 1-2 over fences; room for improvement in his jumping and dropping in trip may not be ideal
runners.name: Maghlaak

quotes.race: William Hill More Top Prices Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I'd say Maghlaak is going to be a decent horse, jumping will toughen him up. His bit of class showed there late on and he did that well.  We bought him as a dual-purpose horse and he has a great pedigree - his dam won the Guineas - Adrian Keatley, trainer

quotes.race: Golf At Goodwood Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maghlaak had a lot of weight, so did it well. I've no idea about plans - Jim Crowley, rider.

runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdle winner who made a successful chase debut at Southwell (2m4f, soft) last month and ran with credit when fourth of ten at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) 15 days later; has room for improvement in the jumping department and dropping in trip may not be ideal.

stable_tour.quote: He finished well to win at Goodwood on his comeback, but he was drawn ten of ten at Redcar last time and could never get any cover. It was a non-event and I'm putting a line through it. He's a pretty talented horse, who likes to get his toe in, and I think the mile and a half would suit him well if he makes the cut. 13-06-24

He's been a good servant for us. He ran a good race in the Group 3 Silver Cup at York and then went so close at Market Rasen. I think if we keep stepping him up in trip, we'll get similar or better results with him. We'll look at the staying race at the Shergar Cup meeting and continue to mix it between hurdles and the Flat. He might jump fences in time. 07-08-25

runners.comment: Running consistently well in defeat since Ascot hurdle win; watch market on chase debut
runners.name: Clap Of Thunder

quotes.race: GL Events Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clap Of thunder was very straightforward and progressed a lot from Chepstow to today. He jumped nicely, travelled well, and won as he liked. I put him up earlier in the season as my horse to follow so when he trailed in a very poor fourth last time I was really questioning my judgement! The way he's won there is the horse I thought we had so hopefully we can go on to better things. He'll jump a fence one day - Sam Twiston-Davies, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won Ascot novice hurdle (2m, good) in November last year and has run consistently well in defeat since (underwent wind surgery before latest start); market may be helpful now switched to fences.

runners.breeder: L De Premont, G De Premont & T Van De
runners.comment: Off 256 days before finishing runner-up on chase debut at Ludlow; one for the shortlist
runners.name: Nordic Tiger

quotes.race: Wincanton Handicap Hurdle (Conditional And Amateur Riders That Have Ridden In PRA Pony Races)
quotes.quote: Nordic Tiger tried quite hard at Lingfield and I think we backed him up too quickly last time. He travelled nicely and is a genuine horse. He'll get a fair whack for that but he's progressive and spring ground will suit even better - Harry Derham, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner who made a creditable chase debut when second of four finishers at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) this month; should be all the better for that first outing in 256 days and one for the shortlist.

stable_tour.quote: He was a joy to train last season. He's genuine and just kept improving. He'll stay hurdling and I think two and a half miles is his trip, but we'll start over two miles at Newbury and hopefully he'll progress from there. He'll need to improve off his mark but he's got the attitude to. 01-11-24

He ran really well in a 2m maiden hurdle at Uttoxeter last week and he'd had a long time off the track, so I almost felt like that was his first run. He'll end up going up in trip at some stage but I'm not in a mad rush to do that. He'll win some nice little races at his level. 18-10-23

runners.comment: May have been fortunate last time but is 2-2 in cheekpieces and has few miles on the clock
runners.name: Benmore
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner who beat one other finisher on his second chase start at Leicester (2m, good) this month (leader departed three out); not sure what the form is worth and now 4lb higher, but he is 2-2 in cheekpieces and has few miles on the clock.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner and third in both chase starts; not dismissed
runners.name: Synchronist
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner in the spring who has finished third in both chase starts, his latest effort in a first-time tongue-tie at Plumpton (2m1f, good) an improvement from his debut; not dismissed.

runners.comment: Made a winning chase debut at Warwick last time and form has been franked; major player
runners.name: Kykorock
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer who showed little in a bumper and three hurdles, but back to form when making a successful chase/handicap debut at Warwick (2m, soft) last time; that form has received a couple of boosts since and he's a major player raised 6lb.

runners.comment: Ordinary efforts in two starts over fences and she may need further now; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Gilbertina
runners.spotlight: Two of her three wins over hurdles came here and she's 2lb lower than for the latest, but just ordinary efforts in two starts over fences and this trip looks a bit sharp for her now; cheekpieces are given a go.

13:47.race_name: Rand Farm Park Family Days Out Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Early promise but has disappointed in all three handicaps; may be best watched for now
runners.name: Recoded
runners.spotlight: Looked promising when placed in four of his first five starts in bumpers/hurdles, but has disappointed in three handicaps (reportedly had an irregular heartbeat last time); may be best watched for now.

runners.comment: Ran his best race over hurdles when fourth at Doncaster four weeks ago; down 2lb
runners.name: Ballynoe Boy
runners.spotlight: Placed in both bumpers and ran his best race over hurdles when fourth of 12 on handicap debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) four weeks ago; down 2lb and wouldn't need to improve much more to be competitive.

runners.comment: Off the same mark as when second of 14 at Southwell in February; off 312 days
runners.name: Gotthereintheend

prev_owners.owner: M Redman M Thomas L Horsfall

runners.spotlight: Proving inconsistent, but is off the same mark as when second of 14 at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) in February and could be given a chance on that form if ready to go after 312 days off.

runners.comment: Fair third on last month's Leicester return; possibilities if coming on for the run
runners.name: Welcheston Warrier
runners.spotlight: Was returning from 252 days off when third of seven at Leicester (2m4f, soft) last month (runner-up has since won over fences); still unexposed and has possibilities if coming on for the run.

runners.comment: Still 9lb higher than for sole win in September; vulnerable to less-exposed rivals
runners.name: Gms Prince
runners.spotlight: Sole success in 26 starts came here (2m3f, good) in September and he has twice run with credit since, but he remains 9lb higher than for the win and may be vulnerable to less-exposed rivals.

runners.comment: Little in three starts over hurdles but now upped in trip on handicap debut; tongue-tie on
runners.name: A Law To Himself
runners.spotlight: Placed in both points but has shown little in three starts over hurdles; may show more now upped in trip on handicap debut with a tongue-tie added; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Hasn't finished within 13l of the winner in seven starts; drop back in trip may help
runners.name: Annies Gold
runners.spotlight: Hasn't finished within 13l of the winner in three bumpers and four starts over hurdles; drop back in trip may help, but others make greater appeal.

runners.comment: Much improved when third last time on return from seven months off; form working out well
runners.name: Roxby Belle
runners.spotlight: Modest in her first three starts over hurdles but, despite being 3lb out of the weights and returning from 201 days off, she showed much more when third of 11 on handicap debut at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) last month; a couple of those behind won their next starts; leading claims.

runners.comment: Off 559 days; stable has taken two of the last five runnings; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Renegade Arrow
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner in 2021; best effort over hurdles when third of 13 on his return from five months off at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) in June last year, but has been off again since; cheekpieces given a go; worth a market check for stable that has taken two of the last five runnings.

runners.comment: Makes debut for another new yard after 611 days off having undergone wind surgery
runners.name: Celine Man
runners.spotlight: With Mark Fahey when runner-up at Fakenham (2m4f, soft) in March 2023, but pulled up on both starts for Henrietta Knight the following spring; makes debut for another new yard after 611 days off having undergone wind surgery; only of interest if backed.

runners.comment: 0-23 under rules and makes little appeal from 8lb out of the weights
runners.name: Macho Sun
runners.spotlight: 0-23 under rules and makes little appeal from 8lb out of the weights.

14:22.race_name: Rand Farm Park All Weather Attraction Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Well beaten in three hurdles; this greater test of stamina should suit; market informative
runners.name: Wannabe
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three 2m hurdles and this is a completely different test on chase/handicap debut, but his pedigree suggests the greater test of stamina should suit; market informative.

stable_tour.quote: We've got a lot of nice three-year-olds at the moment, including this fella, who we paid ?72,000 for at the Derby Sale. You may not see him this season, but he's definitely one to follow in the future. 20-12-23

runners.comment: Was running a big race before falling on latest chase start; worth a second look
runners.name: Orange Diamond
runners.spotlight: Won his first three starts over hurdles at Worcester (2m4f) for this yard and has run with credit in both outings since; failed to complete in all five previous starts over fences, though was running a big race before falling on the final occasion; worth a second look.

runners.comment: 0-17 under rules, but only beaten a length over C&D last time; each-way claims again
runners.name: Hawkseye View

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D Walton & D G Pryde

runners.spotlight: Winning pointer but 0-17 under rules, albeit was only beaten a length over C&D (good to soft) last time; up 3lb but holds each-way claims again with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Still in with every chance before falling two out over C&D last time; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Alltalknoaction
runners.spotlight: Yet to win but was still in with every chance before falling two out on his second chase start over C&D (good to soft) three weeks ago; possibilities off the same mark with cheekpieces given a go.

runners.comment: Ran well on return over hurdles last month; trip no problem on chase debut; tongue-tie on
runners.name: Delgany Deadline
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability over hurdles, running a big race when fourth of 16 on his return from 202 days off at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) last month; return to this trip no problem on chase debut and he's respected with a tongue-tie given a go.

runners.comment: Back off the same mark as when winning on this card two years ago; worth a market check
runners.name: Benny Baloo
runners.spotlight: Quiet in two starts for this yard since returning from 16 months off in September, but is back off the same mark as when winning a novice handicap over C&D on this card for Tim Easterby two years ago; worth market check.

runners.breeder: G F A Du Pont Rouge
runners.comment: Won twice in October, but was well held at Wincanton last time; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Of Corse I Can
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 3m2f at Fontwell (good) and Newton Abbot (good to soft) in October, but was well held off this mark at Wincanton (3m3f, good to soft; behind Sheeka Supreme) this month; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: 0-10 under rules; hard to fancy from out of the weights
runners.name: Sheeka Supreme
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer, but 0-10 under rules and may not have achieved much when fourth of 11 at Wincanton (3m3f, good to soft) this month; hard to fancy from out of the weights.

runners.comment: 1-64; makes little appeal from well out of the weights
runners.name: Fast Deal
runners.spotlight: Caused a 150-1 shock at Stratford (3m4f, good to soft) in April last year, but that's his only win in 64 starts; well out of the weights and makes little appeal.

14:57.race_name: Pallinc Lincolnshire National Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 3-7 over fences; excuses came to light last time and chance here if the wheels stay on
runners.name: Sound And Fury
