runners.spotlight: Took chase record to 3-6 when holding on from a useful stayer at Carlisle (3m2f, good to soft) on reappearance; lost a shoe and bled from the nose when well beaten at Cheltenham (heavy) since; likely contender if the wheels stay on this time.

runners.comment: Won as a novice but didn't run much of a race last month after a break and wind surgery
runners.name: Mt Fugi Park

quotes.race: Derek Cannon 80 Not Out Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mt Fugi Park had been a bit of a headscratcher so it was nice to see him get the job done and get his nose in front. The cheekpieces certainly didn't do him any harm. I'd love to say we've unlocked a magical secret with him, but I don't know why he bounced back today ? he'd been working well and schooling well. We'll see how he comes out of the race before making a plan - A J O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Next Meeting @leicesterraces Wednesday 31st January Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mt Fugi Park will get a mark after today and that'll probably direct us [where to go] a bit more. There's a three-mile race at Haydock in the middle of February that might suit him, but we won't over-face him too much this year. He'll be a nice chaser, so whatever he does going into the spring we'll be happy with, but we'll be looking forward to him next year - Jonjo O'Neill Jr, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser; won at Carlisle (3m, good) in April but was well beaten over 3m6f next time and didn't run much of a race at Exeter last month after a break and wind surgery; bit to prove now, including stamina.

stable_tour.quote: He was a fair novice hurdler and we thought he'd improve for fences, but for some reason it took quite a long time to click. He did win at Carlisle and had a wind operation going into this season, which can hopefully help him get back on track. He was below par at Exeter on his comeback, but he's a thorough stayer with not many miles on the clock. 18-11-25

runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.comment: Even if jumping better than last time his current mark could be an issue
runners.name: Ivane
runners.owner: A Keaveney, M Keaveney & P Butcher
runners.spotlight: Strong stayer who won the Durham National over 3m5f at Sedgefield in October (good; had slow-ground form in Ireland); only three ran when second at Plumpton and made mistakes when 12l behind the winner last time (3m3f); current mark could be an issue.

stable_tour.quote: He's been in great form through the summer and is the sort of horse who can mix it between the Flat, hurdles and chases. He's versatile with regards to trips as well and he'll handle wet ground no problem. There are no plans but a nice staying race off a low weight would suit him well. 24-10-25

runners.comment: First and second in two of his three handicap chases; clear of the third last time
runners.name: Red Delta
runners.spotlight: Triple point winner; first and second in two of his three handicap chases and was clear of the third when narrowly beaten at Doncaster (3m2f, soft) last time; should give his running and have some say.

runners.comment: Unproven beyond 3m1f but she won her only previous race over fences
runners.name: You Some Girl

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.spotlight: Four hurdle wins but was beaten 12l in that discipline last time; however, she won her only previous chase, in October in a three-runner beginners' event, and the return to fences is interesting; unproven beyond 3m1f.

stable_tour.quote: A bumper winner on her debut last season, she hasn't been the most fluent jumper over hurdles and we've done plenty of work on her schooling. I thought she'd won at Sedgefield in November when she came there absolutely swinging before falling two out. She needed a bit of physio and she's improved for it, and when the ground comes good we'll look to run her over two and a half miles-plus. She's qualified for the Go North mares' final and could be one for that. 24-01-24

runners.comment: 3m6f was perhaps a stretch last time at Newcastle and he's not on a bad mark
runners.name: Finn Lough

quotes.race: attheraces.com/marketmovers Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Finn Lough doesn't like to be in front too soon. The thinking was to run him in a better race with more pace on. We were going quick enough and I was taking my time. I knew I'd got the horse but it was whether I could get it out of him. And today it's worked well. The cheekpieces helped but the main thing was riding him as he wanted - Henry Brooke, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Two chase wins at about 3m but has finished runner-up over 3m2f; 3m6f was perhaps a stretch at Newcastle last time and he's not on a bad mark.

stable_tour.quote: He had some good form last season, but looked a bit lacklustre the other day. He probably wants more than three miles and the blinkers back on. He might be better in the spring and should have a few pounds in hand. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Up and down over hurdles but first and third in his two chases at Hereford (3m1f)
runners.name: Copshill Lad

quotes.race: BeatWright: Beat The Wright Way Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very pleased with Copshill Lad. I think the key was his jumping. We thought about going chasing when he was beaten at Ascot last year, but we wanted to give him a full season afterwards. He's not the fastest, but he's very genuine and he kept on galloping. Hopefully chasing can bring out further improvement - Harry Derham, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Up and down over hurdles but has made a good start over fences at Hereford (3m1f), winning off 2lb lower and then third behind an improver (successful since) one month ago; should be involved.

stable_tour.quote: He runs in the famous colours of Middleham Park Racing and made a winning debut when landing a Stratford bumper in May. We have tinkered with his wind over the summer, and he is now back in full work. He should be ready to resume next month with a view to tackling National Hunt novice hurdles. 13-10-22

runners.comment: This is a step up in class from his last win and he's 2lb badly in under a penalty
runners.name: Ali Star Bert

prev_owners.owner: Notts Racing, S A Harris & Miss H Ward

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ali Star Bert likes to make the jockeys work, but he knows Southwell inside out. I bred him and am so pleased with how he's turned out. He's slow, but always keeps trying hard, and those types aren't easy to find. The last two furlongs made all the difference, as turning in I thought he was going to be second or third at best - Shaun Harris, trainer.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shaun (Harris, trainer) wasn't sure about the ground as he'd never run on it before but maybe that's what Ali Star Bert wanted. That's my fifth winner this season which is already better than last season when I broke my leg and was off for a good while - Hugh Nugent, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Can struggle with consistency but he's won his last two, both over Southwell's extended 3m; however, this is a step up in class and he's 2lb badly in under a penalty.

runners.comment: Jumps well for an inexperienced chaser and his yard won this last year
runners.name: The Big Breac

quotes.race: Boyle Sports Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Big Breac was always going to improve for a fence. Three miles and soft ground are ideal for him and we haven't hit the ceiling with him yet - Joel Parkinson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Cheltenham Non-Runner Money Back Handicap Hurdle (Brindisi Breeze Qual') (Div I)
quotes.quote: The Big Breac is an out-and-out stayer. Two wins over hurdles are a bonus as he'll be a staying chaser - joint-trainer, Joel Parkinson.

quotes.race: William Hill Offers Top Price Guarantees Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Big Beac is improving every time he runs. We weren't sure how good he was when we first got him, then he got a little problem so he's been a bit slow getting going but he's improving every time he comes to the track - Joel Parkinson, joint trainer

runners.spotlight: 3-3 at Wetherby, where he won in November to earn this 8lb higher mark off which he ran well at Newcastle (3m6f, good to soft) since; jumps well for an inexperienced chaser and his yard won this last year.

runners.comment: 3m winner at Southwell; up in trip in a stronger race but she's not discounted
runners.name: Queens Wish

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Queens Wish was good. I'm not sure the form of the race was super hot but it was good and she was good. She jumped nicely. We'll find another little novice event and see where we get to in the spring. It was nice to have a good start - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Ex-Skelton mare; running well for current yard and was having only her second run over fences when much the best at Southwell (3m, good to soft) in November; that was a big step up in trip under rules but she was strong late on; has further to go now and in a better race, but not discounted.

15:32.race_name: Rand Farm Park Mare-Y Little Christmas Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: 4-5 in completed hurdles and 2-2 under William Easterby; much respected on handicap debut
runners.name: Smart Decision
runners.spotlight: 4-5 when completing over hurdles, the latest success coming in game fashion in a Leicester novice (2m, soft); may still have more to offer now switched to a handicap and much respected in his bid to make it 3-3 under William Easterby.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Uttoxeter last time; stable has won two of the last eight runnings
runners.name: Nowmelad
runners.spotlight: Won twice for the Newland/Insole stable in the autumn of 2024 and ran his best race for this yard when second of eight at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) 17 days ago; back up 2lb, but still shortlisted for stable that has won this race twice since 2017.

runners.comment: 3lb below his last winning mark but recent efforts need improving upon
runners.name: Ballygeary

quotes.race: Xenon Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballygeary ran a nice race at Cheltenham last time. He's probably a better horse getting a lead, but there were just the two runners. He'll jump a fence but we might run him in a few nice handicap hurdles along the way - Donald McCain, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Five wins over hurdles for Donald McCain and 3lb lower than for his latest success, which came here (2m5f, good) in June last year; last three efforts for his new yard leave something to be desired, though, and he will need to have derived benefit from a second wind op.

stable_tour.quote: He ran nicely at Aintree last month when he was a bit fresh but jumped slicker than he's done before. He's run respectably in the bigger races and could go for the 2m2f handicap hurdle at Haydock on Saturday week. He's not a big horse, but he could possibly go novice chasing later on. 12-11-24

runners.comment: Disappointing on handicap debut last time; right-handed track may help, but a bit to prove
runners.name: The Long Walk
runners.spotlight: Made all for a comfortable success in a Warwick maiden (2m3f, good) in May but was pulled up on his handicap debut at Uttoxeter in October next time; hung badly right in the latter, so going this way round may help, but he still has a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Contrasting form lately; tendency to jump/hang left would be a concern on this track
runners.name: Belle Le Grand
runners.spotlight: Won first two hurdle races in May but something of a contrast lately, falling at Ludlow when still in with a shout but modest efforts either side; could bounce back, but her recent tendency to jump/hang left would be a concern on this track; stable also runs Ghasham.

stable_tour.quote: She won twice over hurdles for us earlier in the year but found the soft ground against her at Hexham on Friday and ran below par. We'll find some better ground for her through the winter and hopefully in the spring there'll be some nicer races for her. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Pulled up in both starts over hurdles for this yard; has undergone wind surgery
runners.name: Ilot De Lisle
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner in France in the autumn of 2022 but pulled up in both starts over hurdles since returning for this yard in January; last month's wind surgery will need to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Has proved consistent this year; the slight drop in trip should suit; high on the list
runners.name: As Fast As Wind
runners.spotlight: Consistent this year over hurdles and on the Flat, beaten under a length into third of 11 on stable debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft) last time; up 3lb but the slight drop in trip should suit; high on the list.

runners.breeder: A Obrien,M Al Monsour& K Al Attiyah
runners.comment: 2-26 strike-rate but he can't be ruled out, especially if benefiting from the wind surgery
runners.name: Ghasham

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Maiden
quotes.quote: Ghasham is a massive big horse and looks progressive. It was a nice performance and there is a lot of improvement to come from him. He loved that ground and was very tough - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Placed over 2m4f at Worcester in two of his three starts for this yard; strike-rate is not the best but he can't be ruled out, especially if benefiting from the wind surgery since latest outing.

runners.comment: Up 7lb, but shaped as though a longer trip would suit when winning last time; respected
runners.name: Secret Vino

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Virgin 519 Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We bred Secret Vino ourselves at home, so it's lovely. He was sort of on the back burner behind everyone else for a little bit. He's been improving with every run. He hasn't had a lot of races, so he needs to get a bit more experience before we aim for anything too high - Tom Ellis, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Improving steadily and did well to get up and break his duck at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month; 7lb higher and the hood worn on last two outings is missing, but he shaped last time as though returning to further would suit and he remains open to improvement; respected.

runners.comment: Early promise but last three efforts have been disappointing; something to prove
runners.name: Jehol De Thaix
runners.spotlight: Promise in a bumper and a hurdle race in his first two starts but last three efforts have been disappointing, including on handicap debut; something to prove.

11:57.race_name: winningpost.co.uk Play Prize Champion Tipster Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Course record of 112 includes a win in this race last year;  in the equation back here.
runners.name: Motazzen

quotes.race: Jordan Road Surfacing Highways Solution Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Motazzen has his mojo working at the moment, and to be honest he's been well placed, too. The race cut up, but it's still brilliant how he picked up. He was having a good old look around in front - Paul O'Brien, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Has a course record of 112, winning last year's renewal (middle leg of a three-timer) off a 13lb lower mark; scored on the Flat in August and ran up to his best back over hurdles when second here (2m1f, good) and at Stratford (2m2f, good to soft) in October; had a rare off day when eighth of nine at Wetherby last month but must come into the equation back here.

stable_tour.quote: We acquired this son of Dubawi from the Shadwell dispersal, having won twice in France for Jean-Claude Rouget over 1m2½f and 1m5f. We have had him gelded and he appears to be showing more speed than he did in France. His work has been pleasing and there are a couple of handicaps next week at Chester I have in mind. He came highly recommended from Shadwell, and it made sense for us to buy him. He is a very interesting newcomer to the team. 27-04-22

runners.comment: Relished heavy ground when winning with authority at Uttoxeter; 3lb well in under penalty
runners.name: Morning Mayhem
runners.spotlight: Had been well beaten on all previous completed starts over hurdles, including in two handicaps for current stable, but he relished heavy ground when winning with authority at Uttoxeter (2m) seven days ago; incurs a 7lb penalty but is due to go up 10lb; may need the ground to soften up even more in order to reproduce his best.

runners.comment: Pulled up on his latest chase start and reverts to hurdles in first-time cheekpieces.
runners.name: King Of Highways
runners.spotlight: 0-7 under rules but made a pleasing start over fences on his handicap debut when third of four finishers at Lingfield (2m4f, good) last month; pulled up on his latest chase start and reverts to hurdles in first-time cheekpieces; yard going well and he's not out of this.

stable_tour.quote: He ran very pleasingly when third in his first chase at Lingfield last week, which was also his first handicap. He ran green, hanging badly to the left, and I'd like to think he could have won if he'd got on and not messed around a bit. I think it's certainly within his compass to win a little 0-100 race. It was a solid first run over fences but maybe he wasn't quite concentrating as much as he should have done. 01-12-25

runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles but made a pleasing return when fourth of 11 here last month.
runners.name: Bradman
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but made a pleasing return when fourth of 11 here (2m5f, good to soft; 80-1) last month with cheekpieces on for the first time over hurdles (retained); holds place claims if he can reproduce that run.

runners.breeder: Herve Robert & Mrs Adeline De Vitton
runners.comment: Has three wins over hurdles but tailed off on return at Leicester last month.
runners.name: Goguenard

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Goguenard's work and his ability has never been the problem but his physical ability has, he's had huge issues. My vet, Kevin Bishop, found a problem and we jabbed him in his neck, we put some cortisone in, and it's just changed him. That said, he's still a very fragile horse so we'll enjoy today. He's owned by a group of my greatest mates and they've been incredibly patient - and probably wish I was a bit more boisterous about how he was going but as a trainer you err on the side of caution. If we can keep him sound, the boys will have a bit of fun - DJ Jeffreys, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three wins over hurdles but he was tailed off at Leicester (2m4f, soft) last month on return from a break; still 1lb higher than his last winning mark at Stratford in March 2024 and best watched for now.

runners.comment: Stamina stretched over 3m last time; only 1lb higher than for his course win in October.
runners.name: Atlantic Power
runners.spotlight: Two solid efforts over 2m5f on good to soft here in the autumn, getting off the mark in October following six months off and following that with a third last month; stamina may have been stretched when last of seven at Wincanton (3m) 22 days ago and he is only 1lb higher than for his course win.

12:32.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Too Much Turkey Handicap Chase (Fontwell Chase Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Made a crucial mistake four out on chase debut at Leicester; trip suits; claims
runners.name: Jackeline
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner at Hereford (2m, good to soft) last December; lost her chance with a mistake four out on her chase debut at Leicester (2m6f, good to firm) 22 days ago; drop back in trip should suit and she holds claims.

runners.comment: Scored on seasonal/stable debut at Worcester in September and placed on last three runs.
runners.name: Superstylin
runners.spotlight: Scored on seasonal/stable debut at Worcester (2m, good) in September and placed on last three appearances, most recently when second of eight at Lingfield (2m, soft) 13 days ago; ought to make his presence felt.

stable_tour.quote: I think he's very good fun in 0-100 2m chases. He got a little win at Worcester in September and he ran very well again to come third at Warwick the other day. He's running very consistently but he doesn't find much off the bridle, so we might ride him a little bit cold and try to deliver him on the line. He's a tough horse who seems to take his races well and hopefully his time will come again this season. 01-12-25

runners.comment: Has a lower chase mark on his seasonal/stable debut but is still hard to fancy
runners.name: Chankaya
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles for Mitchell Hunt in February 2024 but well held in five starts over hurdles for Tim Vaughan last term; returns to fences (well held on first attempt) off lower chase mark on his seasonal/stable debut but hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Returned to form when winning at Hereford last month; second next time and unseated since.
runners.name: Mcgrath From Clune
runners.spotlight: Back to form when winning at Hereford (2m, good; 33-1) last month, then runner-up at Newcastle (2m, good to soft) before unseating two out at Taunton (going best) 15 days ago; now 8lb higher than the latest success but still well treated on past Irish form.

13:07.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made a winning start over hurdles here in October and good third at Kempton last month.
runners.name: Fortune Timmy
runners.spotlight: Bought for £40,000 in January after finishing second in an Irish maiden point; made a winning start over hurdles here (2m3f, good to soft) in October, with two subsequent winners behind, and improved again when third of five finishers at Kempton (2m, good) last month; looks a nice prospect.

stable_tour.quote: We got him from the Cheltenham sales. He didn't get on the track last season because the ground dried up very rapidly. He came out this season and won his maiden really nicely at Fontwell and he was third at Kempton on Monday.I want to get him qualified for the EBF Final at Sandown in the spring. 01-12-25

runners.comment: Won bumper and hurdle debut here; open to improvement back on this course
runners.name: Fountains Blenhein
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner here in March and made a successful hurdles debut over C&D (good to soft) in October; hung right-handed when last of three finishers at Plumpton (2m4f, good) last month but may be a different proposition back here, open to improvement.

runners.comment: Belied 80-1 SP when fourth of 15 on hurdling debut at Newbury; open to improvement
runners.name: Fashion Hunter
runners.spotlight: Belied his massive odds when fourth of 15 on hurdling debut at Newbury (2m, soft; 80-1) last month; fascinating contender who may well take a step forward today.

runners.comment: Down the field in two bumpers late last year and finished last on hurdles debut recently.
runners.name: Midsummer Dream
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two bumpers late last year and finished last of eight on hurdles debut at Leicester  this month; easy to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Irish point winner who won bumper on rules debut last month; hurdles debut.
runners.name: Rathkenny
runners.spotlight: Won Irish point in April and off to a flying start under rules in a four-runner bumper at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) last month; promising on hurdles debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse owned by Robert Waley-Cohen, for whom we won the bet365 Gold Cup with The Young Master. He's a big galloper who won a point-to-point in April. He has a high cruising speed and can stay at it. 12-11-25

13:42.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Extra Places Paid Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Only 1-13 over hurdles but he rediscovered some form when beaten under 5l at Newbury
runners.name: Kruger Park

quotes.race: Howden Supporting West Berkshire Mencap Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground didn't worry Kruger Park much as he's a Kapgarde who stays forever. He's beginning to learn at long last. He'll be a chaser next season and a lovely one, but he's taken a long time to come right. He ran off the course at Taunton last season and has been a real baby, but today is the best he's behaved and he travelled and jumped well, while Freddie gave him a super ride. He wasn't easy to break in and is a typical Kapgarde - they take forever. He was a boy and wasn't straightforward last year, but he's got there now - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Only 1-13 over hurdles but rediscovered some form when beaten under 5l at Newbury (3m, soft) latest and this represents a drop in grade; has to be considered.

runners.comment: Won his maiden hurdle here; fell on chase debut latest; wouldn't be exposed just yet
runners.name: Dwight K Schrute

quotes.race: Birchwood Kia - Chichester, Driven By You Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll keep Dwight K Schrute on the go for the next 6-8 weeks but he'll have a break over the summer before going over fences next season - Jamie Snowden, trainer, talking to Sky Sports.

runners.spotlight: Won his maiden hurdle here on good ground in March; that was over 2m3f but he stayed 2m7f when close up in a Worcester novice in October; fell mid-race on chase debut last time; he wouldn't be exposed just yet.

stable_tour.quote: He's an English point-to-point winner and won nicely in a novice hurdle at Fontwell last season. He ran well under a penalty when third at Worcester last month over two miles seven furlongs and he stays well. I'm looking forward to seeing him over a fence, and he should be nicely handicapped to progress. 05-11-25
Another who has joined us from the point-to-point sphere, where he won his sole start. He was ridden by Freddie Mitchell, who used to be my assistant and he recommended him to us. 28-09-23

runners.comment: She won easily back over hurdles in a small field at Uttoxeter; now 7lb higher
runners.name: Jalisco Star
runners.spotlight: Progressive hurdler last season and, having struggled over fences on her first two runs this term, she won easily back hurdling in a small field at Uttoxeter (2m7f, soft); 7lb higher now but respected nevertheless.

runners.comment: Pulled up over fences last time but five of six wins have been over hurdles; inconsistent
runners.name: Striking A Pose
runners.owner: S Clare G Kennington & C Knowles

prev_owners.owner: S Clare G Kennington C Knowles & J Reed
I & C Gosden, M Sharp & G Kennington

quotes.race: Kenn Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose is rated 130 so he was supposed to win like that. He's a nice chap and a gorgeous-looking horse and it was nice to watch all the way round - his ears were pricked and he didn't put a foot wrong. I think 2m4f is perfect, he's got a bit of class about him so he's not short of speed. I'm sure he'll end up over 3m but this trip is fine on genuine soft ground. I don't think we'll step him up to three this season. We've got some options now, he's qualified for the EBF Final at Sandown in a couple of weeks. He's probably not an Albert Bartlett horse but he might be competitive at Sandown, or he could go to Aintree. I expect we'll lean to Sandown. He'll be a lovely chaser for next season - Joe Tizzard, assistant to trainer Colin Tizzard.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing "National Hunt" Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose has learnt his job over two miles and the form from Ascot looked quite nice. He's a point-to-point winner so stepping him up in trip worked a treat. He's a gorgeous-looking four-year-old and is a nice horse who's at the right end of the handicap who we hope will continue progressing through the ranks. He'll go over fences next season and he won't run again until the new year. - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer

runners.spotlight: Pulled up over fences last time but five of his six wins have been over hurdles; not that consistent even in this discipline but he's capable of going well.

stable_tour.quote: He just seems to love it at Exeter. We could back over fences soon but he was third the other day and that was a good run, so we'll probably pick and choose with him. The handicapper has had his say with him though. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Five chase wins but now returns to hurdling (0-6) after a long absence; best watched
runners.name: Blade Runner

quotes.race: Littlehampton Welding Ltd Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Blade Runner keeps surprising me because he shows very little at home - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Horse Racing At Betting.Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Blade Runner is still quite green and that was his first time over fences but I wanted to get him chasing sooner rather than later. He's done it well but Tom said he was looking all over the place. I've been in a little bit of a hurry since I bought him from Cheltenham sales, got handicapped and brought him here today. He's going to be a horse that's going to be benefitted from being chucked out in the field soon but we might have one more run with him this season - Chris Gordon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on his highs over fences but became hard to predict in that discipline and now returns to hurdling (0-6) after a long absence; could still be a factor, especially should market vibes bode well.

runners.comment: In form; perhaps has her share of weight but the new visor might give her a lift
runners.name: Malago Rose

quotes.race: Betting Better With Sky Bet Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I went a bit soon, but Malago Rose has outstayed them despite there being no pace early - Freddie Mitchell, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Shaped well over C&D in early November after a break and another good run at Lingfield when returned to 2m7f; perhaps has her share of weight but the new visor might give her a lift (replaces cheekpieces).

14:17.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Money Back Specials Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Initial promise; beaten 17l and 24l in two handicaps but it's still early days
runners.name: Risk It All
runners.owner: Keith F J Loads & Harry Redknapp
runners.spotlight: Won his only Flat race in France and he shaped with plenty of promise in his first two starts over hurdles; beaten 17l and 24l in his two handicaps (the latest after a break and wind surgery) but it's too early to be getting negative.

stable_tour.quote: A bit of a frustrating horse last season, but he's always promised a lot in his work at home. Maybe he was just a bit immature last winter and he's had his wind done, which should help. He'll stay over hurdles and it wouldn't surprise me to see him come good this term. 28-10-25

runners.comment: Has evidently found his level after a successful handicap debut (2m4f); penalised
runners.name: Grand Conqueror
runners.spotlight: Placed in an Irish point; tailed off in his first three runs over hurdles but he made a winning handicap debut at Plumpton (2m4f, good to soft) 11 days ago, ridden out; penalised accordingly (down 1lb in future) and this is a shorter trip but he's evidently found his level.

runners.breeder: Haras Du Hoguenet & Mr Gilles Lebaron
runners.comment: Quiet on return but placed in three consecutive handicaps last winter
runners.name: Ami Bondhu
runners.spotlight: Placed in three consecutive handicaps last winter (2m-2m5f; good to soft/soft) but he made a low-key reappearance in October; if bouncing back from that he wouldn't be without hope.

stable_tour.quote: He's a soft-ground horse. He badly needed his first run back at Stratford in October. I think he'll get 3m when he learns to settle but it'll be 2m4f for now. He's a busy little horse who always wants to get on with it, and I think he'll be stepping up in trip by the end of the season. I think he's handicapped to win. 03-12-25

runners.comment: Competitive form off this mark over hurdles but has been absent a long time
runners.name: No Mean Feat
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who tried chasing on one occasion; competitive form off this mark over hurdles but he's been absent a long time.

14:52.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Daily Price Boosts Handicap Chase

runners.comment: C&D winner; never competitive latest but now back at a more realistic level
runners.name: Record High
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over C&D (heavy) in February when 3lb lower and ran up to that level when second of five finishers over C&D (good to soft) in October; unable to get competitive when well held here (3m3f, good to soft) last month but warrants another chance back at this more realistic level.

runners.comment: Didn't shine in her three starts over fences in October/November; hard to fancy.
runners.name: Midnight Gold
runners.spotlight: Sole success came over hurdles in June 2023; didn't shine in her three starts over fences in October/November; first-time visor replaces usual cheekpieces but she is hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Third on his handicap debut over hurdles at Plumpton last month; chase debut.
runners.name: Minella Kaiser
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles but made a pleasing start to the season when third on his handicap debut at Plumpton (3m1f, good) last month; may be a different proposition now he goes over fences with soft ground likely to be in his favour.

stable_tour.quote: It was a pleasing run in his first handicap hurdle at Plumpton last week when he finished third to a good thing of Nicky Henderson's. He finished off his race very well but he really wants a fence in front of him and a lot of mud. He needs proper soft ground, which is proving very hard to find this season. 01-12-25

runners.comment: Both wins over fences have been over 3m at Ffos Las, latest on soft last month.
runners.name: Esperti

quotes.race: Buckley Agri Listowel & McHale Farm Machinery INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Esperti did it nicely, his first run was very good and the form worked out really well but he ran very flat when we fancied him in Galway. He came back to form today and ran a cracker. Derek rode him with loads of confidence, he dropped him in and got him switched off - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Both chase wins have been over 3m at Ffos Las, the latest on soft last month; rated much higher over hurdles two seasons ago and may have wiggle room off his current mark.

stable_tour.quote: His form is a little bit in and out. He was very good in winning his bumper at Listowel but he didn't perform the last day at Punchestown but the race was run at a pedestrian pace and that wouldn't suit him. H's a horse you have to settle out the back and Punchestown turning into a sprint just didn't work out for him at all. H's a brilliant jumper but, being a four-year-old, h's going to stick to bumpers for now. H'll have a run after Christmas and hopefully he will end up in some of those festival bumpers. 08-12-21

runners.comment: Ran well here when dead-heating for second place last month; not out of this.
runners.name: Ronnies Reflection
runners.spotlight: Both chase wins over 2m6f at Leicester (soft and heavy) but he ran well here (2m5f, good to soft) when dead-heating for second last month; below form at Leicester latest but fairly treated and not out of this.

runners.comment: 1-29 and beaten 29l by Esperti at Ffos Las last month.
runners.name: Dysania
runners.spotlight: 1-29 and beaten 29l by Esperti at Ffos Las (3m, soft) last month; has it all to do and 1lb out of the weights.

15:27.race_name: tigerbet.co.uk Happy New Year Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Irish point winner; clear at one point in an Ascot bumper  before finishing second
runners.name: Double The Dance
runners.spotlight: Bought for 100,000euros after winning an Irish point; clear at one stage before finishing second in an Ascot bumper (good; raced freely) and, although that form has taken some knocks, it was a good first run under rules.

stable_tour.quote: He cost €100,000 after winning his point-to-point in Ireland. He's done his first two bits of work nicely and I think he'll be up to winning a bumper for sure. 28-10-25

runners.breeder: F Aimez, Ms L Aimez & P Aimez
runners.comment: Only narrowly failed at Chepstow (soft) and the winner was well touted
runners.name: Half Hoping
runners.spotlight: Failed only narrowly at Chepstow (soft) last month against a winner who was well touted after pushing a good horse close in his only Irish point; that winner, No Walkover, runs at Aintree 3.25 today; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He was beaten only a nose on his first start in a bumper by a highly regarded one of David Pipe's called No Walkover at Chepstow. It didn't surprise me that he was thereabouts, but it did surprise me that he got so close. I didn't think he'd be streetwise enough to win a bumper, especially when the form was there for everyone to see with the Pipe horse. He's still very green but I was absolutely thrilled with him. He's a stayer in the making but schools beautifully and loves the game. We'll probably wait for next season to go hurdling - he'll have a couple more runs in bumpers and then it'll be hurdling with him, but he's going to end up wanting a trip because all he does is stay. 03-12-25

runners.breeder: Emmanuel Chevalier Du Fau Et Al
runners.comment: Beaten 11l but ran well for a long way here two months ago (favourite)
runners.name: Lancelot Vivo
runners.spotlight: Beaten 11l when favourite for a bumper here (good to soft) two months ago but he ran well for a long way up front and that wasn't too bad a race.

runners.breeder: M Devilder & Earl Les Obeaux Danjou
runners.comment: Dam half-sister to three successful jumpers; watching brief is probably best
runners.name: Lancier Des Obeaux
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Label Des Obeaux (smart 2m4f hurdle/3m chase), Luna Des Obeaux (French 1m7f hurdle) and Le Brionneau (2m4f cross-country chase); watching brief is probably best.

runners.comment: £100,000 3yo; seventh foal; brother to 10.5f Flat (RPR 86)/2m hurdle winner Style De Vole
runners.name: Style De Folie
runners.spotlight: £100,000 3yo; seventh foal; brother to 10.5f Flat (RPR 86) and 2m hurdle winner Style De Vole, half-brother to three winners including Style De Garde (useful 2m/2m1f hurdle/chase); dam French 2m1f-2m4f hurdle/chase winner; had wind surgery prior to this debut and goes in a tongue-tie; market helpful and trainer has had two bumper wins this week with new recruits.

runners.comment: Bought for £30,000 after showing ability in Irish points, beaten 5l in the latest
runners.name: West Along
runners.spotlight: Bought for £30,000 after showing ability in Irish points; beaten 5l in the latest, about 2l behind the runner-up who went close in a Musselburgh maiden hurdle last week.

11:45.race_name: Sprayclad UK NE Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.comment: Decent novice hurdler last term; not so good over fences so far; stable in better form now
runners.name: Sayva

quotes.race: Dunes Bowling Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We found a good opportunity for Sayva today. I really liked him when he won his bumper. I was very happy with him going to Sedgefield but, with it being his first run over hurdles, I wasn't going to be able to ride him how I did today. But, with the benefit of a run, he was very straightforward today - Richie McLernon, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Quite a useful novice over hurdles last season; hasn't run up to his best in two runs over fences but stable is in much better form of late; could go well.

stable_tour.quote: He needed the run on his debut over hurdles at Sedgefield and stripped fitter for that when winning comfortably at Newcastle last week. He likes good ground and we'll probably look for another race under a penalty. He might go for one of those races on Trials day at Musselburgh in February in the long term and should be capable of winning plenty of races. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Two hurdle wins last term (one here); shaped well over fences, close 2nd latest; player
runners.name: Scorsese
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles last season, latterly over 2m4f here (good); has run well in the last two races over fences, falling at last when in front at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) before finishing neck second at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft); 7lb claimer is recruited; major chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fine horse who won his last couple of races over hurdles and I think he'll make a nice chaser - he's got the presence and the stamp. I was happy enough with him at Cheltenham on his reappearance. We took the blinkers off as we felt he shouldn't really need them first time over fences - he'd have enough to look at without worrying what was behind him! We went there as we hope he can return later in the season. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Irish point winner (3m); two hurdle wins last term; quite interesting on chase debut
runners.name: Double Digits
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner (3m, yielding); two wins over hurdles last term (2m/2m1f, good); quite interesting on chase debut, although below par on only attempt at this trip under rules.

runners.comment: Won three small-field chases for Dan Skelton; below best for new yard; bit to prove now
runners.name: Lady Jago
runners.spotlight: Won three small-field chases on good ground at up to 3m1f for Dan Skelton; bought for £10,000 in July and hasn't recaptured her best form for new yard.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden very well and has been second since to two nice horses. She'll go into handicaps, where she'll continue to pay her way, and she'll jump a fence in time. 12-11-24

runners.comment: Ex-French; dual chase winner, latest in November; soft ground suits; could go well
runners.name: Jermyn Raffles
runners.spotlight: Ex-French; has won twice over fences, latterly at Durtal in November (2m4f, soft); sold for 13,000euros since; hard to relate to British form, but soft ground suits and he's worth a market check on stable debut.

runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner at up to 2m4f; didn't show much on chase debut but better is likely
runners.name: Ailt An Chorrain
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner, most recently in a 2m4f Newcastle novice in March (good); bit disappointing since, including on chase debut at Newcastle last time; however, improvement on that can be expected.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely horse who we put in at the deep end at Cheltenham in October. He ran well in a really good race but didn't handle the track. It was only his second run after he won on his debut at Perth and he was babyish. We've freshened him up and he'll probably run in the next few weeks on a flat track like Newcastle or Wetherby. He'll be better over fences - that's what he was bought for. 11-12-24

runners.comment: Won two chases at about 2m last term; well beaten on reappearance; stamina to prove
runners.name: Raffles Wonder

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Go North One Man Series Final Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The wind operation has made a big difference to Raffles Wonder, he's got a bit of confidence and pulled clear nicely. I hope he'll go on because he goes on ground much softer than this - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won two chases last term, the first over 2m here (good); didn't show a lot on Hexham reappearance but should be all the better for that run; could go well but best form is at shorter.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Sedgefield in 16-10-24

runners.comment: Five course wins, the latest in this race in 2024; should improve on last run; a possible
runners.name: Tom Creen
runners.spotlight: All five wins have been here, the latest in this race off this mark in 2024; should have come on for his reappearance run; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He's another legend; we just need to run him at Sedgefield. He loves the place and has won there five times. He's virtually on a career-high mark but we'll give it another go with him at Sedgefield, possibly over 3m. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Fontwell winner for Paul Nicholls; well-beaten 3rd on stable debut; better can be expected
runners.name: Fortunate Fella
runners.spotlight: Fontwell winner for Paul Nicholls in May (2m3f, good); well-beaten third on stable debut; better today is likely.

runners.comment: Beat a subsequent winner at Bangor last time and should be on the premises again
runners.name: Atlantic Lad
runners.spotlight: Ran to his best when beating subsequent winner Judicial Deference over a similar trip at Bangor (soft) last time; has a penalty to carry but should give another good account.

stable_tour.quote: A cheapish buy who ran some really nice races last season. He's very tall - nearly 17 hands - and quite narrow and a bit immature. He could go chasing straight away. 30-10-25

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner; respectable effort on hurdle debut but more needed
runners.name: Cold Henry
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner in 2022 but hasn't added to his tally; respectable effort on hurdle debut last time but plenty more needed if he's to win this.

runners.comment: Disappointed on hurdle debut; much better last time and has strong claims; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Dalston Lad
runners.owner: Cherry Knoll Farm, M Ward & D Skelton

prev_owners.owner: Cherry Knoll Farm, M&T Ward & D Skelton

quotes.race: William Hill More Top Prices Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elim) (Go North Jodami Qual) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Dalston Lad is a really likeable type. He's straightforward and ground it out well. He won pretty easily. He'll be a nice horse for hurdles - Kielan Woods, rider.

runners.spotlight: Decent bumper performer; disappointed at Cheltenham on hurdle debut but better effort at Doncaster last time; cheekpieces fitted and he has strong claims in an uncompetitive event.

stable_tour.quote: He won two bumpers last season and was over the top by the time he went to Cheltenham, so we were hopeful of a good run when he went back there for his reappearance. He was very disappointing, though, so we gastroscoped him and it turned out he has ulcers, which surprised us because he was going well at home. We'll get them treated and go again. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Placed in a point and bumper; needs a second look on this hurdle debut
runners.name: Daly Boy
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point on debut and third in a bumper at Ayr in March on first rules start; stable among the winners and he needs a second look on this hurdles debut.

stable_tour.quote: A horse we really like. The form of his bumper has worked out well and he's going to be a lovely novice hurdler. He's big and strong and wants proper soft ground. He could do well in handicaps in the spring. 20-11-25

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on his hurdle/rules debut last time and needs a big step forward
runners.name: Loulou Madrik
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability in points but soundly beaten on his rules/stable debut and will likely struggle on these terms.

runners.comment: Hinted at ability in points but well beaten on hurdle debut and she has plenty to find
runners.name: Perfectot
runners.spotlight: Showed ability at an ordinary level on first two bumper starts but well beaten since, including on hurdle debut last time; tongue-tie now fitted but she has plenty to find.

stable_tour.quote: I bought her as a yearling in France and I've had her a while. Her sire has been doing well on the Flat and she'll be one for National Hunt junior bumpers and novice hurdles. She looks smart. 16-10-24

12:50.race_name: Castle Construction North East Ltd EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Progressive hurdler; needs to raise his game again but no surprise should he do so
runners.name: Bohemond Antioch
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in bumpers and improved with every outing over hurdles; needs to raise his game again but no surprise should he do so.

runners.comment: Turned over at a short price last time and looking exposed but should go close in this
runners.name: Country Park
runners.spotlight: Disappointed at Market Rasen last time and is looking exposed but should be better for that first run in over six months and stable has won with four of last 14 runners; should go well.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky not to win a novice hurdle last year, including when coming down at the second-last when going well at Ascot in December. He's still a novice for this year, should improve for his comeback at Market Rasen and can hopefully progress this season. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Soundly beaten and unlikely to be making an impact on these unfavourable terms
runners.name: Onehundredneighty
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in a point, in bumpers and over hurdles; makes no appeal.

runners.comment: Respectable effort on hurdle debut but pedigree suggests she'll be suited by further
runners.name: Gintime
runners.spotlight: Respectable efforts in bumpers and a similar story on her hurdle debut; she'll likely step up on that form but her pedigree suggests she'll be ideally suited by further.

13:25.race_name: Ready To Welcome The New Year Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)

runners.breeder: David Lumet & Dr V Catherine Lumet
runners.comment: Won at Newton Abbot in September but fell next time and well beaten on most recent outing
runners.name: Jaitroplaclasse
runners.spotlight: Notched first win at Newton Abbot in September; in the process of running well when falling next time but well beaten at Wincanton latest; chance if bouncing back.

stable_tour.quote: Michael Blencowe hasn't had much luck for us and I was hoping this fella, who is beautiful, would change that, but he disappointed at Kempton in March. He looks the part and we just need to unlock his talent. 30-10-23

runners.comment: Already a better chaser than a hurdler and has leading claims once again
runners.name: Dixie Cowboy
runners.spotlight: Already a better chaser than a hurdler, winning over C&D on chase debut last month and running to a similar level on heavy ground at Hexham last time; leading claims.

stable_tour.quote: He's coming back from injury, having not raced since the spring of last year, when he got a leg at Stratford. He's going well at home and has pleased us in a racecourse gallop. We'll mix and match between hurdles and fences. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Creditable run in November following a long absence; last run may well have come too soon
runners.name: Take Centre Stage
runners.spotlight: Has not had much racing but patchy form since winning at Newcastle nearly two years ago (first-time visor); shaped as though retaining much of his ability in November following 11-month break and latest run may have come too quickly; gets blinkers and no surprise to see him go well.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half brother to Tommy's Oscar and came to us after finishing fourth on his only start in a Punchestown bumper. He showed signs of weakness last year but after a long summer break at his owners' farm he has come in much heavier and stronger. His schooling is electric and he now looks a different horse entirely. His work is much better and he should be ready to start off in a novice hurdle by the middle of October, provided the ground is soft. 28-09-22

runners.comment: Infrequent winner these days; patchy form this year and may again find one or two too good
runners.name: Restandbethankful

quotes.race: Breedon Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'd love to say I gave him a peach of a ride, but Restandbethankful ran away with me. I rode him in work at home and he did exactly that, but you don't mind it when they're winning - Tommy Dowson, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Has won only once since 2023 and form has been patchy this year (reportedly stiff when pulling up last time); has slipped in the weights and is back down in trip in refitted cheekpieces but may again find one or two too good.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay on his first start at Chepstow when he lacked experience. He works like he's on a decent mark and that run will have stood him in good stead. He's capable of winning on nice ground over hurdles. 21-10-21

He was a good winner over 2m at Huntingdon last time in a handicap hurdle and that form has received quite a boost with the runner-up, Zacony Rebel, bolting up last week at Ludlow by 12 lengths. There is a good handicap in two weeks' time at Musselburgh's big meeting that is his likely next assignment and off a 6lb higher mark he should continue to be competitive. 26-01-22

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner who has run to a similar level on last three starts over fences; claims
runners.name: Huit Reflets
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who has run to a similar level on last three outings over fences; drops back in distance and should give another good account.

stable_tour.quote: He's had four runs since we purchased him in Ireland and he's been third, third, second and second - including last time out at Hexham behind Halpha Soleil. He looks certain to be getting his head in front soon as the first three at Hexham came a long way clear - he just bumped into one there. 14-06-24

runners.comment: Uneven form since last win in 2024; respectable run last time but not sure to build on it
runners.name: Zaras Universe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs C Hopper And David Carter

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Zara's Universe won two last year and the handicapper has has given her a chance today, plus we've put that good young kid William (Maggs) on board. To be fair to Brian Hughes, he said to put the headgear on last time he rode her so we brought her down to two miles, put headgear on, and everyone's happy - Andrew Crook, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Uneven form since last win in March 2024 and, although she ran respectably at Southwell last time, there's no guarantee she'll build on that.

runners.breeder: R D And Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Ran well over C&D in November but fell next time and below best on his most recent outing
runners.name: Blended Stealth
runners.owner: D Mullen, G Barker And Partners
runners.spotlight: Ran well over C&D in November but fell next time and below best on heavy ground at Hexham on latest start; looks one to watch.

14:00.race_name: Michael & Olivia Watson Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Two novice wins last term (2nd over C&D); rather disappointing since; tongue-tie now tried
runners.name: Sign Again

quotes.race: Download The vickers.bet App Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sign Again is a nice horse. We'll take our time with him as he's a bit of a baby still but he's good. The Jennie Candlish horse [Pigeon House] had some good form but we were carrying 5lb less, so it was the right thing to do to take our chance and see what we could do. He'll be a nice chaser in time, so we won't hurry him. I think we'll try off a double penalty next with a claimer on although we might take a look at the Sidney Banks - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

quotes.race: Racehorse Sanctuary Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Sign Again and expected more of him in the bumper at Bangor, but he had to make the running and he was green as anything. He was overpriced in this and, even though it wasn't the greatest race, he's gone and proved he's better than average - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won novice hurdles at Plumpton (2m4f, good) 13 months ago and over C&D on this card last year (good to soft); disappointing since, including both runs following a wind operation this season; may fare better with a tongue-tie now tried.

stable_tour.quote: He's one I really like. He won a race at Plumpton last week, it was only a four-runner race but he won very comfortably with his head in his chest. We were disappointed with his bumper but he had to make it that day, which he didn't want to do. We rode him the correct way at Plumpton, and while he might not have beaten superstars, he couldn't have done it more impressively. I'd like to think he could win under a penalty and show a lot more. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Won on stable debut with blinkers tried in July; never travelled latest; could bounce back
runners.name: Broughshane
runners.owner: H I K, Tj Houlbrooke, Ann Docker

quotes.race: Unibet Moneyback As Cash Races Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Broughshane is a chaser, but I thought we would give him a go over hurdles and see where we are at. His work was very good at home and we schooled him in blinkers the other day and it really sharpened him up. James [Bowen, jockey] said once he hit the front he was just doing enough. He did knuckle down and I think he will only improve as well from here as he is a lovely horse. I'm very excited about him. His point-to-point rating was 95 in Ireland and it is only the very elite that have that. His form had never dipped really, and although it wasn't at high levels, he had always run nice races. We did think he would have a good chance, but we do think he is a chaser - Mickey Bowen, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won twice for Jonjo O'Neill last year and gained a third success on stable debut at Market Rasen in July (2m4f, good; blinkered first time); never travelled when pulled up last time; no surprise if he were to bounce back.

stable_tour.quote: He showed some good form over hurdles last season, finishing third on Welsh National day and looking like he was going to go close when falling three out back at Chepstow in January. He got off the mark first time out this season at Fontwell and could be going over fences now. He handles soft ground well and will stay three miles. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Three wins last term, the third for Ella McGarry at Ayr in April; now 10lb higher
runners.name: Summergrounds

quotes.race: Racing Post Go North Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Summergrounds is a consistent little horse and he loves this ground. Danny gave him a great ride, they were getting at it and he just took his time - Nicky Richards, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three wins last season, latest off 10lb lower for today's rider Ella McGarry at Ayr in April (2m4f, good to soft); creditable efforts latest two outings but had edged further up the weights and may find others better treated.

runners.comment: Carlisle win in October 2024; bit disappointing this term but on a good mark now
runners.name: Blue Fin

quotes.race: Think Smart At Vertem Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blue Fin is a lovely, sweet horse, he's just learning his job nicely. We won't get carried away, he'll have one or two more runs in novice hurdles then be a lovely novice handicap chaser next season. He's a half-brother to the staying chaser Viva Steve and he has a nice pedigree - Donald McCain, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won at Carlisle in October last year (2m1f, soft); bit disappointing this season, stepped back up to this sort of trip last time, but he's on a good mark now and not out of it.

runners.comment: Won over 2m1f here in December 2024; some fair runs since; tongue-tie tried; trip a worry
runners.name: Kingston Narcissus
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when winning a maiden hurdle here last December (2m1f, soft); some fair efforts since, third at Wetherby last time (2m, soft); tongue-tie is now tried and he could go well, but perhaps better at shorter.

stable_tour.quote: His form over a trip on the Flat in France was good and he'll probably want further than 2m over hurdles in time. He was a very pleasing second in a novice hurdle at Sedgefield last week and looked to love the soft ground. I'm looking forward to him. 16-10-24

runners.comment: Two wins at Perth in 2024 (2m4f, good); below par this term; fair mark but bit to prove
runners.name: Fourofakind
runners.owner: Mrs G Jenkinson And Mrs B Butterworth

prev_owners.owner: Any Excuse For A Holiday Syndicate

quotes.race: Haydock Park Welcomes Racing To School Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: The first time Fourofakind was a bit disappointing and didn't jump properly, but he ran really well at Newbury last time behind a nice horse of Nicky's [Henderson]. I thought this was an appropriate opportunity and he stepped forward and took the chance. The reason he lugs left is his breathing isn't perfect and I'll definitely get that done in the summer. I'm going to take him to Ascot on April 2nd for a valuable handicap, if he gets in, and I think a nice gallop there will bring out the best in him - Harry Derham, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won twice over 2m4f at Perth last year (good); bit disappointing this season, including with a visor last three starts; on a fair mark but a bit to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He's another four-year-old who did well for me last season at a level. He'll stay hurdling and I might run him on the Flat a couple of times at some stage. I suspect he won't start until late November or early December. He'll begin over 2m but I suspect he'll go up in trip. He's a fun horse. 18-10-23

runners.comment: Three wins last month, two of them here; up total 21lb (7lb higher than last win); chance
runners.name: Devon Skies
runners.spotlight: Progressive mare who won three on the bounce last month, two here (2m4f/2m5f, good/soft) and the latest at Market Rasen (2m5f, good to soft); has gone up a total of 21lb (up 7lb for last win) but still one to consider.

runners.comment: Maiden; runner-up on last two starts, latest over 2m5f here; now 2lb higher; contender
runners.name: Livano Bello
runners.spotlight: Has improved for wind surgery and has been runner-up at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) and over 2m5f here (soft; winner was completing a hat-trick) on last two starts; now 2lb higher; major contender.

runners.comment: Won at Carlisle last December; mixed form since, including over fences; poor run latest
runners.name: Heritier

prev_owners.owner: Ursa Major Racing & Mrs E J Quinlan
Gardiner And The Cool Runnings Team

runners.spotlight: Winner over 2m4f off a 6lb higher mark at Carlisle last December (soft); mixed form since, including over fences; needs to bounce back from a disappointing effort last time.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a fantastic purchase from Tattersalls Online for only 10,000gns. He's our first horse with Lizzie Quinlan and has been second for us four times in seven runs, including in the valuable Go North One Man Series Final at Carlisle in April when he just hit the front too soon and was beaten by Trac. His second there was the equivalent of winning four normal races, so that cushioned the blow a bit. There's more to come from him but he does need soft or heavy ground. 14-06-24

runners.comment: Unexposed maiden; good 3rd at Newcastle last time; up in trip for h'cap debut; interesting
runners.name: Miss Friday Lions
runners.spotlight: Unexposed maiden; best of her four runs over hurdles when 66-1 third in Newcastle maiden last time (2m1f, good to soft); up in trip for her handicap debut; interesting.

runners.comment: Ex-Adam Nicol; won at Perth in July; interesting on stable debut but better on good ground
runners.name: Top Flight Century
runners.spotlight: Won a Perth handicap for Adam Nicol in July (2m4f, good); some fair runs since, including when runner-up at Carlisle in October (2m4f, good); could go well on stable debut but ideally suited by good ground.

runners.comment: Placed in 4 UK points; modest form hurdling but this step up to 2m4f should suit him well
runners.name: Kaviar Wood
runners.spotlight: Placed in four of his eight British points; well beaten over hurdles, including on handicap debut in cheekpieces over 2m1f here last time (form ahead is sound); no headgear this time; the longer trip should suit; chance.

runners.comment: 0-12; best run when second to in-form rival over C&D last month; each-way chance
runners.name: Fairly Fulling
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; good second to hat-trick scorer Devon Skies (runs in the 2.00) over C&D last month (soft); fared less well last time; each-way chance.

runners.comment: AW Flat winner; only one hurdle win (2023) and disappointing on last three starts
runners.name: Mr Rumbalicious

prev_owners.owner: Lets Get Ready To Rumble Partnership

quotes.race: Bowness Bay Brewing Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Mr Rumbalicious is a fun horse and I am very pleased with him. I think he will be better on slightly better ground actually but we will see - James Moffatt, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: AW Flat winner; only success over hurdles was at Cartmel in August 2023 (2m1f, soft); fair second at Hexham in June (2m, good to soft) but disappointing since.

stable_tour.quote: His form figures might not show it but he's a straightforward horse who's a really good jumper. It was a momentary lapse when he ducked out at Sedgefield in November and then he somehow managed to unseat his rider last time out at Musselburgh. We'll wait for the better ground in the spring to summer and he might go to Perth before running at Cartmel, where he won last summer. He's gloriously handicapped. 14-02-24

runners.comment: Two wins over 2m1f last term; C&D second in September but disappointing since
runners.name: Balranald
runners.spotlight: Two wins over 2m1f last season, including one here; second over C&D in September (good) but well below his best on both starts since.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden; on a good mark but has not been on top form in recent outings
runners.name: Mr Globalist
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden; has run the occasional good race but needs to improve on recent efforts if he is to get off the mark on his 24th start over hurdles.

15:10.race_name: MW Civils & Groundworks Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB)

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on her debut at Warwick last month and makes no appeal
runners.name: Dame In Disguise
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on her debut at Warwick last month and makes no appeal.

runners.comment: Second of five over C&D on her debut; that form nothing special but she can do better
runners.name: Drakaris
runners.spotlight: Second of five over C&D (soft) on her debut last month; that form is nothing out of the ordinary but she'll likely improve and is a player.

runners.comment: Irish point winner who was picked up for £80,000; interesting rules debut; yard runs two
runners.name: Elderflower Tonic
runners.spotlight: Floored the odds-on favourite last month on second Irish point start and picked up for £80,000 since; interesting runner on rules debut for yard which also runs Eskylady.

runners.comment: Picked up for £260,000 having won a point in October; player on rules debut; yard runs two
runners.name: Eskylady
runners.spotlight: Beat the only other finisher on debut in an Irish point in October and picked up since for £260,000; looks the yard first string (they also run Elderflower Tonic) and she's a fascinating runner on this rules debut.

runners.comment: In process of running well when falling at the second last in point in March; interesting
runners.name: Red Wine Supernova
runners.spotlight: In the process of running well when falling at the penultimate fence in Irish point on her debut in March; has since joined David Pipe, who has won this twice since 2019; interesting runner on this rules debut.

runners.comment: Point winner, has shown a good attitude in winning two bumpers, promising jumping type
runners.name: Ballyfad

quotes.race: Eventsec (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Ballyfad is probably a horse who will be better with a jump in front of him, but these are all horses for the future. I'll speak to Michael and Eddie [O'Leary, owners] and we will make a plan - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a point for Luke Murphy at Fairyhouse in April; purchased for E175,000 to join the Gigginstown team; got on top late on to win a Down Royal bumper on rules debut at the beginning of November; showed a good attitude when following up under a penalty at Punchestown three weeks later; very promising; perhaps will come into his own when tackling further over hurdles.

stable_tour.quote: He was an emphatic winner of a point-to-point at Fairyhouse for Luke Murphy. He's nice. We have no serious work done with him yet and you'll see him out in a bumper just before Christmas. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Fair Flat pedigree, dam won a bumper on good ground, set a tough assignment here on debut
runners.name: Gonewild
runners.spotlight: Free Eagle gelding; first foal; dam bumper winner on good ground, half-sister to three Flat winners, including Shena's Dream, the dam of Group 2 6f 2yo winner Miss Amulet; set a tough assignment here on debut.

runners.comment: Big price when down the field on debut at Fairyhouse late last month, up against it
runners.name: It Will Do Rightly
runners.spotlight: Big price when down the field on debut at Fairyhouse late last month; up against it.

runners.comment: Big price when down the field in maiden hurdles at Gowran and Navan, same likely here
runners.name: Las Brisas Boy
runners.owner: Anthony Vaughan & Mark Phillips & D P Gaffney
runners.spotlight: Not a bad run in mid-division in a Punchestown festival bumper; big price when down the field in maiden hurdles at Gowran and Navan; same likely here.

runners.comment: First foal; dam French/German winner, from a stout German family, hooded for debut
runners.name: Laxxio
runners.owner: Mrs P Crampton & Oliver Crampton & Djcc Investments Limited
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam French/German winner, half-sister to German Derby winner Laccario; family of German Derby winners Lando and Laroche; hooded for debut.

runners.breeder: G A E C Touillon Moiron
runners.comment: One of three runners for Gavin Cromwell, this is a big task for an inexperienced horse
runners.name: Le Midnightdancer
runners.spotlight: E48,000 3yo; first foal; dam placed hurdle/chase in France, half-sister to useful French hurdle/chase winner Valban; one of three runners for Gavin Cromwell; this is a big task for an inexperienced horse.

runners.breeder: M Hughes Rousseau & M Emmanuel Julien Leclerc
runners.comment: Laboured in a valuable sales bumper last season, likely to be capable of much better
runners.name: Le Tatoue Madrik
runners.spotlight: E115,000 3yo; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to two winners, notably smart jumps scorer Niko Has; looked in trouble before halfway when contesting a valuable sales bumper at Fairyhouse in April; likely to be capable of much better.

runners.comment: Five from six in AQPS events, sole runner for the champion trainer, could be hard to beat
runners.name: Leader Dallier
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam twice-raced half-sister to 1m4f AQPS Flat and useful hurdle/chase winner Herbiers; winner of five of his six races in AQPS events at trips ranging from 1m4f to 1m7f; most significant display when taking a Grade 3 event at Vichy in July; sole runner here for the champion trainer.

runners.comment: Stayed well on the Flat, rated a respectable 93, trainer aboard for stable/hurdling debut
runners.name: Mont St Michel

prev_owners.owner: Moyglare Stud Farm & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith

runners.spotlight: 93-rated on the Flat; twice a beaten favourite before winning over 2m1f at Killarney; out of depth in the Group 2 Prix Foy and well below best at the Curragh on final start for Aidan O'Brien; trainer takes the mount on first outing for the stable.

runners.comment: Handicap winner on Flat, unlikely to be in the same league as stablemate Ballyfad.
runners.name: Playtime
runners.spotlight: Handicap win over 1m4f (good) at Chester in September was the highlight of his Flat career for Andrew Balding; unlikely to be in the same league as stablemate Ballyfad.

runners.comment: Twice fourth in points but soundly beaten, towards the rear on hurdles debut at Cork
runners.name: Potters Pal
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to French winners at below 1m; dam unplaced; ordinary form in points, two fourth placings, but soundly beaten; towards the rear on hurdles debut at Cork.

runners.breeder: S C E A Hamel Stud
runners.comment: Half-brother to the smart Botox Has, an interesting unknown quantity for Tim Toe's owner
runners.name: Straight John
runners.spotlight: E170,000 3yo; sixth foal; half-brother to four winners, most notably the smart Botox Has, a multiple winner of Graded races over hurdles, including the Rendlesham in 2024; dam French hurdle/chase winner; an interesting unknown quantity; same owner as Tim Toe, same trainer as Ballyfad.

runners.comment: Has shown a degree of promise in bumpers, lack of hurdling experience is a drawback
runners.name: Thankyouforthedays
runners.spotlight: Two bumper runs; shaped quite well without posing any threat in a 20-runner event at the Punchestown festival; kept on into a distant fourth at Fairyhouse last month; lack of hurdling experience is a drawback.

runners.comment: Impressed in winning a bumper, untidy jumping proved costly at Gowran, still early days
runners.name: Tim Toe
runners.spotlight: Emphatic winner of a good-ground Thurles bumper in March for Pat Doyle; third-placed Galileo Sands won two bumpers in the summer; a ragged round of jumping proved costly when he was a beaten odds-on favourite at Gowran last month on stable/hurdling debut; early days, could feature if his jumping holds up this time; same ownership as Straight John.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay at Gowran in a 2m maiden hurdle. His jumping was a bit deliberate, and he might prefer nicer ground - he'd won a good-ground bumper before that run. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Flat career failed to progress after Dante third, tailed off on hurdles debut at Navan
runners.name: War Rooms

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Dante Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: That was what I expected at Sandown. We were disappointed there but nothing went to plan there and Jim was quick to say put a line through that. I was more favouring going to Newbury on Saturday but fair play to the owners, they were rewarded. The winner looks really smart but we were beaten not far by a Group 1 winner last year. War Rooms won't go to Epsom and we'll keep him for Royal Ascot for the Hampton Court. He's still learning and Jim said we might do more harm than good for the future if we were to go to Epsom - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Simon Piggott Memorial Race EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: War Rooms gave me a good feel. They went a strong pace on the ground and he stayed well. He'll have learnt plenty and has got a good mind on him. He's rangy and will be a lovely horse for next year. Over a mile and a quarter he'll be quite smart - Jim Crowley, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Third in the 2024 Dante and generally kept good company on the Flat in Britain; started brightly in Ireland in the spring; failed to sustain that form and was tailed off on hurdles debut at Navan.

runners.comment: Down the field on hurdling debut, unlikely to feature in a maiden of this standard
runners.name: Wilde Words
runners.owner: F W Healy & Philip Bowe & Ms Margaret Mullins
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in sole point-to-point start; better on hurdling debut at Gowran; major improvement needed to feature in a maiden of this standard.

runners.comment: Rated a modest 62 on the Flat, makes hurdles debut for new yard after a 575-day absence
runners.name: Your Out Of Line
runners.spotlight: Best Flat effort for former yard came in a 1m Gowran cliamer in May 2024; rated a modest 62 on the Flat and makes hurdles debut for new yard after a 575-day absence.

runners.comment: Modest form in bumpers and maiden hurdles for her previous trainer, faces a huge task
runners.name: Frontier Rose
runners.spotlight: Modest form in bumpers and maiden hurdles for her previous trainer; faces a huge task on stable debut.

runners.comment: Point winner, unlikely to be good enough judged on unplaced runs at Clonmel and Thurles
runners.name: Moonlight Paradise
runners.spotlight: Beat a subsequent winner when winning a point for Denis Murphy in April; unlikely to be good enough judged on unplaced runs at Clonmel and Thurles.

runners.comment: Showed up well before fading into sixth in a 22-runner Navan maiden, open to improvement
runners.name: Saveforarainyday
runners.spotlight: Beaten 12l in fourth behind subsequent expensive purchase Clondaw Park when favourite for a heavy-ground point at Lisronagh in February; unfancied at 25-1 on hurdling debut at Navan, showed up well before fading into sixth in a 22-runner contest; open to improvement.

runners.comment: Useful staying handicapper on Flat, ran twice as a juvenile hurdler, needs to find extra
runners.name: Shoda
runners.spotlight: Useful staying handicapper on the Flat; ended the season with a Clonmel win that earned her promotion to a respectable 88; ran twice in juvenile hurdles last season; third in a maiden at Limerick, same placing but well beaten in a small-field Grade 3 event at Naas.

runners.comment: Impressive Cork bumper winner in April; major player switched to hurdles
runners.name: Doctor Du Mesnil

quotes.race: Finbarr Quaid Electrical (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Doctor Du Mesnil is so relaxed. You can ride him any way you want. He's actually even a different horse on grass compared to at home. He picked up, in two strides I had them covered. It's a long way up the straight and I knew I had them covered whenever I wanted. If he can get off the ground at all over a jump he'll be a very good horse. He's a big chaser in the making. I liked the way he quickened up - Jody Townend, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Doctor Dino gelding cost 55,000euros as a 3yo; first foal; dam French 2m1f chase winner; impressive 11l debut winner of 2m3f Cork bumper in April, showing tidy turn of foot (second has since won a maiden hurdle); gelded since; may ideally want further but nonetheless an exciting recruit to the hurdling ranks.

stable_tour.quote: He's quite exciting and looked the part when he won his bumper at Cork. Going on his home work I'd say he's more of a two-and-a-half-mile horse than a two-miler, but we'll see what happens. He's nice and I'm looking forward to seeing how high he can climb over hurdles. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Ability in bumpers but lots to find on recent hurdles debut effort
runners.name: Eagles Quest
runners.owner: Jackie Cullen & A D Mullins & Ms Margaret Mullins

prev_owners.owner: Kieran Stokes & A D Mullins & Ms Margaret Mullins

runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in four bumpers, including two in Britain; ran okay in Curragh Flat maiden but didn't count on recent hurdles debut at Punchestown; others preferred.

runners.comment: Smart bumper form last year for the Moore's; bought for 410,000GBP and debuts for top yard
runners.name: El Cairos

quotes.race: British Horse Society Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Cairos was impressive and he's a nice horse. He's always shown that at home, but the proof is in the pudding here today and it was a rare turn of foot - Gary Moore, trainer.
