runners.spotlight: Recruited for 200,000euros after winning a point for Sean Doyle in April 2024 and smart bumper form last season for Garry & Josh Moore, winning at Newbury, good fifth in Cheltenham Festival Bumper and clear second at Punchestown Festival, having hung left final furlong; bought for 410,000GBP at Cheltenham in October and very interesting recruit for the Elliott team now switched to hurdles.

stable_tour.quote: He's a smashing prospect and we were delighted to get him in the in the David Maxwell dispersal. He showed loads of ability in bumpers and you'd be hoping he could rank highly in the novice hurdling division. He's a big addition to our yard and you'd have to be very excited about him. 26-10-25

runners.comment: 92-rated Flat performer but no show on recent hurdles debut; can only be watched for now
runners.name: Genuine Article

quotes.race: Rockshore Refreshingly Irish Handicap
quotes.quote: He jumped quick, went a nice gallop, ran down the hill and Genuine Article filled himself up and galloped out. When you have gate speed and your horse doesn't mind making the running just go with it - Seamie Heffernan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Genuine Article took his time to come to hand and he will improve a ton. He seemed to be doing things well at home. There is a three-year-old handicap at Galway which might suit him - Chris Hayes, rider.

runners.spotlight: Useful 92-rated Flat performer with a preference for an ease in the ground; always behind on recent hurdles debut at Navan however and can only be watched for now.

runners.comment: Never sighted at Punchestown in June; back from a break and easily passed over
runners.name: Gerrymandering
runners.spotlight: Brought down at the first on hurdles debut in April and never sighted at Punchestown in June; back from a break and easily passed over.

runners.comment: Well held on hurdles debut at Down Royal last month, likely to need more time
runners.name: Goin
runners.spotlight: Dual German Flat winner beaten 28l on hurdles debut at Down Royal last month; others more appealing.

runners.comment: Never involved on Navan hurdles debut; yard has a stronger contender in Grandy Lane
runners.name: Good Option
runners.spotlight: Second in a Fairyhouse point-to-point in April; never seriously involved when ninth of 26 in a maiden hurdle at Navan early this month; yard has a stronger contender in Grandy Lane.

runners.comment: Midfield in Roscommon bumper for Shark Hanlon; best watched on hurdles debut
runners.name: Good Time Tommy
runners.spotlight: Mahler gelding is the first foal out of a dam that is a half sister to bumper and Cheltenham festival winner Good Time Johnny; midfield finish on Roscommon bumper debut in August for Shark Hanlon; changed yards and probably best watched on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Didn't seem to handle testing conditions at Punchestown; return to better ground to suit
runners.name: Grandy Lane
runners.owner: Darren Cahill/Jrm Racing Syndicate/Mrs J P Duffy
runners.spotlight: Just denied in 2m4f Sligo maiden hurdle on rules debut for Ian Donoghue in May and shaped well on yard debut when touched off in Clonmel bumper last month (soft); didn't seem to handle testing conditions at Punchestown 16 days later however; back hurdling and return to better ground should suit.

runners.comment: Free-going sort needs to settle better now back hurdling
runners.name: Kilgame
runners.spotlight: Two runs over hurdles; second to smart type at Auteuil on only run for Gabriel Leenders but too keen and faded to finish fifth on yard debut in Cork maiden a year ago; tongue-tie fitted on switching to bumper when last seen in March, still looking headstrong when fair third at Wexford; back from another break and needs to settle better.

runners.comment: Dual bumper winner didn't see it out on testing ground on hurdles debut; ground to suit
runners.name: Murat
runners.spotlight: Classy sort unbeaten in bumpers at Killarney and Galway, making all on latter occasion in August; didn't see it out on testing ground on hurdles debut at Naas last month when beaten 17l by a smart sort but back on better ground remains a danger to all.

runners.comment: Fair sort on the Flat for Johnny Murtagh; watching brief advised on hurdles debut
runners.name: Navagio

quotes.race: SP Or Better With The Tote Race
quotes.quote: That was a pleasant surprise, I knew Navagio would handle the ground and Dylan said he could go up in trip after the Curragh the last day. He got the trip and battled. I'm thrilled with him. On ratings, I thought fourth was the best we could get. He loves a good ease in the ground - Ray Cody, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner on yielding/soft for Johnny Murtagh in the past but no wins in Britain for James Horton in recent years; bought for 14,000gns at Newmarket in the autumn; watching brief advised on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Dual bumper runner-up needs to improve for switch to hurdles to play a role here
runners.name: Ozarks Walk
runners.spotlight: Runner up in two of four starts in bumpers, including when narrowly denied at Kilbeggan in August; needs to improve for switch to hurdles to play a role here.

runners.comment: Okay debut effort at Navan last month but hard to see him improving enough
runners.name: Pats Legacy
runners.spotlight: Walk In The Park half-brother to point-to-point winner Desaray; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m4f-2m7f chaser The Outlier; okay debut effort at Navan last month but hard to see him improving enough to play a major role here in an even stronger maiden.

runners.comment: Placed in 4 of 7 point-to-points; likely all the better for this hurdles debut experience
runners.name: Silver Salute
runners.spotlight: Workforce 6yo placed on four of seven point-to-point runs; likely all the better for this hurdles debut experience.

runners.comment: 100-rated Flat performer; interesting contender on albeit belated hurdles debut
runners.name: Tyson Fury

quotes.race: Charlie Waller Trust Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: It's a big hefty weight and with all the jockey's allowance Tyson Fury was nearly carrying ten stone today. He's a big horse and he probably didn't handle that ground, so we'll probably put him away for next year. He's probably a horse who would win over a mile and a quarter, he's got enough boot for that. He might even get quicker, he's an exciting one - Richard Spencer, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart Flat performer (rated 100) although last win came in Dundalk handicap early last year; has been running respectably this year, most recently never-nearer third in decent event at same track early this month (after a six-month break); interesting contender on albeit belated hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Never counted before pulled up on Punchestown debut 12 days ago; can only be watched
runners.name: Umpires Call
runners.spotlight: Never counted before pulled up on Punchestown debut 12 days ago; can only be watched.

runners.comment: Mild promise in maidens at Punchestown and Fairyhouse; likely more one for handicaps
runners.name: Urban War
runners.spotlight: Won twice as a 2yo in Britain for Amy Murphy in 2020; back from over three year's absence in October, mild promise in maiden hurdles at Punchestown and Fairyhouse; likely more one for handicaps.

runners.comment: Tailed off after never featuring on Fairyhouse debut in January; best watched on return
runners.name: Daisy Fingall
runners.spotlight: Sister to 1m7f-2m1f hurdle/chase winner Brookie, half-sister to two winners including Captain Guinness (high-class 2m hurdle/chase inc Champion Chase); dam unraced half-sister to smart 2m3f-3m5f hurdle/chase winner Jerrysback; tailed off after never featuring on Fairyhouse debut back in January; best watched on return.

runners.comment: Rated a modest 87 and hardly likely to offer a threat in a maiden such as this
runners.name: Is She Now
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden rated a modest 87 over hurdles and hardly likely to offer a threat in a maiden such as this.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way in maidens at Down Royal and Navan
runners.name: Marions Diva
runners.spotlight: Sister to the stable's useful mare Sassy Diva; beaten a long way in maidens at Down Royal and Navan.

runners.comment: Quite nicely-bred debutante for whom market likely best guide
runners.name: Scathach
runners.spotlight: Affinisea half-sister to three winners inc Fire Attack (useful bumper and 2m4f/2m5f chase) and Western Ryder (useful bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase); dam placed in bumper, closely related to high-class bumper and 2m-2m4f jumps winner Brewin'upastorm; market best guide on debut.

runners.comment: Rated 101 on Flat, gave an assured display when beating Ben Hur at Navan, strong contender
runners.name: Barbizon
runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat for John Murphy, winning two from four (including on yielding to soft) and achieving a rating of 101; always going well when scoring readily from subsequent Fairyhouse winner Ben Hur on hurdling debut at Navan; trainer saddled Mange Tout to beat Narciso Has at Fairyhouse; strong contender.

stable_tour.quote: This guy has the makings of a smart juvenile hurdle. He had a high rating on the Flat with John Murphy and has schooled nicely for us. We're looking forward to getting him out shortly. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Beaten by Barbizon at Navan, winner since at Fairyhouse but needs to find extra
runners.name: Ben Hur
runners.spotlight: Three runs on the Flat, rated 72; satisfactory effort when seventh of 23 over 1m4f at the Curragh on final Flat start; kept on after a mistake two out to finish second behind Barbizon on hurdles debut at Navan; upheld form with the winner's third-placed stablemate Wackestone when winning at Fairyhouse.

runners.breeder: Aston Mullins Stud & S Barrow Esq
runners.comment: Has looked like a possible future winner on occasion, seems out of his depth here
runners.name: Kasper Hauser
runners.owner: One In A Million Syndicate/Trevor Payne/B Sheerin
runners.spotlight: Has looked like a possible future winner on occasion; however, seems out of his depth here, judged on his form in maidens and a remote fifth in a race at this level at Cheltenham last month.

runners.comment: Auteuil winner, beaten by a stablemate of Barbizon at Fairyhouse, should be sharper now
runners.name: Narciso Has
runners.spotlight: Beat a subsequent winner first time out at Auteuil in April; had a spell in the lead before being mastered by the race-fit Mange Tout in a Grade 3 event at Fairyhouse, drawing clear of third-placed Adrienne.

stable_tour.quote: The form of his win at Auteuil in April looks good as the second that day has won since. He looks the part at home, so hopefully he can progress into a live Triumph Hurdle candidate. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Soft-ground 1m4f winner in France, trainer won this last year with a hurdling newcomer
runners.name: North Shore
runners.spotlight: Ran four times on the Flat in France; handled soft when winning over 1m4f on debut in July; narrowly beaten in three subsequent outings over further; trainer won this last year with hurdling newcomer Hello Neighbour.

stable_tour.quote: He came from France and looks a really nice juvenile hurdler. He's a winner on the Flat over there and one we're looking forward to. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Lingfield Derby Trial winner, Irish Derby also-ran, 78,000gns recruit to this yard, gelded
runners.name: Puppet Master

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

quotes.race: William Hill Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Puppet Master is a nice horse and has always been held in high regard. He's done well because running downhill on this ground probably wasn't ideal for him. Stay True is a lovely horse also and will be going forward. I'd be happy with both of them. They're all very good horses and there's nobody like Aidan to train a horse, so I'm very lucky - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back If 2nd To SP Fav Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Puppet Master is a lovely colt. He had a lovely run at Killarney, running green but finishing out well. Today he was very professional. He jumped, travelled, and I thought he quickened up well. He had a look when he got there but he went to the line well and he has a bit of class - Wayne Lordan, rider.

runners.spotlight: 2-7 for Aidan O'Brien; built on the promise of Ballysax fourth behind Delacroix when winning the Derby Trial at Lingfield; in rear in the Irish Derby; never looked happy when last of four in a St Leger trial at the Curragh; Lingfield win was on good-to-firm ground, but won a Galway maiden on soft at two; 78,000gns recruit to this yard; has been gelded.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good staying colt who showed he was tough and hardy when winning the Lingfield Derby Trial. Ryan liked him that day and the plan was always to come here next. He seems well and seems to stay well. 13-06-25

runners.comment: Winner of an academy hurdle and an orthodox maiden, a lot more on his plate now
runners.name: Quinta Do Lago
runners.spotlight: Ran green when winning an academy hurdle at Cork; cause helped when his nearest pursuer blundered badly at the last; put that experience to good use when winning a maiden at Punchestown, a lot more on his plate now.

runners.comment: Maiden winner, no match for the promising Mange Tout and Narciso Has in a Grade 3 event
runners.name: Adrienne
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden who ran well on several occasions in defeat; won well at Fairyhouse on second hurdles run; no match for the promising Mange Tout and Narciso Has when stepped up in class at the same venue.

runners.comment: 98-rated Flat winner, second-string for owner of Narciso Has and trainer of North Shore
runners.name: In My Teens
runners.spotlight: 98-rated Flat winner; weakened late into fourth when making hurdles debut at Punchestown; unseated at first when 11-1 chance in Grade 3 Fairyhouse event; apparent second-string for the owner of Narisco Has and the trainer of North Shore.

stable_tour.quote: She's run well in four starts on the Flat and will go juvenile hurdling. She's done a good bit of schooling and jumps well. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Modest on Flat, never-dangerous sixth behind Ben Hur on hurdles/stable debut at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Thilos
runners.spotlight: Regressive Flat maiden for Joseph O'Brien; huge price when a never-dangerous sixth behind Ben Hur on hurdles/stable debut at Fairyhouse.

runners.comment: Handicap debut winner at Punchestown last month; up 7lb but 4yo still unexposed
runners.name: Powerful
runners.spotlight: Camelot gelding out of half-sister to Derby winner Motivator; promise in maidens and off the mark on handicap debut at Punchestown last month (odds-on), clear with second when just holding on in testing conditions; 7lb rise makes this tough but still unexposed and better ground could bring further improvement.

runners.comment: Much improved for Downpatrick maiden win; contender if handling softer conditions
runners.name: Atomic Queen
runners.spotlight: Useful bumper form (winning at Limerick) and stepped forward hugely from underwhelming hurdles debut effort to land 2m2f Downpatrick mares maiden in August, quickening up well from the last to beat a hot favourite 5l (good); hasn't raced on ground this soft so slight concerns on that score but could go well if handling conditions on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Well held in the Lartigue at Listowel; mark remains on the high side
runners.name: Day Trader

quotes.race: John B. Keane (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a good performance. Dan [King] was excellent as always and he is a very underrated rider. He is one of the best in the country. At Killarney Day Trader was off the bridle from flag fall but today he carried him everywhere. Daniel has the hands of Carberry and hopefully he has the brain of Walsh. What a rider and he's a lovely fella. Hopefully he is the next one on the way up. We will see where Day Trader goes next. The doors are all open for him. He can go on the flat and he can go over jumps, it all depends. He is a very sound horse and he ran plenty as a three-year-old so I don't want to smash him up - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner also won modest 2m Listowel maiden hurdle over the summer (good) but soundly beaten in Lartigue at Listowel; recent AW run should have brought him on but mark remains on the high side.

runners.comment: Solid form in novice events, more needed to play a major role on handicap debut
runners.name: Nelson Muntz
runners.spotlight: Has gathered fair bit of experience, winning Kilbeggan maiden and solid form in novice events, albeit latterly over longer trips; more needed to play a major role on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Good recent AW form; one to consider although ground possibly softer than ideal
runners.name: Tatateo
runners.spotlight: Tramore maiden winner ran well in 2m4f Thurles novice and some good recent AW form; one to consider although ground possibly softer than ideal.

runners.comment: Lartigue also-ran; fit from recent AW run and ground shouldn't be a problem
runners.name: Money Dancer
runners.owner: Dont Let The Old Man In Syndicate

quotes.race: Finlay Volvo Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Money Dancer behaved herself better here than she does at home, she's very bouncy and not simple. But she has always shown us plenty. She has been tipping along all winter but we liked the couple of pieces of work she did. She found plenty and handled the trip well. We will roll the dice a bit with her now. With those fillies, you are as well off to get what you can when you can with them, so we will go for a Listed race somewhere - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Ran away with Galway maiden in September in first-time hood but safely held twice after including Lartigue Hurdle at Listowel; fit from recent AW run and ground shouldn't be a problem.

runners.comment: Testing ground may not have suited at Navan; remains potential improver on handicap debut
runners.name: The Store Boy
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 5yo made promising enough debut at Tramore in May but hasn't improved as expected both starts since, albeit much stronger maiden last time at Navan when not seeming to get home in testing conditions; remains a potential improver on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He was a little disappointing at Wexford when third in a maiden hurdle last time. We might step him up in trip to look for some improvement. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Gowran winner up 8lb; will need a good test at this trip
runners.name: Welluknow

quotes.race: GAIN Equine Nutrition Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Welluknow is a big baby. He was a July foal. It is lovely to see him come around. He is a homebred, so it is lovely. It is a great sport where you can take them from in utero to the winners' enclosure; there is a bit of meaning to it. I think he is a good horse. I think he has plenty of pace, so I think two to two and a half in time - Mark Molloy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Definite signs of ability in maidens on varying ground before breakthrough in 2m Gowran novice handicap last month, coming home strongly to get up late to beat a long-time clear leader on heavy; type to keep improving but will need to here off 8lb higher mark, and will need a strong pace.

runners.comment: 2lb rise for recent Cork second looks harsh; still prone to jumping errors
runners.name: Bannow Blaze
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up in handicaps before Wexford win in October off 104; odds-on to follow up at Cork following month but no match for a ready winner; still prone to jumping errors and others preferred.

runners.comment: Recent chase winner; drop in trip may not suit but respected off 16lb lower hurdles mark
runners.name: True Testimony
runners.spotlight: Career-best when getting off the mark last month in 2m5f Fairyhouse mares handicap chase off a mark of 123; not sure this drop in trip will be in her favour but has to be greatly respected off 16lb lower hurdles mark.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo a likely improver now switched to handicaps and one to keep an eye on
runners.name: Jacko Star
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo (out of yard's smart mare Jackonslady) has shaped nicely in three maiden runs, latest when never-nearer fourth at Gowran last month; likely improver now handicapping and one to keep an eye on in the market.

runners.comment: Subject of running and riding inquiry when pulled up at Cheltenham last month
runners.name: Bruant

prev_owners.owner: Tobias Jones, James Finch & Samuel Sutton

runners.spotlight: Scored twice on Flat in France and landed 2m2f Downpatrick novice hurdle for current yard over the summer; subject of running and riding inquiry when pulled up at Cheltenham last month (reportedly raced too keen); can't rule out him bouncing back.

runners.comment: Placed over hurdles in the past but recent form doesn't make him an obvious player
runners.name: Chiefs Kingdom
runners.spotlight: Placed four times over hurdles in the past but recent form (largely over fences) doesn't make him an obvious player.

runners.comment: Navan comeback win augurs well and 8lb rise possibly lenient; more likely
runners.name: Spinola Bay

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: His last run was a while ago but Spinola Bay has always been a horse that runs light. He was straightforward, jumped pretty well on the whole and nice to get a winner. The last was probably my own fault but was clever and galloped all the way to the line - Sam Ewing, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.spotlight: Definite signs of ability in maidens and a bumper in 2024; returned from 14 months' absence in fine fettle to land 2m Navan handicap 12 days ago, up with pace throughout and seeing it out strongly despite fluffing the last; 8lb rise looks workable and big player.

runners.comment: Tough-looking task here after 10 months' absence on handicap debut
runners.name: Stiltellinemnuttin
runners.spotlight: Pick of five maiden runs last season when creditable fifth at Navan; tough-looking task here after 314 days off on handicap debut though.

runners.comment: Absent since June and best watched on handicap debut unless market suggests otherwise
runners.name: Walk On Annilog
runners.spotlight: Maiden's best run came when second in Kilbeggan maiden last term on better ground; absent since June and probably best watched on handicap debut unless market suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Maiden has posted some good runs in defeat up to 2m5f but opposable on recent form
runners.name: Brave Soldier
runners.spotlight: Maiden has posted some good runs in defeat up to 2m5f but opposable on balance of recent form.

runners.comment: Better chaser; runner-up in recent Thurles handicap hurdles but 4lb higher now
runners.name: Freddie Robdal

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Henry [de Bromhead, trainer] said to hunt away and I just counted to five. Freddie Robdal picked up lovely and winged the last and landed running - Diarmuid Moloney, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner has gone close off lower hurdles mark recently in 2m Thurles handicaps; 4lb higher now so more needed.

runners.comment: Stepping into a different league after Clonmel win, the trip may be shorter than ideal
runners.name: Hes Gorgeous
runners.spotlight: Consistent over hurdles without winning, rated 112; belied his 33-1 starting price with a bright start to his chasing career, taking second at Wexford; backed that up with a Clonmel win; stepping into a different league now, and the trip may be shorter than ideal.

runners.comment: Useful handicap hurdle form, Naas win suggests he is already a better horse over fences
runners.name: Irish Panther

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: That was exciting and Irish Panther is a nice horse. He won very well at Clonmel, which he was entitled to do, and I thought that was a very good performance. He jumped really well and what really amazed me was how quickly he put it to bed, he actually sprinted. The Racing Post Novice Chase at Christmas would be more than likely where we go now. I don't know if he'll go again in between as he's had two races now in three weeks, which is enough in my opinion - Eddie Harty, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Crottys Lake Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Irish Panther did what he was entitled to do. He could go back for a good handicap hurdle, or another option we are throwing around is going chasing with him. He is such a good jumper and he's got the engine for it - Eddie Harty, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Useful handicap hurdle form, notably when third behind two British-trained runners at the Punchestown festival; had a straightforward task when landing a maiden hurdle at Clonmel in October; 128-rated hurdler already looks a better horse over fences, judged on an 8l win from the 138-rated Jacobs Ladder at Naas.

runners.breeder: A Obrien,M Al Monsour& K Al Attiyah
runners.comment: Galway Hurdle winner in 2024, well below his best since second in the Ascot Stakes
runners.name: Nurburgring

prev_owners.owner: Al Mamoura Partnership/Mrs A M Obrien
Al Mamoura Partnership/Mrs A M Obrien
Al Mamoura & Mrs A M Obrien

quotes.race: Ascot Stakes (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Massive run, got across from a wide draw, travelled round lovely. When the winner quickened by us, Nurburgring just lacked a gear for a stride or two - maybe another couple of strides and he might have got back at him - Colin Keane, jockey.

quotes.race: Guinness Galway Hurdle Handicap (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: When Nurburgring ran well at Punchestown, we decided this was a good mid-summer target. He had a little holiday and then had a nice run over a shortish trip on the Flat at Leopardstown to blow the cobwebs away - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts Across All Channels" Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Nurburgring had been gelded since his last run. He travelled like a dream and jumped well. He had a little look around him after the last but he did it well - Richie Deegan, rider.

quotes.race: Larkin's Bar & Francie Sheahan's Bar 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Nurburgring was a bit careful but he should improve. With his Flat rating we were hoping he could do that. He coped with the ground well. We'll probably try to find a winners-of-one for him - JJ Slevin, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Racing Next On Saturday May 13th Maiden
quotes.quote: Some of mine have needed a run this year and I thought he might get a bit tired, but he came home well. He is a big horse with a lot of scope and is a smart type. He will be a lovely middle distance/stayer hopefully. Joseph O'Brien - trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart dual-purpose sort; won the Galway Hurdle in 2024 and was a Killarney novice chase winner in July after being a close runner-up in the Ascot Stakes; has blotted his record since then, pulled up in the Galway Plate, in rear in the Irish Cesarewitch, lifeless run over fences at Cork.

stable_tour.quote: He's had one run on the Flat recently having previously competed over jumps and he'll love the step up in distance. 13-06-25

He'll probably go to Fairyhouse for a juvenile hurdle. He obviously lost the race in the stewards' room at Listowel but the form of that race has worked out well. He's a lovely, big horse and he seems to have taken well to hurdling. He has been gelded since Listowel. 27-11-23

runners.comment: Top-class novice hurdler last term, Drinmore winner is potentially an outstanding chaser
runners.name: Romeo Coolio

quotes.race: BAR 1 Betting Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: He's unreal. Romeo Coolio jumped brilliant, he probably could have done with going half a stride quicker, travelled very well and never missed a beat. He got close to a couple but it was more trying to restrain him than anything. He's as quick as lightning away from a fence - Jack Kennedy, jockey, speaking to RTE.  Obviously with Cheltenham you have now only have two or three (miles). We could also come back here at Easter or go to Aintree, there are loads of options. The one thing Jack did say is that he wouldn't be afraid to bring Romeo Coolio back to two off a real fast pace, the way he jumps. But there's no decision that needs to be made today.  Leopardstown is an option, everywhere is open, and we could end up in Kempton. I'll never forget when the boys [KTDA Racing, owners] came to me at the start, the one thing they said was they'd love to have a Champion Chase horse. Whether he's quick enough for that, I don't know, but we can dream in every direction - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It couldn't have been more straightforward. Jack said Romeo Coolio's one of those horses that you would love to have the last three fences in, he was that good. I thought it was a good performance, he couldn't have done any more than he did so we're absolutely delighted. We will probably head for the Drinmore now. You have the Drinmore and you have Christmas, we'll talk to the lads and see what they want to do. They are great supporters of Cullentra. - Gordon Elliott, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.Brilliant. Obviously disappointing the fences were taken out but the ones we did jump Romeo Coolio was really good. It's up to Gordon [Elliott, trainer] and the lads but I imagine the Drinmore is where we'll see him - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: TrustATrader Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Romeo Coolio ran a great race. The ground would be as quick as he wants it but the winner was very good. I would imagine he won't do much more this season and he is horse to go chasing with next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Obviously it didn't go to plan the last day and we all went home a bit disappointed, so I'm delighted for the boys who own Romeo Coolio. Looking at that, I'd say a fast gallop is what he needs. He looked good there today. We said after the last day we were going to go on and keep it simple. I'd imagine he'll probably go for the Supreme next - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tayto Group Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Romeo Coolio is a good horse and a real two-mile horse. The Royal Bond might be where he goes next - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Not far off the best of last term's novice hurdlers; won Grade 1 event at this meeting and better in defeat when placed at Cheltenham and Aintree; made a good start over fences at Down Royal; much too strong for three-time chase winner Gold Dancer in the Drinmore at Fairyhouse.

stable_tour.quote: Everything about him suggests he'll be a better chaser than hurdler and he wasn't too bad over hurdles, was he? The way he jumped hurdles always had me excited with a view to going chasing. His schooling has been excellent, as we thought it would be. He's ready to rock and worked really well at Navan the other day alongside some of our best horses. He's in serious nick. He'll run in a beginners' chase at Down Royal this week or we'll wait for Navan. It'll depend on the ground. He's in the same boat as Brighterdaysahead in that he could start off over 2m or 2m4f. It doesn't really matter to him. You'd be hoping he's an Arkle horse. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Beat Romeo Coolio at Aintree, can run too freely, questions to answer after Thurles defeat
runners.name: Salvator Mundi

prev_owners.owner: Genetique Obstacle, Haras Du Saubouas & Mme Marine Pineda

quotes.race: TrustATrader Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Salvator Mundi's work at home has been very good. I was disappointed that it had taken him this long to win a Grade 1, but we changed tactics a little bit today and decided to let him get at it, and I think it worked finally. They went a really good pace and Paul got him settled. He jumped well - just a little bit to the right up the straight, but Paul felt that he was correcting himself. That's a good sign that he was able to think about that when galloping at speed. He thinks he's faster than he is - that's what goes on in his head - but he's learning to settle and with more racing he'll settle and he'll be better - Willie Mullins, trainer.I won't lie, over the first and around the bend I was a bit worried - I'd set out to make more use of Salvator Mundi, but when he was settled where he was I stayed there. Cheltenham probably didn't suit him as much as here. We know he has a big engine - he disappointed us at Cheltenham, to be honest, and I wanted to disprove that he wasn't good enough. He was back to himself here, fast ground suited him - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Club Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Salvator Mundi was fresh and it was messy so I would say it was going to be hard to be impressive. We know he can jump but he didn't jump well today because I couldn't let him. He had to dig in then off the bend on tacky ground in the straight. He had to find plenty. It's hard to be impressive on that ground but at least he won. He'll have to build on it but I think he will. He has gears and on that ground it's hard to use them to the best effect. I'd say a stronger run race on looser ground, wetter ground even, would help him - Paul Townend, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won Punchestown Grade 2 novice in January; raced freely when fifth in Supreme Novices'; settled better when reversing form with the Cheltenham third Romeo Coolio at Aintree; ran freely again and jumped to the right at times when second to stablemate Irancy at Punchestown; questions to answer after failing to match stablemate Kappa Jy Pyke on chasing debut.

stable_tour.quote: Looking at the way he raced over hurdles and how keen he could be, I'd imagine he'll go over fences and have a chance to prove himself an Arkle horse. I do think he has the ability to be a Champion Hurdle contender as he's seriously talented on his day, but he might be able to raise his game again over fences. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Respectable third behind Kopek Des Bordes on chasing debut at Navan, up against it here
runners.name: Shraheen

quotes.race: Midlands National Day Friday 12th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shraheen has been his own worst enemy because he normally races with the choke out but today he relaxed a little better. The strong gallop was a help. He's a lovely big fellow and bred to be a chaser - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressive handicap hurdler late last year; improved again when scoring over 2m3f at Kilbeggan in July; ran as well as could have been expected when 19l third behind Kopek Des Bordes on chasing debut at Navan last month; up against it at this level.

runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Three wins from four starts as a second-season novice this term; trainer's second-string
runners.name: Westport Cove

quotes.race: Matchbook Betting Exchange Craddockstown Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: This was one against the head. I didn't think he could win it, but he fought back bravely after the second-last. He jumped the last well and he's a very sharp jumper. I said, 'Well done' to Paul [Townend] when he came back in and he said, 'You needn't say well done, I didn't have much to do. I was just a passenger'. Once the tape goes down, he just goes out and gallops - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Group Irish EBF Kilbegnet Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: We let Westport Cove rattle early on and he took a breather at stages. He jumped brilliant up the home straight and that's what won it for him. He goes his gallop and you're a passenger on him - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Very useful 137-rated hurdler; now 11lb higher over fences after nine starts; twice runner-up last season; three wins and a second from four starts as a second-season novice this term; three of those runs were on goodish ground, but he handled testing conditions when mastering the useful Fleur In The Park at Punchestown a month ago.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably best on nice ground. He's a keen-going sort who has done well over fences and has won Grade 3s at Galway and Roscommon. He'll stick to the minimum trip. 17-11-25
He was a comfortable winner of his only race, a Fairyhouse bumper in January when there was plenty of cut. He hasn't run since but would be one to consider. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Pleasing start to her chasing career with Gowran win, well beaten in Cork mares' Grade 3
runners.name: Break My Soul

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Break My Soul was ready to start and I was confident she would win. Last year, we were just killing time over hurdles. I wanted to go for a chase straight away, but luckily Keith [Donoghue, brother] talked sense into me. She's definitely the best we've ever had. We'll try to stick to two miles and we won't be afraid to go against the geldings either - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won her sole point start and twice a winner over hurdles; second in a 2m Grade 3 at Gowran in February on stable debut; not disgraced in Grade 1 runs at Aintree and Punchestown; made a pleasing start to her chasing career with Gowran win; soundly beaten in Cork mares' Grade 3.

stable_tour.quote: We got her after winning a point-to-point but things did not go according to plan last season at first. However, we resolved a few issues and she finished with two extremely easy victories at Chepstow and Fontwell. She's had a good summer at grass and we'll now resume over hurdles. Good ground is important to her. 22-10-24

runners.comment: 2-2 over fences, coped with a drop in trip and rise in class in 2m Grade 2 at Cheltenham
runners.name: July Flower

prev_owners.owner: C B Woods & Mr N Doolin

quotes.race: Paddy Power Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The November) (GBB)
quotes.quote: July Flower is very exciting. She was very good at Limerick the other day and we said we'd drop back in trip and see. We are delighted with her - she jumped great. I delighted for the Angoves [owners] and Darragh [O'Keeffe, jockey]. We were in two minds about going over fences in the summer, but Duncan [Angove] was happy to go and thankfully we did. We'll take it one step at a time - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Beat The Bank.ie Irish EBF Mares Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: July Flower can be keen but she settled lovely today. The race panned out ideally for her and she picked up again in the straight. Her jumping is exceptional; that's a big asset to her. She's got some really good form in France and it was great to see her reproduce that over here - Rachel Blackmore, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won a Grade 1 AQPS event in France at three; useful hurdler last term, won a 2m4f Grade 3 mares' event at this venue, fifth in the Mares' Hurdle at Cheltennham; 2-2 over fences; gave a polished display at Limerick (2m3f, yielding to soft); coped well with drop in trip and rise in class when landing 2m Grade 2 contest at Cheltenham.

stable_tour.quote: She was electric in a mares' beginners' chase the other day at Limerick. We were delighted with her. She seemed to love jumping fences. I'm starting to wonder if I got her trip slightly wrong - I'd say she might be a two-mile to two-and-a-half type, rather than two-and-a-half up to three miles. She seemed to really enjoy being ridden positively. She'll have entries in the Arkle Trial at Cheltenham, the two-mile novice chase at Punchestown the following week and the Drinmore. We'll see which one suits best. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Top-weight opposable over an inadequate trip
runners.name: Lisnamult Lad

quotes.race: Randox Supporting Prostate Cancer UK Topham Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It cost me a bit of momentum I suppose [being hampered by the loose horse on the run-in], but when we got to the Elbow he ran straight and I'd say we were just beaten by a class horse. Lisnamult Lad has given me a hell of a spin. It just took me a couple of fences to trust him and to know his limits, but he was very accurate at the take offs and landings and very measured. At the last I thought we had it, but it's a long way to the line. I'm gutted that it didn't come off, but he can come back here again - Johnny Burke, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lisnamult Lad is not a big horse but he's tough. I was delighted with his mark in Ireland, we were 124 but 10lb higher here. I rang the English handicapper and gave it out to him but it worked out well - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

quotes.race: Lake Isle Of Innisfree Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lisnamult Lad is an odd sort of horse that seems to get lit up in his races. I got a nice breather into him and he hit the line hard. We will have to teach him to settle better and maybe a big track is what he wants - Ben Harvey, rider

runners.spotlight: Sole chase win came at Cheltenham in October 2024 (2m4f, good); fine second of 30 in the Topham at Aintree in April; fell when weakening on seasonal return at Cheltenham in October; blinkers now replace cheekpieces; this trip looks too sharp.

stable_tour.quote: We knew about him in the spring; Adrian Murray had told me he was good and I'd seen him work. He won well for Adrian in a point-to-point last month and we bought him afterwards. He'll go for a bumper before maybe going hurdling straight after. 21-11-22

runners.comment: Mildly encouraging Fairyhouse run last month; more expected of here
runners.name: The King Of Prs

quotes.race: SBK Dan & Joan Moore Memorial Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It's brilliant to win it, and brilliant to have the second and third as well. The King Of Prs was a very cheap purchase as a store, and he has kept improving. He has plenty of size and scope and there is no reason that he won't keep improving. Keith was a little bit annoyed with himself that he came wide on him in Leopardstown at Christmas, and he wasn't beaten far. He came out of it well, he's tough and hardy. All three of them could go for the Grand Annual at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The King Of Prs will race on during the Winter and he will jump a fence - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: All three chase wins at around this trip, notably very valuable Grade 3 handicap at Fairyhouse last term off 130; ran okay on second start back this term at same venue last month and more expected of here.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Dan Moore last season, but he shot up in the weights for that and probably isn't well handicapped now. He's a consistent horse, though, and ready to start off again. He's one for those good 2m handicap chases. 04-11-25
He progressed well last season, winning twice over fences. He's ready to start off and we'll keep him to two miles and soft ground. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Sole runner for top yard so respected but opposable on form so far now on handicap debut
runners.name: Wheres My Jet
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner is 0-4 chasing this term, coming up against some smart types in maidens, most recently faller two out when not out of it at Fairyhouse 13 days ago; sole runner for top yard so has to be respected, but opposable on form so far now making handicap debut.

runners.comment: Well held last month in Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham and now drops in grade/trip
runners.name: Theatre Native

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. Theatre Native ran very keen there all the way and when she learns to settle, obviously that will help her again. It was lovely to see her still finish out the race as well. She did a lovely piece of work about ten days ago, so that gave us some encouragement. I think the key is to try and get her to settle more. She's got an engine and I'm delighted she's done that - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Better chaser than hurdler, easily winning 2m5f Cheltenham Grade 3 mares handicap last season (good); well held there last month however in Paddy Power Gold Cup and now drops in grade/trip.

stable_tour.quote: She ran well at Limerick when she finished third. She's entered in the Paddy Power at Cheltenham on Saturday and she'll also have an entry in the novice handicap chase on the Sunday there as well. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Novice needs to find more on handicap debut
runners.name: Addragoole
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground maiden hurdle winner who has improved with each of his four runs over fences, including winning 2m2f Sligo beginners, most recently never-nearer fourth in better class Cheltenham novices' in October; needs to find more on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken well to fences and ran well enough when fourth at Cheltenham last month. Eoin [Staples] couldn't claim off him, which wasn't ideal, and he ran well after missing a couple of fences. We'll give him a little freshen-up now and aim him at the 2m handicap chase at Leopardstown over Christmas. 04-11-25

He's been a bit frustrating as he's been second five times now. He's still raw and green and mentally a baby, but he did things right at Gowran on Saturday, settling well, and is learning all the time. Hopefully he'll have his day sooner rather than later. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Remains unexposed on comeback run; has to be respected given the form of the Elliott yard
runners.name: Golden Joy

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Golden Joy jumped very well, that will stand to him. Thurles the last day it may have happened a bit quick for him but still ran a nice race, coming here I thought I had a chance - Jordan Gainford, jockey, speaking to Racing TV  We'll probably go for a novice handicap chase, the 2m division is not always the strongest. I'd say the ground was a big key to Golden Joy here - Gordon Elliott. trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.spotlight: French hurdles winner off the mark at second attempt in chases in C&D beginners' (left clear last) in March; following month race essentially ended with mistake four out (eased) in Cork handicap; has been off 249 days and remains unexposed; has to be respected given the form of the Elliott yard.

stable_tour.quote: His homework is an awful lot better than he's been showing on the track. The 2m handicap chase at Down Royal is on our radar for him next. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Last year's winner has a bit to prove off this mark after a tame hurdles run last time
runners.name: An Peann Dearg

quotes.race: Ryanair Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: An Peann Dearg travelled well, something similar to the last day, but he probably hit the line a little bit stronger - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Last year's short-head defeat of The Folkes Tiara in this race off 116 was backed up off 6lb higher at the Dublin Racing Festival; season ended disappointingly, so has a bit to prove after tame hurdles run last time.

stable_tour.quote: He's very lightly raced for his age. He's had all sorts of problems over the years, but he's come alive of late. We didn't fancy him going to Leopardstown at Christmas, so he surprised us there and then he backed it up by winning at the Dublin Racing Festival. He won well there and goes to the Grand Annual with a decent squeak.  20-2-25

runners.comment: Best form at 3m, remains opposable at this much shorter trip
runners.name: Chance Another One
runners.spotlight: Improved since going chasing, winning first two starts over 3m, including Kempton handicap last month; never counted over inadequate trip back in novice company at Punchestown since and again tried over this shorter than ideal trip.

runners.comment: Only denied late on Wexford return; back in trip and should go well with rider's claim
runners.name: Release The Beast

quotes.race: O'Kelly Brothers Demolition Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Release The Beast is a horse we have always liked and this is his job. He is a different horse since he came back in this year and had a lovely run the first day. It was only a rated novice but he is definitely a nice horse - James Nolan, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Release The Beast has never disappointed us. It's impossible to assess other than it could not have been easier. We're excited by him - Paul Nolan, trainer

runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced 6yo won Galway maiden hurdle on debut and looked good in winning 2m2f Limerick novice chase this time last year; better again on seasonal return in October when only outpointed late in 2m4f Wexford handicap in October (well clear of the remainder); back in trip here and should go well with rider's claim.

runners.comment: Won this in 2023 and denied last year by An Peann Dearg; nothing to note of late however
runners.name: The Folkes Tiara

quotes.race: EasyFix Equine Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Folkes Tiara had lost his form a little but great to see him back. His jumping was unreal. Brian thought he was beaten coming to the last but he just winged it. He was brilliant - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: New Smart View Racecards By Racing Post Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Folkes Tiara jumped super. Rachael was in front a lot sooner than I thought she would be but he actually jumped his way to the front so she just sat against him and took him back. He toughed it out really well. He got under the last a bit but picked up again and when the other horse came to him, he went away. This ground is key to him as he likes a bit of nice ground. He was second in this race last year and it's great to go one better. We could probably look at the two-mile handicap at the Dublin Racing Festival as he runs well here. That would be the first thing that springs to mind - Robbie Power, stable representative

runners.spotlight: Won this in 2023 and just denied last year by An Peann Dearg off 131; nothing approaching that form since however, never counting the last twice; plenty to find but clearly likes this C&D so don't rule out.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a bit disappointing recently; his form has tailed off, but we'll try to rediscover it. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Well held in 2m1f Fairyhouse handicap chase last month so lots to find
runners.name: Je Tai Porte

quotes.race: KOG Logistics Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I've tried to sit Je T'ai Porte in a couple of times but she'd be fairly free and doing a bit too much the whole time, but she was grand in front here. I think the loose horse from the last helped her, she put in a good round of jumping and hopefully could win more - Shane Fitzgerald, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better Guaranteed Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Je T'ai Porte is not the most straightforward. I'm hoping when she steps up in class she might improve as she might be able to take a lead. She will stay going for the summer - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.spotlight: Better chaser than hurdler, three wins include 2m4f Limerick mares event in May (good); back from the Flat when well held in 2m1f Fairyhouse handicap chase last month so lots to find.

stable_tour.quote: She had a good season and finished off with a win at Limerick. She ran well when sixth on the Flat at Roscommon on her reappearance and she'll probably go to Naas next for a second-season novice hurdle. 04-11-25
She had a great summer, winning twice over fences. We've given her a break and she'll be back for the spring. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Long losing run and holds no secrets from the handicapper but don't rule out
runners.name: Dont Go Yet
runners.spotlight: Both handicap wins have been at this trip although last one was over two years ago; fine second at Punchestown in May and fit from two runs last month, so could go well albeit holds no secrets from the handicapper.

runners.comment: Relatively unexposed 5yo but lack of a recent run a concern
runners.name: Wonleg

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I am delighted with that. That was Patrick's [O'Brien] first ride for us and I thought he was really good. Today was the plan but there is a 120 or less novice chase in Tramore and we would love to go there if we could possibly squeeze in with Patrick's claim. I thought he gave Wonleg a super ride - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won Roscommon maiden hurdle last year and off the mark over fences on handicap debut at Wexford over 2m in July (good) off 116; tame Killarney run a month later raises questions and lacks a recent run.

runners.comment: Unable to justify market support on recent Thurles comeback; down markedly in trip now
runners.name: Milan Forth
runners.spotlight: Decent standard in hunter-chases last season, winning at Clonmel and Down Royal before decent seventh in Aintree Foxhunters for Adrian Murray; plenty of market support on rules comeback six days ago but dropped out quickly home turn and pulled up in 2m6f Thurles handicap; drops markedly in trip.

runners.comment: Novice progressing well and one to consider
runners.name: Seskin Flash
runners.spotlight: Improved for fitting of a hood, winning 2m6f Downpatrick handicap hurdle last term and more recently produced late to land 2m4f beginners' chase at same venue in October; better again when close third in 2m1f Down Royal handicap later same month; progressing well and one to consider.

runners.comment: Most recent Down Royal handicap effort leaves him with plenty to find with Seskin Flash
runners.name: Solsbury Hill

quotes.race: J.F. Hanley Groundscare Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Solsbury Hill can be quite keen but he's settled lovely and he jumped fantastic. Coming out of the back straight they [leaders] were getting faster and faster and I was more than happy to keep sitting as my lad has bundles of speed. I knew if I could just keep filling and filling, he'd sprint away from the back of the second-last - Charlie O'Dwyer, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We have eventually got it right with Solsbury Hill. We've tried everything - different trips, put a hood on him the last day and took it off today. In fairness to Charlie he was adamant that he wanted to drop him in and get him switched off down the inner, but it was fairly rough early on. There was a lot of hustle and bustle. He was probably a little bit further back than he wanted to be, but Charlie was adamant that once he switches off, he has plenty of pace. They went a strong pace and it all worked out well for him. He jumped super down the back and produced a nice turn of foot. He'll definitely go chasing next season as he jumps a fence super and is a nice one to look forward to - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bolted up in 2m1f Roscommon beginners' chase in August but hasn't built on that twice since, most recent Down Royal handicap effort leaving him with plenty to find with Seskin Flash.

runners.comment: Jumping concerns after her Tramore effort when last seen now entering handicap ranks
runners.name: Ma Belle Etoile
runners.owner: P Haughey & P M Haughey & John Ball

quotes.race: Wexford Town Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: We were disappointed with Ma Belle Etoile in Tramore. We hoped we had her back right which we did. I was delighted to see her do that. She has always looked like a promising mare. We might enter her for the race in Galway next week [Guinness Open Gate Brewery Novice Chase], it is a black type novice and she is a gorgeous looking mare so if she could get black type it would make her even more valuable as a broodmare. We will see. We will give her the entry but no firm plans - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper and novice hurdle winner got off the mark chasing at second attempt in 2m Wexford mares beginners' in July (good); jumping let her down following month in Tramore novice and returns from four months' break here for handicap debut still unexposed but with a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Clonmel handicap debut second may appreciate better ground; pick of the de Bromhead five
runners.name: Trasna Na Pairce

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D P Magnier & Mrs Veronica Sherwood

runners.spotlight: Back-to-back hurdling wins at Clonmel in early summer and steady improvement in four attempts chasing, notably latest when front-running second at same venue in 2m3f novice handicap early this month on heavy; better ground here may suit and could prove the pick of the de Bromhead quintet.

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Recent handicap debut not devoid of promise; drop in trip may suit now
runners.name: Crescent Moon
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in 2m4f Fairyhouse novice handicap hurdle last term; debut promise over fences at Galway in October and pick of three attempts since on latest in 2m5f mares' handicap at same venue last month, not quite getting home when beaten 5l into fifth; back in trip here with place claims.

runners.comment: 2021 winner; best recent form over hurdles but can't rule out off much reduced chase mark
runners.name: Grange Walk

quotes.race: "Bet Through The Free Racing Post App" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grange Walk is a fair horse who is only coming to himself. He'll probably go on for the Dan Moore at Fairyhouse from here. I was very happy coming here - I couldn't believe that Danny Mullins went to Kempton [to ride Tornado Flyer in the King George]. This horse is only a six-year-old so time is on his side - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Frank O'Beirne Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grange Walk is a proper one and I think he would have won at Galway but for falling. Bryan (Cooper) said he won with something in hand. He's only six and the sky is the limit for him. He'll be a novice chaser, not a handicapper - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Grange Walk is going to be a smashing chaser. He's very scopey and Danny (Mullins) has loved him from the first time he schooled him.  He actually turned to me then and said we have a Draycott Place or Kylecrue back again in terms of the way this lad jumps. He'll probably go for the two miles and two furlongs in Galway next. Two miles is his trip but he gets that distance no problem on good ground - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Doneraile Walk Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Danny gave Grange Walk a peach of a ride today, I thought he was absolutely brilliant. We were short a little bit of fitness so we held him up a bit. He'll go to Listowel now for a novice or a handicap. He probably wasn't ready for the novice in Galway and the hill probably caught him a bit. He is a good horse and can go wherever he likes - John Ryam, trainer

runners.spotlight: Four wins over fences include this race in 2021 off 130; better recent form has been over hurdles, winning 2m6f Limerick handicap last season and twice runner-up at Sligo over the summer; stamina test (3m, soft) too much at Clonmel on latest; can't rule out off this much reduced chase mark.

runners.comment: Better hurdler; recent Clonmel fifth leaves him with a bit to find with Trasna Na Pairce
runners.name: One Last Tango

quotes.race: BarOneRacing Telebetting 1800 624 524 (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: You don't always get what you deserve but One Last Tango deserved that. Any time he's got good ground, he's run a good race and was was only beaten three-quarters-of-a-length on his last two runs. I wouldn't call him a summer bumper horse, he's a bit better than that and he'll definitely have a little break. We might just call it a day because he won't go soft ground. He'll be a nice horse for next summer in all those festival meetings - Eoin Griffin, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Latest of three hurdle wins came over C&D at this fixture in 2023; 0-10 chasing however, just denied in Down Royal novice last term and decent second in 2m1f Tipperary handicap in May off this mark; recent Clonmel fifth leaves him with a bit to find with Trasna Na Pairce.

runners.comment: Placings in beginners' chases but 11lb wrong on handicap debut here
runners.name: Figurehead
runners.spotlight: No wins in a varied 43-race career, although some placings in beginners' chases this term; 11lb wrong on handicap debut.

15:30.race_name: Race And Stay INH Flat Race

runners.comment: Represents respected connections, hood and tongue-tie for debut strikes a concerning note
runners.name: Cityofblindinlites
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to hurdles winner Ailt An Chorrain; dam won on the Flat over a range of distances; represents respected connections, hood and tongue-tie for debut strikes a concerning note.

runners.comment: Stumbled and unseated rider after three furlongs at Fairyhouse, 50-1 then, no appeal now
runners.name: Euro Agent
runners.spotlight: Stumbled and unseated rider after three furlongs on debut at Fairyhouse, 50-1 then; no appeal now.

runners.comment: Dam an unraced half-sister to Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Bobs Worth, stiff task on debut
runners.name: Givemegetmebuyme
runners.owner: D Kiely,L Barnes Kiely & P Fitzpatrick
runners.spotlight: E30,000 3yo; seventh foal; closely related to a minor hurdle winner Beaufort West, half-brother to bumper hurdle winner Cash The Cheque and two point winners; dam unraced half-sister to Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Bobs Worth.

runners.comment: Point winner over 2m4f, runner-up Lord Rouge has boosted the form with a Cork success
runners.name: Heldam
runners.spotlight: E110,000 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to bumper/hurdles winner Sayadam; dam won six races over hurdles in France, also won on Flat and over fences; winning favourite in a 2m4f maiden point at Punchestown on only start for Matthew Flynn O'Connor; runner-up Lord Rouge has boosted the form with a hurdling defeat of a Mullins-trained odds-on chance at Cork.

stable_tour.quote: He travelled through his point really nicely under Jamie Scallan and looked a nice type. He's only four, so we'll stick to bumpers this season. He could be a smart sort. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to the smart Spirit Leader; from a small yard, taking on big guns
runners.name: Hoof And Hustle
runners.spotlight: 11th foal; half-brother to a bumper winner and a point winner Wild Breeze; dam unraced half-sister to Jessica Harrington's talented mare Spirit Leader; from a small stable, taking on big guns here.

runners.comment: Stayed on from an unpromising position when sixth at Punchestown, open to improvement
runners.name: Ifuknowuknow
runners.spotlight: Stayed on from an unpromising position after getting outpaced at Punchestown; sixth placing was quite encouraging in the circumstances; open to improvement.

runners.comment: Had plenty of horses behind when sixth in a maiden hurdle at Punchestown last month
runners.name: Mcallister
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the trainer's 2021 Pertemps Final winner Mrs Milner, and to two other winners for this stable; had plenty of horses behind when sixth in a maiden hurdle at Punchestown last month.

runners.comment: E350,000 buy after a wide-margin point win for John Nallen at Curraghmore, dam was useful
runners.name: Minella Machine
runners.spotlight: E350,000 purchase following wide-margin point win for John Nallen at Curraghmore; fourth foal; half-brother to multiple winners Jubilee Alpha and Four Clean Aces; dam Queen Alphabet was a versatile mare who won seven races for Peter Fahey.

runners.comment: Reportedly made a good impression in winning his only point start in Britain for Tom Lacey
runners.name: Outofafrika
runners.spotlight: E25,000 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to two bumper winners Inion Tiogair and Tiger Bay Queen; dam point/3m hurdle winner; reportedly made a good impression in winning his only point start in Britain for Tom Lacey.

stable_tour.quote: He came from a UK point-to-point and is a very nice horse. He'll start off in a bumper. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Should be better for the experience of Fairyhouse debut when beaten by two stablemates
runners.name: Premier Division
runners.spotlight: Ran green and could finish only third behind two longer-priced stablemates when favourite on debut at Fairyhouse; should be better for the experience.

runners.comment: Dam has produced winners for the stable, promise on only point start, good 7lb claimer
runners.name: The Mourne Rambler
runners.spotlight: E45,000 3yo; sixth foal; stable has done well with progeny of the dam; brother to multiple winners Sixshooter and She's A Star, half-brother to bumper/hurdle winner Blue Mosque; promise when second at Portrush on only point start; good 7lb claimer booked.

runners.comment: Newcomer from a predominantly Flat stable not typically associated with bumper runners
runners.name: Royal Juliette
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-sister by Austrian School (Tiger Roll's half-brother) to winners including Royal Romeo (bumper/2m hurdle); dam well held in bumpers, half-sister to the smart Mariah Rollins; predominantly Flat stable is not typically associated with bumper runners.

12:25.race_name: Aqua Process Solutions @ Limerick 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: French import was placed in both hurdle runs at Auteuil in the spring; leading contender
runners.name: Bertutea

prev_owners.owner: Mme Marc Boudot, M Seror Et Al

runners.spotlight: French import won over 1m3f on AW in January and was placed in both hurdle runs at Auteuil in the spring (winners of both contests ran well at Graded level subsequently); leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: He could be one for the Triumph Hurdle, or else we'll go down the Fred Winter route with him. He didn't manage to win in France, but he ran well in defeat twice over hurdles and can hopefully continue to progress. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Out of his depth at Cheltenham last time; should be competitive back in a maiden
runners.name: Crooked Path
runners.spotlight: Couple of fair placed efforts in maidens prior to being out of his depth when a 66-1 chance at Cheltenham last time; should be competitive back in a maiden and has plenty of experience at this stage.

runners.comment: Good start over hurdles when unfancied at Cork, only beaten 2l on testing ground
runners.name: Dawn Coming
runners.owner: Ms P Twiss & J Twiss & M Osullivan & S Nevin Twiss
runners.spotlight: Ran four times on the level for his breeder Jim Bolger, placed in a Curragh maiden and rated 73; good start over hurdles when unfancied at Cork, only beaten 2l on testing ground.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Unplaced in three runs for Johnny Murtagh, hurdle debut on first start since being gelded
runners.name: Elman

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan

runners.spotlight: Aga Khan-bred was unplaced in three starts for Johnny Murtagh, rated 73; picked up for 18,000euros last month; hurdling debut on first start since being gelded.

runners.comment: Smart staying handicapper on the Flat (rated 91); first jumps runner for his trainer
runners.name: Kilmeaden

quotes.race: GRA Chocolates Handicap
quotes.quote: Kilmeaden has loads of ability but is just a bit gawky. Paddy gave him a great ride. I think Galway probably suited him in that he was turning, and it kept him interested. It's lovely to get a winner here. He's very laid back and I don't see any reason why he wouldn't stay further - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Smart staying handicapper on the Flat (rated 91), winning a Galway festival handicap over 1m4f and second over 1m6f at Listowel; gelded since that latter run and interesting hurdling debutant; first jumps runner for his trainer.

runners.breeder: M Matheo Viel & Mme Michel Bourgneuf
runners.comment: Not beaten far by 113-rated filly when favourite for winners' race at Punchestown
runners.name: Mode Avion
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to useful 2m hurdle winner Last Kingdom; won a 1m4f newcomers' AQPS Flat race in April; 5-4 fav for a winners' race at Punchestown last month, not beaten far by filly who's now rated 113; should come on for that experience.

runners.comment: Ex-Godolphin performer hasn't shown a great deal in three starts on the Flat; tongue-tie
runners.name: Padre Bay
runners.spotlight: Ex-Godolphin performer hasn't shown a great deal in three starts on the Flat, including on stable debut at Dundalk last week; best watched on hurdling debut; tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Ran well off mark of 55 in Listowel festival handicap (1m3f, heavy); stable/hurdles debut
runners.name: Royal Belief
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in five starts on the Flat for John O'Donoghue although ran well off mark of 55 in Listowel festival handicap (1m3f, heavy); bought for 6,000euros last month; stable/hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Unraced for Donnacha O'Brien and bought for 4,400gns in May; best watched on debut
runners.name: Sycamore Cove
runners.spotlight: Brother to winners Alder (Listed-placed 1m 2yo/1m2f; RPR 108) and Altair (7f AW/9.4f; 88), half-brother to seven winners including Radiantly (Group-placed 7.4f 2yo; 103) and Phosphorescence (1m-1m4f inc AW; 83); unraced for Donnacha O'Brien and bought for 4,400gns in May; best watched on debut.

runners.comment: Moderate Flat form in six runs for Andy Slattery; unlikely to contend on hurdling debut
runners.name: Arizona Robbins
runners.spotlight: Moderate Flat form in six runs for Andy Slattery; unlikely to contend on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Long way behind Crooked Path on hurdling debut and will probably be one for handicaps
runners.name: Red Veil

prev_owners.owner: J Kirkland & Mrs J M Ryan

runners.spotlight: Regressive on the Flat but ran okay on hurdling debut at Gowran in October; long way behind Crooked Path on that occasion, though, and will probably be one for handicaps.

runners.comment: Six-time British Flat winner could be a useful hurdling recruit
runners.name: Atlantic Gamble
runners.spotlight: Won six times at around 1m last year in Britain, including four times on the AW; has won on soft and heavy; officially rated 77; could be a useful recruit to hurdling for Paul Gilligan.

runners.comment: PU when sent off 200-1 for Cork maiden hurdle debut and impossible to fancy based on that
runners.name: Allow Sound
runners.spotlight: Pulled-up when sent off 200-1 for Cork maiden hurdle debut and impossible to fancy based on that.

runners.comment: Placed form on Flat; likely needs a lot of improvement for switch to hurdles
runners.name: Convincing
runners.spotlight: Placed form on the Flat, leaves him with a mark of 67 in that sphere; likely needs a lot of improvement for this switch to hurdles.

runners.comment: Never a factor in Gowran debut at 200-1 and tailed off at Cork last time; ruled out
runners.name: Dearg Mor
runners.spotlight: Never a factor in Gowran debut at 200-1 and tailed off at Cork last time; ruled out in first-time hood.

runners.comment: Potential in third place point finish and not disgraced on rules debut when 4th
runners.name: Jessbers Wish
runners.spotlight: Showed potential when third in a point-to-point for Denis Murphy (winner sold for 200,000GBP) and wasn't disgraced on rules debut in a Fairyhouse heavy-ground bumper after being pestered for the lead and weakening into fourth of six.

runners.comment: Runner-up in sole French start and form of that race looks strong; could be anything
runners.name: Laurets Destruval
runners.spotlight: Wore a tongue-tie (now left off) when runner-up in sole French start, a heavy ground 2m1f Pau conditions hurdle; the winner of that race has gone on to score Listed hurdle and chase wins; makes debut for top connections and could be anything, but that French run was more than a year ago, so may improve for the run.

runners.breeder: S A S Elevage Du Livet
runners.comment: Positive runs in bumpers the last twice, runner-up and fourth; makes hurdling debut
runners.name: Le Roi Du Livet
runners.spotlight: Good runs in bumpers the last two times; beaten just a nose at Tramore in October (2m, yielding) and the rival who beat him that day easily won over hurdles subsequently; ran to a similar level when fourth at Navan last time in a better quality contest (soft to heavy); makes hurdling debut now.

runners.comment: Sent off 250-1 for Cork hurdles debut and was tailed off; very unlikely
runners.name: Lucky Crystal
runners.spotlight: Sent off 250-1 for Cork hurdles debut and was tailed off; very unlikely.

runners.comment: Placed twice on Flat for Andrew Balding but tailed off on hurdling debut last time
runners.name: Parkland
runners.spotlight: Placed twice on the Flat for Andrew Balding; questions to answer on his 2025 Flat form and didn't answer those when tailed off on hurdling debut at Navan last time.

runners.comment: Big odds for opening three maidens and ran like it; rule him out
runners.name: Poets Oath
runners.spotlight: Big odds for opening three maidens and ran like it; rule him out.

runners.comment: Half-brother to Mighty Potter was 26l behind stable first-string on debut; sharper now
runners.name: Ravendark
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to five winners, including high-class Mighty Potter, French Dynamite and Brighterdaysahead; purchased for E350,000 as a 3yo; was a 26l third behind stable first-string at Fairyhouse on debut (yielding to soft); should be sharper now.

stable_tour.quote: He's still very weak but has the makings of a nice horse when he matures and strengthens up. He'll appear in a bumper when he's ready. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Runner-up in second point shaped as if he needed the run when 23l behind on rules debut
runners.name: Sense Of Occasion
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Belclare maiden point-to-point on second start in that sphere; shaped as if he needed the run when 23l behind on rules debut in a decent-looking maiden hurdle at Navan (soft to heavy); more required.

runners.comment: Winner of second point start; disappointed on rules debut last time; capable of better
runners.name: Sound As A Bell
runners.spotlight: Homebred easily won a Quakerstown point-to-point in April under Derek O'Connor on second start in that discipline; towards the top of the market for maiden hurdle debut at Punchestown (2m3f, soft to heavy) but tailed off; likely capable of better.

runners.breeder: M Guillaume Sarda & M Michel Morre
runners.comment: Closely related to Forcing Bull; interesting jockey booking
runners.name: Star Of The Week
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; closely related to point and 2m1f hurdle/2m4f chase winner Forcing Bull; dam ran once in Switzerland, half-sister to smart 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Farclas, out of Swiss 10.7f Listed winner; interesting jockey booking.

runners.comment: Bungled the last over C&D latest to finish 2nd behind subsequent Gr.3 winner; big player
runners.name: Starting Fifteen
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred ran fine races in bumpers here and at Punchestown last spring; stepped up on poor Listowel bumper run when travelling strongly jumping the second-last over C&D (good to yielding) last time before making a mess of the last to finish second; the winner that day has won a Grade 3 since and runs in a Grade 1 over Christmas so the form is solid; big player.

runners.comment: Not a potential maiden winner at this stage, judged on two Punchestown runs
runners.name: The Dancen Kid
runners.spotlight: Not a potential maiden winner at this stage, judged on two Punchestown runs.

runners.comment: No wins in his opening four point-to-points and that form shouldn't be good enough
runners.name: Wise Man
runners.spotlight: No wins in his opening four point-to-points and that form shouldn't be good enough.

runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to 2m5f/3m hurdle winner Atlantic Gold; others more appealing
runners.name: Cailin Mahler
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; dam unraced half-sister to 2m5f/3m hurdle winner Atlantic Gold and bumper winner Tina Marie, out of bumper winner; others more appealing.

runners.comment: Reserve; tailed off in opening m'dens and 18.5l behind last time; unlikely.
runners.name: Jaynemax
runners.spotlight: First reserve; tailed off in opening two maiden hurdles and 18.5l behind at Naas last time; unlikely.

runners.comment: Reserve; dam unraced half-sister to 1m Flat/2m hurdle winner Lady In Lavender
runners.name: Success Mode
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; dam unraced half-sister to 1m Flat/2m hurdle winner Lady In Lavender and point/2m7f chase winner Lady Kate; not of huge appeal on paper.

runners.comment: Reserve; heavy ground placed form in France and of obvious interest for top connections
runners.name: Roc Dino

prev_owners.owner: Bdi Racing Team & Mme Floriane De Maupeou Dableiges

runners.spotlight: Third reserve; joined top connections following three French heavy ground runs; took the runner-up spot in a Pau conditions hurdle in January and third in a more valuable Auteuil contest in February; of obvious interest in getting a run.

runners.comment: Much improved to win a m'den hurdle by 16l and took runner-up spot latest; in the mix
runners.name: County Final

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I don't know how strong the race was, but County Final  jumped well and won well. He ran well in fifth at Punchestown and is definitely learning as he goes along. There are no big plans for him. It was a restricted maiden hurdle for horses who hadn't been in the first four, and he had the bit of experience which helped - Frank Berry, racing manager to owner JP McManus.

runners.spotlight: Well-backed when getting off the mark at Navan (2m3f, yielding) on third hurdle start, showing much improved form to win by 16l; kept on well to take the runner-up spot in a Punchestown novice handicap last time (2m1f, soft to heavy); should be in the mix.

runners.comment: Benefitted from fall of leader to win at Cork; return to this type of trip should suit
runners.name: Kazansky

quotes.race: BAR 1 Casino Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: The horse in front looked like he was gone, but it happened to us in the first. We had luck on our side, but Kazansky is a galloper and stays well - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Beaten a head in second point-to-point start for Sam Curling before winning next time; three lengths down when hampered by fall of leading stablemate at the final flight at Down Royal on rules debut (2m6f, good to yielding); had a change of fortune at Cork latest when benefiting from final flight fall of leader to score (2m1f, soft to heavy); possibly the stable first-string and this trip should suit.

stable_tour.quote: He worked nicely last week. He's a staying chaser in the making but should be up to winning a maiden hurdle before then. 26-10-25

runners.breeder: M Alban Chevalier Du Fau & M Emmanuel Chevalier Du Fau
runners.comment: Debut bumper winner scored on 2nd hurdles run upped in trip on softer conditions last time
runners.name: Santo Sospir

quotes.race: Sebden Steel Maiden Hurdle
