quotes.quote: He was good and toughed it out really well from the back of the last. Jack said Santo Sospir lost a bit of momentum when he pricked his ears and ran around a bit at the last. He's obviously stepped forward from Wexford and hopefully he'll be a nice novice going forward. I think further will definitely suit him and he handles those ground conditions, so he'll have loads of options for the winter - Lisa O'Neill, assistant trainer

runners.spotlight: Scored on debut in a six-runner heavy ground Punchestown bumper in February; well beaten on hurdling debut at Wexford, but appeared to benefit from step up in trip when winning a Punchestown maiden hurdle by 1l last time (2m3f, soft to heavy); step up in trip looks like it will suit him, but possibly the stable second-string.

stable_tour.quote: He showed a really good attitude to get up late and land a Punchestown bumper in February. He's working well and will return in a maiden hurdle over the coming weeks. 26-10-25

runners.comment: M'den hurdle winner stepped forward with a clear 2nd in a Gr.3 last time; big player
runners.name: The Big Clubman

quotes.race: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Coming here for his first run of the season we just said we'd give The Big Clubman a nice education. Once we hit the rising ground turning in he was picking up and I thought going to the last with a good jump we'd win. They went a good gallop and he is still a shade green, so they were going a shade quick for him for a lot of the race, but he has a good background from the point-to-points and jumped super. There should be plenty of improvement in him and he can step up in trip as well - Sean O'Keeffe, jockey

runners.spotlight: Faller on point-to-point debut before taking the runner-up spot next time; stayed on well when scoring on rules debut for Paul Nolan in a Wexford maiden hurdle (2m, good), beating subsequent winner Parnell Street by 2l; stepped up on that to take a clear runner-up spot in a Navan Grade 3 last time (2m4f, heavy); looks a stayer so this trip should suit; big contender.

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with how he stepped up from his maiden hurdle win when finishing second in a Navan Grade 3 this month. He was getting a slap down the shoulder there after jumping a few hurdles and I was getting worried, but he stayed on very well, to suggest you'd definitely be thinking of stepping him up in trip. He looks like a decent stayer. He's one to look forward to. If we're thinking of going to Cheltenham, maybe the Albert Bartlett could be a target. I am grateful to all the generous owners I have who have allowed me to find horses of his quality. 23-11-25

runners.comment: Well backed to get off the mark last time when making all; entitled to improve; chance
runners.name: Yeshil
runners.spotlight: Second in the 25-runner Goffs Defender Bumper at the 2024 Punchestown festival; transferred to Henry De Bromhead last season; ran only once, faded from two out to finish eighth in a Leopardstown maiden won by Kopek Des Bordes; well backed and made all to gain his first win in a Punchestown maiden last time (2m4f, heavy); entitled to improve on that and the step up in trip should do him no harm.

runners.comment: Tramore bumper and hurdle winner; didn't see out 24.5f trip last time after untidy jumps
runners.name: Barra Rua

quotes.race: New Years Day Discount Tickets Online Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Barra Rua might just lack a gear and, as you say, it was a surprise she won a bumper but she has a bit of class about her and she'll go up in distance down the line I'm sure. It was nice to get her head in front there today - Donagh Meyler, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Barra Rua had very solid form and she definitely deserved to win this race today. We tried to make a test of it today because she stays well. I thought I might have got up on the nod, but you never know - Maxine O'Sullivan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Tramore bumper winner got off the mark over hurdles at the second attempt back there in November (2m5f, soft); didn't quite see out the 24.5f trip in a Cork Grade 3 (soft to heavy) last time under a positive ride after some untidy jumps late on; can do better but a bit to find all the same.

runners.comment: M'den hurdle winner has been running consistently in h'cap hurdles; thereabouts again
runners.name: Carried With Love
runners.spotlight: Comfortable Cork maiden hurdle winner (good) has been running very consistently in recent handicap hurdle starts, third last thrice; up 1lb following Thurles run latest (2m4f, good to yielding); has handled softer ground before and should be thereabouts again.

runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner was 25l behind last time; others make more appeal
runners.name: Ms Agartha Yeats
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner with both wins coming at Wexford; fell at the first on seasonal debut at Fairyhouse and beaten 25l at Navan (2m4f, soft to heavy) last time, prominent but weakening quickly at the last; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Point winner got off the mark under rules with victory in a m'den last time; in the mix
runners.name: Katie Daniels
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner built on a promising Clonmel maiden hurdle third (2m4f, yielding) to make the breakthrough at Fairyhouse last time in a 2m4f mares' maiden hurdle, keeping on well (heavy); in the mix on handicap bow.

runners.comment: Point and m'den hurdle winner last term but didn't progress; slight ground questions too
runners.name: Magic Boum

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: We thought Magic Boum would run a nice race and maybe go back for a bumper so this was a nice surprise. She was tough and honest and but for a mistake at the last she would have won easier - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Point-to-point and 2m maiden hurdle winner (good to yielding) last year but didn't progress, last seen when pulled up after a poor round of jumping at Downpatrick in March; has won after a break before but slight question mark on this ground (has been withdrawn based on heavy/soft ground recently).

stable_tour.quote: She created a nice impression when she won her point at Kildorrery and she'll be ready to show up in a fillies' bumper in the coming weeks. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Sole win came in this race in 2023 and runner-up here last year; can't be ruled out
runners.name: Phils Choice
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in this contest in 2023 (soft to heavy) off 9lb lower; took the runner-up spot here last year off current mark; hasn't shown a lot in four runs since and failed to complete at Fairyhouse when last seen, but she can't be ruled out back here.

runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner has run well in both h'caps; there's a win in her off this mark
runners.name: Cousin Kate

quotes.race: www.tramoreraces.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Look, it wasn't the strongest of races and it kind of fell apart in front of me, but they all take winning and it was good to get it. Cousin Kate is out of a good mare, so hopefully she can build on that and win plenty more races - Daniel King, Jockey.

runners.spotlight: Much improved to land a moderate Tramore maiden hurdle in October (2m, yielding) and took the runner-up spot on handicap debut at Gowran following that (2m4f, heavy) when headed at the final hurdle; again ran well as favourite back at Tramore latest (2m5f, soft) when keeping on well from the rear to take third after finding herself a fair way back; there's a win in her off this mark.

runners.comment: Debut bumper winner on hvy but opening h'cap efforts leave her with a bit to find
runners.name: Miss Mini Bee

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 4-Y-O Fillies INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Miss Mini Bee is a big filly but only a frame. She should hopefully improve a good bit from this - Pat Foley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Debut bumper winner on heavy last winter but is 0-8 hurdling and opening handicap efforts leave her with a bit to find, although 7l fourth at Thurles last time (2m4f, yielding to soft) was an improvement; possibly on a tough mark.

runners.comment: Modest form before winning at Wexford; not out of it when falling latest; place chance
runners.name: Cathryns Ruby

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: She's not the most straightforward to train but when things fall right for Cathryns Ruby you'd think she would have to have a chance in this grade but hard to be confident in - Pat Foley, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.spotlight: Modest form overall before getting off the mark in a 0-100 Wexford handicap (2m4f, yielding), keen enough but seeing it out well; not completely out of it off this mark when falling at the second-last at Thurles last time (2m4f, yielding to soft); may play a role but others more likely.

runners.comment: Fairyhouse h'cap winner in Feb' but well beaten in summer run; this ground may suit better
runners.name: Westernersunrise
runners.spotlight: Fairyhouse handicap winner in February off 95 (2m4f, soft); well beaten at Punchestown in June following that (2m7f, good to yielding); this ground likely suits better but may need this.

runners.comment: Maiden after ten runs and 17.5l behind on seasonal return latest; much more needed
runners.name: Catchabird
runners.spotlight: Maiden after ten runs; made her seasonal return at Punchestown last month when 17.5l behind the winner (2m3f, soft to heavy); much more required.

runners.comment: Winless from 11 and latest two runs don't fill one with confidence
runners.name: Arctic Piper
runners.spotlight: Winless from 11 starts and latest two runs don't fill one with confidence of her making the breakthrough; pulled up at Punchestown last time when weakening quickly.

runners.comment: Won at the 26th attempt last time; can go well again, but overall record is off-putting
runners.name: Milanaway
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 26th attempt at Punchestown last time when making all for a game success (3m, heavy); can go well again despite being 1lb wrong, but her overall record is off-putting.

14:40.race_name: O'Kelly Brothers Demolition Rated Novice Chase

runners.comment: Winning hurdler was out of depth in Gr. 2 latest but was placed in two chases earlier
runners.name: Ad Caelum

quotes.race: Racing Again December 21st Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The rain really helped Ad Caelum and she's an exciting mare for the future. Sean really fancied her and I was a bit concerned as she likes to get her toe in, but the ground has gone yielding which helped. She'll need soft ground and should be progressive in handicaps, or she could go to a rated novice hurdle - John Ryan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Four-time winning hurdler took second place in small-field mares' chases at Sligo and Clonmel in October; unplaced in two runs following that, and way out of her depth in the Grade 2 Hilly Way at Cork last time; this is a more appropriate level and not discounted.

runners.comment: A repeat of his fifth behind Kopek Des Bordes on penultimate could see him go close
runners.name: Anotherway

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At Bet Victor Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Anotherway stayed and galloped to the line but his jumping left a lot to be desired. Maybe it was the heavy ground as he jumped a lot better at Leopardstown. But he did what he was showing us at home today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner for Willie Mullins (2m, heavy); found wanting in valuable handicaps and yet to shine for current yard, although there were positives in his fifth-place finish behind Kopek Des Bordes at Navan and a repeat of that could see him go close.

stable_tour.quote: A fine horse who came to us from Freddy Head in France. He didn't take his gelding overly well and took a while to recover from it. He's perfect now and I'd say he's a nice horse. 13-11-23

runners.comment: Fair hurdler for Nicky Henderson but finished last on stable debut latest
runners.name: Choccabloc

prev_owners.owner: J & J Potter Ltd And Kelvin-Hughes

runners.spotlight: Fair 128-rated hurdler for Nicky Henderson, winning a bumper and hurdle race and taking the runner-up spot in his final two starts for that outfit; returned from a day short of a year off with a 29l last on stable/chase debut at Punchestown last time (2m, heavy) in first-time tongue-tie; much more needed.

stable_tour.quote: A progressive young horse who won novice hurdles at Market Rasen and Ludlow last season. There's no doubt he'll go chasing at some stage, and possibly soon as he's always been a sound jumper. He's an exciting prospect for the season. 22-10-24

runners.breeder: S A R L Mm Stud
runners.comment: Last win came in 2022 and returned from absence with two recent tailed off finishes
runners.name: Gatsby Grey

quotes.race: Keith Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gatsby Grey had not impressed much in his homework but we galloped him at Punchestown, dropping him in behind horses, and he seems to have turned a corner - Oliver McKiernan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner, with his last win coming in 2022; generally poor form since and has returned from a 382-day absence with two tailed off finishes; others preferred.

runners.comment: Dogged by poor jumping in three chase starts but big player with a clear round
runners.name: Moudan
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner on heavy, including here; 125-1 for Naas chasing debut when unseated at the first, and fell at two out when weakening in a Navan beginner's won by Kopek Des Bordes next time; managed to complete at Clonmel last time to take third (2m1f, heavy); kept on well that day and he's a big player with a clear round.

runners.comment: Half-brother to Inothewayurthinkin has been tailed off at huge prices in last 2 chase runs
runners.name: Mywayofthinkin

quotes.race: Tuesday Treat At Punchestown Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Mywayofthinkin is a big horse and we were glad to see the rain this morning. He was professional over the last two when it was needed. He'll be going out to grass shortly - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Gold Cup winner Inothewayurthinkin; 2m Punchestown maiden hurdle winner last season; pulled up on chasing debut and tailed off in two starts following that at huge prices; best watched unless the market speaks.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing over hurdles last season. We're going to go chasing with him and hopefully he can find some improvement. 04-11-25

He got off the mark on his hurdles debut at Punchestown in May after a couple of good runs in bumpers. We're waiting on a bit of rain for him and we'll get him started in a rated novice, probably over two miles. He's a grand horse. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Placed once in ten chase starts; let down by jumping on stable debut and PU latest
runners.name: No Flies On Him

quotes.race: TRI Equestrian Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: "I chose No Flies On Him as a three-year-old at the Derby sales when JP very kindly let me pick one out and he sent him for his education with Derek O'Connor, who did a fantastic job with him. He has a wonderful pedigree and he looks like a very promising horse. I've had a lot of swans over the last few years who have turned out as geese but I think this fella might stay a swan! He will have to be entered in Grade 1s after this and hopefully he might get there - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner has been placed just once in ten chase starts (a Leopardstown beginners' this time last year); out of form since then, sent off favourite on stable debut in October in a Down Royal handicap chase but let down by jumping and reportedly lost his action when pulled up at Cork last month; probably best watched.

runners.comment: Last year's winner off 106 doesn't look obviously well-treated on recent efforts
runners.name: Dream In The Park

quotes.race: BRC McMahon Reinforcements Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Dream In The Park jumps well and was better handicapped over fences than over hurdles, so we decided to try it. We schooled him the other day at home and he jumped particularly well - Eric McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Grundon Waste Management Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dream In The Park wants a true gallop and the plan was to take a lead. He ended up being a bit keen in behind off a slow pace but Jack knows the horse well, rides him at home and was able to think on his feet. He learned how to win last time and doing it like he did today hopefully means he won't be going up the handicap too quickly. He's still leaning and I'd love to see him in a race where they go a proper gallop - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Last year's winner off 106 (yielding to soft) under this rider, perhaps fortunate that day when better better-travelling leader fell two out; just three runs since, seventh at the Galway festival before third back over fences at that venue in October; 14.5l fourth at Thurles latest; not obviously well treated.

stable_tour.quote: He won two over hurdles last season but he was a sick horse afterwards. He took a big blow on his chase debut at Hereford and will come on a lot for that run. 22-11-23

This fine big, fine moving individual really looks the part. He may run this week at either Ffos Las or Uttoxeter. He is a proper National Hunt type and going jumping will be the making of him. I think he will be an interesting bumper horse as he is such a strong traveller in his work. I would imagine the bumpers at this time of year will be very competitive, but he should go well. 26-10-21

runners.comment: Bolted up at Ayr but was beaten when UR at Hexham latest; in the mix on this ground
runners.name: Truckers Cruising
runners.owner: Ed Mulligan & John Finnegan & Aileen Saunders & Ann Holton

prev_owners.owner: Ed Mulligan & John Finnegan & Aileen Saunders & Ann Holton

quotes.race: Ayr Racecourse Racing Club Only £50 Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a low-grade race, there's no point getting excited, and he was down the bottom of the weights but Truckers Cruising won well. I don't know how far he can go but hopefully he can win another one - Gordon Elliott, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Bolted up at Ayr (2m, heavy) earlier in the month when back over fences for second chase start; however, he was beaten when unseating at the final fence at Hexham 16 days ago (2m4f, heavy); in the mix with this ground to suit.

runners.comment: Four-time chase winner in great form in two hurdling runs this term; big chance
runners.name: Happy Dreams

quotes.race: Campion Insurance Tim Duggan Memorial Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Happy Dreams loves Limerick. He was well-in at the weights today, right in at the bottom of the handicap, and young Mark (McDonagh) gave him a lovely ride - Michael McDonagh, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner has started this season in great form in two runs over hurdles, winning by 20l around here over 2m5f on heavy ground before going down by a neck off 108 at Cork earlier this month (2m4f, soft to heavy); big chance back over fences in this form.

runners.comment: Goes well in hvy ground and distant runner-up finish latest was best run for some time
runners.name: Mount Frisco
runners.spotlight: Goes well in heavy ground, winning a 2m Tramore novice chase in January last year and a 2m novice handicap hurdle around here later that month; out of form for some time but his distant runner-up finish under forceful tactics by today's rider in a Thurles handicap chase last time was his best run for some time (2m5f, yielding); needs more of the same.

runners.comment: Tailed off on return from lengthy absence last time and best watched for now
runners.name: Teescomponentsyess

quotes.race: Garrarus Beach (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Teescomponentsyess was another cheap purchase and he had been doing everything right at home, we like him now. He jumps well and will probably go hurdling now but he could go back for a winners bumper. We'll see how he comes out of the race and he is an exciting horse to have - Rachel O'Neill, assistant trainer

runners.spotlight: Four-time winner under rules, sole chase win was most recent, at Gowran in February last year (2m4f, heavy); returned from a 624-day absence at Fairyhouse (2m4f, heavy) last time when tailed off; best watched for now.

runners.comment: Placed in both beginners' chase starts and handled heavy latest; chance on h'cap debut
runners.name: Sophia Rose
runners.spotlight: Sligo maiden hurdle winner in August (2m4f, good); has placed in both beginner's chase starts, 3.5l second at Downpatrick (2m3f, yielding) before fading late on into third at Gowran latest (2m4f, heavy); chance on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Won 2nd chase start last time; 7lb rise not beyond her but slight question as to ground
runners.name: Stoneyford Lady

quotes.race: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was great to see Stoneyford Lady win finally. She has been such an enigma, but she has a good pedigree, so it's nice that she has a win now - Henry De Bromhead, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler has made a promising start to her chasing career; took the runner-up position in a Thurles beginners' before making the breakthrough in a handicap back there last time (2m2f, yielding); 7lb rise is not beyond her but slight question mark on this ground (29l last in a heavy-ground bumper, but took third in a soft-ground maiden hurdle).

runners.comment: Four-time hurdles winner has very off-putting chase form
runners.name: Little Mixup

quotes.race: Spring Festival Trials At Naas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Little Mixup had been freshened up nicely for this race. We weren't so sure about the ground but he relished it and he could win another - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdles winner has off putting chase form; chase form is off-putting, once refused, twice unseated and tailed off twice in five chase runs.

runners.comment: Bagged second hurdles here last year; lost form since, tailed off in completed starts
runners.name: Knockbrack Rambler

quotes.race: Racing Home For Easter Festival 30th March To 1st April Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Knockbrack Rambler got a great ride from Cal who just waited and waited. The ground was maybe too soft the last day, not as deep today. We might go again in a couple of weeks - Brendan Walsh, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Got his second hurdles win when taking a 2m3f handicap here last year off 94 (2m3f, yielding to soft); lost form since, finishing tailed off in his completed starts.

runners.comment: Winner of h'cap chase off 87 in summer and hurdles winner here latest; not ruled out
runners.name: Doyen Magic
runners.spotlight: Off the mark immediately over fences when taking a 2m4f Kilbeggan handicap in July off 87 (good to yielding); returned to hurdles at this venue last time to gain her first win in that sphere with a comfortable 4l success (2m, heavy); that was her first run here, so not ruled out back here over fences.

runners.comment: Fifth last two times at Clonmel over fences, improving in second run; needs more
runners.name: Kilbrin Rocco

quotes.race: Grant Bros Developments Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kilbrin Rocco is a nice horse. We were happy in Thurles last time, beaten 20l but he was staying on and Adrian Heskin said he will win races - Mick Winters, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Winner of a Downpatrick handicap hurdle in April last year for Mick Winters (2m3f, good) off 88; has returned from a lengthy break for new yard and has improved in his two runs over fences, 11l fifth at Clonmel in October (2m5f, good to yielding) and 7.25l fifth at the same venue last month (2m1f, soft); needs more in this higher grade; declared for 3.11 at Limerick on Saturday.

runners.comment: Struggled over fences this season and no signs of a change back over hurdles last time
runners.name: Carlas Big Jim

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Carlas Big Jim probably got an easy lead, but he acts well on that ground. Cal knows him very well and he says he jumps better when he's up there. We might run him next in a qualifier for the Full Circle Series at Cork - Louis Archdeacon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has generally struggled in runs over fences this season, and there weren't any signs of a change in fortune when the dual hurdles winner returned to that sphere at Cork last time, beaten 28l (2m4f, soft to heavy); winless over fences and hard to fancy.

runners.comment: No wins from 12 but took third at this venue in Nov' last year; tailed off last twice
runners.name: Road To The Weir
runners.spotlight: No wins from 12 starts, although he did take third position at this venue in November last year (2m, heavy) in a lower grade of race; tailed off in a Sligo handicap hurdle on seasonal return and same story in a Thurles beginners' chase last time; 3lb wrong.

runners.breeder: M Goulven, Mlle Celine, M Pierre-Yves Berthouloux & Mme Fa
runners.comment: Veteran won a modest h'cap in the summer but this is a step above that and 12lb wrong
runners.name: Dontdooddson
runners.owner: Profit In Your Pocket Racing Club
runners.spotlight: Veteran showed he retains the ability to compete at a modest level when winning a 0-100 handicap hurdle at Wexford in the summer (2m, good); this is a step above that and he is 12lb wrong.

15:50.race_name: Play perysbingo.com Mares INH Flat Race

runners.comment: Little sign of promise in a bumper in 2024 and two maiden hurdles lately; look elsewhere
runners.name: Beautiful Beauty
runners.spotlight: Little sign of promise in a bumper in 2024 and two maiden hurdles lately; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Point winner is by a top sire so respected but is untested on ground this deep
runners.name: Jury Time
runners.spotlight: Represents a top point-to-point yard and won in that sphere herself at Lisronagh in November; is by a top sire so respected but is untested on ground this deep.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two bumpers and makes no appeal for the moment
runners.name: Lady Hotham

prev_owners.owner: C Wright, D Kilburn And Pfi Cole

runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in two bumpers and makes no appeal for the moment.

runners.comment: Last time was an improvement but is still likely to find several too strong today
runners.name: Little Ivy
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in a point and two maiden hurdles; last time was an improvement but is still likely to find several too strong today.

runners.comment: Has shown some ability in a UK bumper UK and on debut for this yard; needs a fair bit more
runners.name: Musique Des Champs
runners.spotlight: Has shown some ability in a bumper when trained in UK and on debut for this yard at Cork; has to find a fair bit more today.

runners.comment: From a family that produces bumper winners; eyecatching jockey booking; check the market
runners.name: Nans Choice
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners She's A Fine Wine (bumper and useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase) and There Runs Mary (bumper/2m hurdle); Eur8,000 foal comes from a family that produces bumper winners; eyecatching jockey booking; check the market.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in bumpers at Listowel and Fairyhouse; needs to find plenty of improvement
runners.name: Never Late
runners.spotlight: Has been soundly beaten in bumpers at Listowel and Fairyhouse; needs to find significant improvement for this more testing ground.

runners.comment: Not a bad pedigree but is likely to improve from this debut
runners.name: Pegasuslane
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam well beaten in points, half-sister to winners De Bene Esse (2m3f chase/2m6f hurdle) and Dante's Way (bumper); not a bad pedigree but is likely to improve from this debut.

runners.comment: Sold out of Gordon Elliott's yard for only GBP2,500 earlier this year; likely best watched
runners.name: Quiet In Bresil
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Quesada (German 1m Listed) and Quiliano (French 2m2f Listed hurdle), out of Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner; by a leading sire and cost 42,000GBP as a 2yo but was sold out of Gordon Elliott's yard for only 2,500GBP earlier this year; best watched unless market support.

runners.comment: Disappointing in a maiden hurdle last time but could be involved if getting back to best
runners.name: Soldierstown
runners.spotlight: Point winner ran creditably in defeat in bumpers at Fairyhouse and Sligo earlier in the year; however, was disappointing in a maiden hurdle on return to action; is capable of getting involved if getting back to her best.

runners.comment: Point winner faces much softer ground on bumper bow but is a player if handling it
runners.name: Storm Queen
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m winner (RPR 68), half-sister to useful 7f/1m Flat and 2m-2m2f hurdle/chase winner Tap Tap Boom; Flat-bred filly won a point in the spring on sole start for this yard; faces much softer ground on bumper bow but a player if handling it.

runners.comment: Point winner can improve from recent comeback; is one to consider, check the market
runners.name: Think It Through
runners.spotlight: Won a heavy-ground point in 2024; beaten 15l in a Naas bumper 11 days ago on first run since but is entitled to come on from that run; a respected rider aboard so is one to consider, especially if strong in the market.

runners.comment: Beaten favourite last twice and vulnerable again for all that she is likely to be involved
runners.name: Torpille Dagrostis
runners.spotlight: Has been placed in a point and all three bumper runs in varying ground conditions; however, she has been a beaten favourite the last twice and is vulnerable again for all that she is likely to be involved.

stable_tour.quote: She's a sharp filly who was just beaten in a Cork bumper. She could land a bumper somewhere before heading over hurdles. She's already run well in a point and can jump. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Ran respectably on debut in a strong Navan maiden h'dle; should have improved since; noted
runners.name: Walking Saint
runners.spotlight: Cost Eur90,000 as a 3yo; ran respectably on debut in a strong maiden hurdle at Navan; should have improved from that experience and is one to consider reverting to a bumper.

11:40.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Downpatrick bumper winner who went close in a maiden hurdle; fitness is the big question
runners.name: Augusta George
runners.spotlight: Downpatrick bumper winner who went close in a maiden hurdle at that venue before finishing tailed off here when last seen; fitness is the big question on return from 420 days off.

runners.comment: Flat/bumper winner; creditable run back over timber latest and that form is working out
runners.name: Dippedinmoonlight
runners.spotlight: Flat winner this season and won a bumper last term; creditable effort when fourth back over timber at Fairyhouse last month and that form is working out nicely already; a return to quicker ground is no issue and ought to go well.

stable_tour.quote: She's acquitted herself well in three bumpers, winning at Downpatrick before finishing third in a good Listed race at Gowran which has worked out well with a Cheltenham winner behind her. She's a filly for better ground, so she's on a break and probably won't be back until next summer for a hurdles campaign. We'll mind her as she's only four. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Bumper winner on rules bow; form hasn't worked out but improver up in trip if fit
runners.name: Miss Doyenne
runners.spotlight: Point winner who made a winning start under rules in a mares' bumper at Cork; that form hasn't worked out particularly well but there's more to come stepping up in trip; off 249 days.

runners.comment: Half-brother to a bumper winner; newcomer for a yard in form and worth market check
runners.name: Albus
runners.spotlight: Elusive Pimpernel gelding; half-brother to bumper winner Mason City; dam 8.4f/1m6f Flat (RPR 77) and 2m3f hurdle winner, half-sister to 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner Mr Montague; newcomer for a yard in form and worth market check.

runners.comment: Golden Lariat gelding; dam half-sister to bumper/hurdle winner; likely to need this
runners.name: Areema Dreamer
runners.spotlight: Golden Lariat gelding; dam unplaced in bumpers, half-sister to bumper and 2m/2m4f hurdle winner Westerbee; probably going to need this.

runners.comment: Promise in second bumper run; tailed off either side of that and off 238 days
runners.name: Astley
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in one of his three bumper starts when a distant second at Clonmel and that race worked out okay but tailed off in both starts either side of that and he's entitled to need this after 238 days off.

runners.comment: Placed in 2 of 3 point starts; hasn't really kicked on under rules yet but trip will help
runners.name: Ballyedward
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of his three point starts; hasn't really kicked on under rules yet but step up in trip is going to help.

runners.comment: Ran well in all three point starts but 2m4f on this ground could be sharp on rules debut
runners.name: Blueys Unicorse
runners.spotlight: Chased home Aspurofthemoment in a Dromahane point before going one better in a point that worked out well at Damma House; not so good on his third point outing last month but may have needed that; interesting now switched to rules but 2m4f on decent ground could be too sharp.

runners.comment: Jet Away gelding; half-brother to 3 winners and good chance he'll need this
runners.name: Brackens Jet
runners.spotlight: Jet Away gelding; half-brother to winners Lubeat Foras (bumper/3m hurdle), Tico Times (2m-2m5f chase) and Tomgarrow (2m-3m4f hurdle including US); dam unraced half-sister to bumper and 2m-2m3f hurdle chase winner Beautiful Vision; good chance he'll need this.

runners.comment: Promise in 2 points and went close on rules debut; sharper test here; sets the standard
runners.name: Court Compliance
runners.spotlight: Promise in two points and went close to causing an upset on rules debut at Punchestown (2m4f, soft to heavy) last month; that form is already working out and while this is a sharper test, he sets a good standard.

runners.comment: Shaped like further would suit when 6th in bumper here; similar form when 2nd at Ayr
runners.name: Largy Spirit
runners.spotlight: Shaped like further would suit when sixth in a bumper here and ran to a similar level when a distant runner-up at Carlisle when last seen; step forward required on return and has been off 251 days.

runners.comment: Tailed off a long way out when 50-1 for his debut last month
runners.name: Mr Devlin
runners.spotlight: Tailed off a long way out when 50-1 for his debut last month.

runners.comment: 150-1 and ran as expected when tailed off over this trip at Navan on debut
runners.name: Native Policy
runners.spotlight: 150-1 and ran as expected when tailed off over this trip at Navan on debut.

runners.comment: Distant 4th on debut over 2m1f here and step up in trip will suit; first string
runners.name: Sept Etoiles
runners.spotlight: Distant fourth on debut over 2m1f here was promising and a step up in trip is likely to suit; yard's first string and respected with a run under his belt.

runners.comment: Point winner but was tailed off when 80-1 for her rules debut last month
runners.name: Bet On Beauty
runners.spotlight: Point winner but was tailed off when 80-1 for her rules debut last month and more of a long-term project.

runners.comment: Struggled under rules a couple of seasons ago and 0-8 in points since
runners.name: Coppola
runners.spotlight: Struggled under rules a couple of seasons ago and 0-8 in points since.

runners.comment: Poet's Word filly; half-sister to 2 French winners; Ewing prefers Sept Etoiles
runners.name: Dunsy Rock
runners.spotlight: Poet's Word filly; half-sister to French winners Cote De Grace (useful 2m1f-2m3f hurdle/chase) and King Sihtric (1m4f); dam unraced half-sister to high-class 2m chaser Central House, out of 2m2f-2m6f hurdle winner; one of three for the yard; Ewing prefers Sept Etoiles.

runners.comment: Berkshire filly; half-sister to Lisnamult Lad; tough ask on debut
runners.name: Hellfire Hathaway
runners.spotlight: Berkshire filly; half-sister to point and useful 2m2f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Lisnamult Lad; dam unraced half-sister to smart 2m-3m2f hurdle/chase winner Regal Heights, 2m hurdle/3m chase winner Star of Caulry and 2m4f chase winner Regal Term; tough ask on debut.

runners.comment: Point winner; well held fifth of 16 at Naas last month but form knocked since
runners.name: Somersby Roost
runners.spotlight: Point winner; well held fifth of 16 at Naas last month but form knocked since and needs much more here.

12:15.race_name: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Bumper winner, excellent hurdles debut at Leop'; excuse on latest, big chance if fit
runners.name: Champagne Jury
runners.owner: Dochas & Mrs J P Duffy Partnership

quotes.race: BetVictor's 60 Euro New Customer Offer (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Champagne Jury is a fine big horse and got through that ground well. He looks a big chaser in the making. Going for a maiden hurdle might not be the worst idea - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper winner gave Honesty Policy something to think about when a 1.25l runner up on hurdling debut at Leopardstown (2m, yielding) in March; had an excuse (coughing) for below par run when last seen in April; leading claims if fit for return.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his debut for us in a bumper at Naas earlier this year before running a good race behind Honesty Policy at Leopardstown. Unfortunately, he picked up an injury in the field during the summer and he's due back to us any day now. We'll wait and see how he is before making a plan, but he'll hopefully be out after Christmas. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Fourth in a point in April, tongue tied for Rules' bow, respected source, check market
runners.name: Green Angel
runners.spotlight: Modest fourth in a Loughanmore point-to-point in April; off since and sports a tongue-tie for Rules' debut; yard's runners always respected here so check the market.

runners.comment: 0-4 over timber and rated 119, solid h'cap run latest, go well in first-time tongue tie
runners.name: Los Blanco
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles and rated 119; beaten 1l in a Gowran handicap (2m, heavy) off 115 on latest; has run okay on quicker ground and he should go well returned to maiden company in a first-time tongue tie.

runners.comment: E36,000 Valirann gelding, dam half-sister to Major Malarkey, watch unless market speaks
runners.name: Large Steps
runners.spotlight: Valirann gelding; E36,000 3yo; dam unraced half-sister to useful 2m5f-3m hurdle/chase winner Major Malarkey, out of unraced half-sister to high-class staying chaser Valley Henry; best watched on debut unless the market speaks.

runners.comment: Modest efforts in points, tongue tie goes on for Rules' debut, best watched
runners.name: Ballyvallagh
runners.spotlight: Modest form in sole completed point-to-point; pulled up in that sphere on latest; best watched on Rules' bow in first-time tongue tie.

runners.comment: Tailed off in both starts 250 days apart, may need a bit more time
runners.name: Colins Friend
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Navan bumper in March and not much better in a Thurles maiden hurdle in November; may need a bit more time.

runners.breeder: M Dr V Roger-Yves Simon, Mme Jeanne Aznar,Mee Dr V Valerie S
runners.comment: Clovis Du Berlais gelding, from family of Un De Sceaux, check the market
runners.name: Live Your Dreams
runners.spotlight: Clovis Du Berlais gelding; E10,000 3yo; third foal; dam French 1m4f AQPS Flat winner, half-sister to top-class 1m4f AQPS Flat and 1m7f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Un De Sceaux; plenty of appeal on paper so check the market.

runners.comment: Placed in a point and bumper for former yard, place chance on debut for new stable
runners.name: All Night Revival
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in sole point-to-point start for Nigel Slevin; beaten a neck in a bumper for the same trainer at Fairyhouse last month (2m, heavy) and has since joined Philip Rothwell; place chance on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Long odds and well beaten in three maiden hurdles, passed over
runners.name: Artic Chief
runners.spotlight: Triple figure odds and ran accordingly in a trio of maiden hurdles; passed over.

runners.comment: Not many positives from first two starts, major improvement required
runners.name: Dunleer Crystal
runners.spotlight: In good hands but not many positives to take from his runs in a Clonmel maiden hurdle and Naas bumper; major improvement required.

runners.comment: Beaten 39l when fifth in this last year, may do better when tackling handicaps
runners.name: Written In My Soul
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in sole point-to-point; no impact in a pair of maiden hurdles at the backend of last year (beaten 39l when fifth in this race a year ago); may do better when tackling handicaps.

runners.comment: 5lb below last win, disappointing on latest at Cork but could bounce back down in grade
runners.name: Marys Pride
runners.spotlight: Is 5lb below his last win and he shaped nicely at Fairyhouse on seasonal return in October before disappointing at Cork on latest; drops in grade now and could bounce back.

runners.comment: First two handicap runs were underwhelming, lacks a run, watch in new cheekpieces
runners.name: Monroes Hollow
runners.spotlight: Mild promise in a maiden hurdle and a bumper but first two handicap efforts were underwhelming; lacks a run and best watched in new cheekpieces.

runners.comment: 0-7, not beaten far first two starts for this yard, ground an excuse latest, could go well
runners.name: Aswellasabentley
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but not beaten that far on first two starts for this stable and heavy ground may not have suited at Punchestown (2m4f) last time; could go well dropped back in distance.

runners.comment: Won at Bellewstown in April, came up short off revised mark twice since, may need this
runners.name: Letters To Juliet
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' handicap hurdle at Bellewstown (2m1f, good) in April; has come up short off revised mark twice since and might need this after a 207-day break.

runners.comment: Decent efforts both completed starts for this yard, drops in trip, not taken lightly
runners.name: The Toothpicker
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles; decent efforts both completed starts for this yard; beaten 5.25l when fifth of 24 at Cork (2m4f, sft-hvy) on latest, weakening late; not taken lightly dropped in trip.

runners.comment: Yet to threaten in handicaps, ground excuse latest but needs more off this mark
runners.name: Kingdom Calling

quotes.race: John Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted as Kingdom Calling had been making a fool out of me last year and is a lovely horse going forward and I think he will improve. We thought he was a bumper horse last year but he was running too keen and was petering out at the back-end of his races. The last day in Tramore, Philip Enright got him to relax, to breathe and do everything right but he thought mentally he was still childish - Eoin McCarthy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Yet to really threaten in handicaps since his Listowel maiden hurdle win in September 2024; heavy ground an excuse when tailed off latest but needs to find a bit more off current mark.

runners.comment: Fourth on handicap debut last time was a remote one, more needed off 1lb lower
runners.name: Back To Cali
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maidens and his fourth on handicap debut at Limerick last time was a remote one; more needed off 1lb lower to gain breakthrough win.

runners.comment: No show in maidens or first two h'caps, still early days but best watched for now
runners.name: Watty Show
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in maidens for Gary McGill and similar story in handicaps on first two starts for this yard; still early days but can only be watched for now.

runners.comment: Promise on h'cap debut (2m) but hasn't built on it over further since, needs to revive
runners.name: Ballinearla Girl
runners.owner: Eoghan Michael Wallis & Gerard Fintan Wallis

prev_owners.owner: Eoghan Michael Wallis & Gerard Fintan Wallis

runners.spotlight: Best of four handicap runs came over 2m at Listowel in June; unseated at Cork and soundly beaten at Wexford (3m) and Cork (2m4f) since; drop in trip needs to revive.

runners.comment: Sole win off 5lb higher in 2022, no show in two starts after long layoff, watch
runners.name: Uncle Gerhard

quotes.race: Langtons Kilkenny Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Charlie was very cool and gave Uncle Gerhard a super ride. I thought the ground might be a little too soft. He didn't get home at Down Royal but that was 2m1f and he's a real two-miler. I honestly didn't think he was really ready for today. We gave him a little break after Down Royal and we won't rush him - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer

runners.spotlight: Veteran's sole win came in 2022 off 5lb higher; hasn't really shown enough in two starts since returning from a long layoff to be of interest here; watch.

runners.comment: 0-6 for former yard, pulled up on h'cap debut in January, tongue-tie now tried
runners.name: Bruno From Mars
runners.spotlight: Maiden showed very little in six starts for former yard; pulled up on handicap debut when last seen in January; tongue-tie now tried on debut for new stable.

runners.comment: Handicap debutante hard to fancy on all known form, tongue-tie needs to transform
runners.name: Ringcreevy Diamond
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante is hard to fancy on the evidence of four runs under Rules; pulled up in a point-to-point latest; tongue-tie needs to transform.

runners.comment: Best form at Downpatrick, soundly beaten at Thurles last twice, others preferred
runners.name: Centaq
runners.spotlight: Best efforts have come at Downpatrick at around this trip; soundly beaten at Thurles the last twice and has a tendency to jump left at times; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Flat winner, beaten 9.5l on h'cap debut in August, 3lb drop not enough to tempt
runners.name: Patrick Street
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is 0-4 over hurdles; beaten 9.5l when sixth of 9 on handicap debut at Downpatrick (2m2f, good) on last start in this sphere in August; 3lb drop not enough to tempt.

runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles, no signs of winning potential yet, hard to make a case for
runners.name: Chesterbaylad
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles and yet to show signs of winning potential; no improvement for softer ground latest; hard to make a case for.

runners.comment: Very modest form so far including in h'caps, blinkers added to tongue tie, hard to fancy
runners.name: Give Her Hollie
runners.spotlight: Very modest form so far including in her first three handicaps; blinkers now added to tongue tie; difficult to fancy.

runners.comment: Decent run at Listowel in September, capable of running well if on a going day
runners.name: Boston Bobby

prev_owners.owner: John Synnott & P Donohoe & P J Rothwell

runners.spotlight: Went close at Sligo (2m2f, good) in June 2024 off 5lb higher; decent run after layoff at Listowel in September (2m, gd-yld) but has only completed one of three starts since; chance if he's on a going day.

runners.comment: AW winner, 0-13 over hurdles, pulled up in four of last five, leap of faith required
runners.name: Sunwalk

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Maiden
quotes.quote: Sunwalk has shown us a lot more at home than what he has produced so far on the track. Hopefully he'll build on this and keep going forward. He's a very big horse and it's probably going to take time to grow into himself. He will jump a hurdle - Brian Slattery, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: AW winner on the Flat; 0-13 over hurdles and has pulled up in four of his last five starts, the latest three in point-to-points last month; leap of faith required.

runners.comment: 0-13 over hurdles and yet to trouble the judge, pulled up latest, others preferred
runners.name: Avandra

prev_owners.owner: John Paul Flynn & P J Rothwell

runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles and yet to trouble the judge; never involved when pulling up at Clonmel earlier this month; others hold more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Five-time Flat winner, promise on last start over hurdles at Thurles, interesting
runners.name: Esticky End
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner is 0-11 over hurdles; not a bad effort when a 6.75l fifth of 13 at Thurles (2m, gd-yld) last month, shaping as though a bit further would suit; solid run at Dundalk two weeks ago and he's interesting.

runners.breeder: Lasnawood Ltd & Tullis Park Rose Ltd
runners.comment: Point winner in May, struggled in Ayr chase latest, watch in first h'cap hurdle; reserve
runners.name: Southey

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mrs C Mcalister

runners.spotlight: First reserve; won a point-to-point in May; placed in a couple of maiden hurdles last year but struggled in a handicap chase at Ayr latest; best watched in first handicap hurdle.

runners.comment: Huge odds and well beaten in maidens, watch on h'cap debut unless money arrives; reserve
runners.name: Hello Yes
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; huge odds and struggled in three maiden hurdles at around 2m1f-3m; best watched on handicap debut unless the market speaks.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in a trio of maiden hurdles and on handicap bow latest; watch
runners.name: Scary Askari
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; standout effort a 4l second in a Downpatrick bumper in August; soundly beaten in three maiden hurdles since and on handicap debut at Fairyhouse (made respiratory noise in running); watch.

13:23.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase

runners.comment: Failed to complete in four points since return from huge layoff, hard to fancy
runners.name: Bajan Excell

quotes.race: Follow Limerick On Instagram Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bajan Excell is strange one with his pedigree with the fact that he's slow and stays. He's a horse I would mind stepping up in trip in a handicap - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bajan Excell was lairy the whole way round and was having a good look. I got a good jump at the last and he put it to bed even though he had a look again when he got to the front. He likes heavy ground and I don't think 2m4f will be a problem to him - Mark Enright, rider

quotes.race: JT McNamara Ladbrokes Munster National Tomorrow At Limerick Racecourse Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up in trip helped him big time and he likes the ease in the ground. He ran better at Gowran last time and we'll probably go juvenile hurdling now. Shane [Crosse] gave him a good ride, they went quick enough in front, which helped - Feidhlim Cunningham, representing Gavin Cromwell, trainer of Bajan Excell

runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler for Gavin Cromwell in 2020; failed to complete in four point-to-points since return from massive layoff; hard to fancy.

stable_tour.quote: He's a hardy horse and we'll be starting him back over the next couple of weeks. We'll definitely give him another go over fences. Soft ground is fine for him, although I don't know about running him on bottomless ground when chasing. 19-11-20

runners.comment: Rated 120 over hurdles, completely lost way since 2024 win, can only be watched
runners.name: Clodders Dream
runners.spotlight: Rated 120 over hurdles but has had five non-completions in that sphere since winning at Tipperary in July 2024; can only be watched on chase debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's still a nice prospect over hurdles as he only won his maiden hurdle in May. He was progressive through the summer and hopefully he can continue on an upward curve when he returns. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Course winner over timber, rated 118 over fences, obvious chance if stays this longer trip
runners.name: Glenashling
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler (at this track) has earned a rating of 118 after four chase starts at around 2m; stamina to prove stepped up in trip, obvious chance if he stays (mixed messages in pedigree).

runners.breeder: M David Bernier, Mme Anne-Sophie Bernier, Mme Charlotte Bern
runners.comment: Still in the mix when falling at Cork last month, would prefer softer ground than this
runners.name: Jerk
runners.spotlight: 112-rated hurdles winner; well beaten on chase debut at Fairyhouse last November but was still well in contention when falling three out at Cork (2m5f, yielding) on return from a break last month; would prefer softer ground than this.

runners.comment: Two-time winning hurdler, yard's runners always respected here, tongue tied, could go well
runners.name: Kinbara Firstdraft
runners.spotlight: 110 rated, two-time winning hurdler; shaped well in a novices' handicap hurdle here back in March (2m4f, good); may have needed latest after break and yard's runners always respected here; could go well on chase debut; tongue tied.

runners.comment: Not a bad run on chase debut latest, strip fitter and up in trip a plus, best form on soft
runners.name: Slanagaibhgoleir

quotes.race: Download The Bet Victor App Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Slanagaibhgoleir has been disappointing but I would say the step up to 3m suited. He picked up well from the mistake at the last and you would have to be pleased - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.spotlight: 121-rated hurdler didn't run too badly on chase debut at Clonmel (17.5f, heavy) earlier this month; will strip fitter for that and this longer trip is a positive but his best form is on soft ground; rain would enhance chance.

stable_tour.quote: He had a nice run in a maiden hurdle at Punchestown last season and should progress this year. 24-10-23

runners.comment: Rated 129 over hurdles, promise in both beginners' chases, should be in the mix again
runners.name: Supreme Jet
runners.spotlight: Rated 129 over hurdles and has shaped with promise in beginners' chases at Naas (2m, soft) and Cork (2m5f, yielding) the last twice; should be in the mix again dropped back slightly in trip.

runners.comment: Rated 113 over hurdles, should make a chaser on breeding but lacks experience
runners.name: Torquay Road
runners.spotlight: Three-time winning hurdler rated 113 in that sphere; remote fourth over hurdles at Newbury on latest last month; should make a chaser on breeding and enjoys going right-handed but lack of chasing experience may count against him.

runners.comment: 0-5 over fences, soundly beaten thrice since promising Wexford 2nd, bit to prove for now
runners.name: West Away

quotes.race: Midsummer's Day With The Stars On Sunday, 23rd June Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: West Away got a very good ride from Dylan and it was good to reward him. He has developed into a good horse. He had been running in good quality races for the grade so it was great to win one. He could go to Cartmel for a big pot - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two-time winning hurdler is 0-5 in chases and rated 121; fine effort when a 1l second to Ashdale Flyer at Wexford in August but soundly beaten both chase starts since; a bit to prove for now.

runners.comment: Point winner, 4-15 over hurdles, bred to make a chaser but best watched unless backed
runners.name: Birmingham Alabama
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner is 4-15 over hurdles and rated 120; bred to make a chaser but needs to bounce back from two moderate efforts over hurdles at Roscommon and Thurles; best watched unless the market speaks.

runners.breeder: Mrs T K Cooper & Miss Diana Cooper
runners.comment: Rated 106 after two chase starts, much more needed to win this
runners.name: Fairyland Opera
runners.owner: Mrs T K Cooper & Miss Diana Cooper

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fairyland Opera absolutely deserved it and she ran unbelievable races at Naas and Navan, bumping into two very good horses. It didn't do her handicap mark any good so we said we'd go back to a maiden. They either stay or they don't and handle Tramore or not but she did both just fine. She's gorgeous. The plan was always to step up in trip and she'll probably have one more run before her holidays - Lorna Fowler, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is rated 106 after two modest efforts in beginners' chases at Fairyhouse and Thurles; much more needed to win this.

runners.breeder: M Claude Quellier, M Alan Quellier & Mme Svetlana Timon-Quel
runners.comment: Point and maiden hurdle winner, out of depth when last seen in April, market best guide
runners.name: Swing Davis

quotes.race: Pick Your Places At BoyleSports Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was there a long way out but I was staying on and I still had a fair chance. Swing Davis was unlucky to fall the last day and I was staying on well that day as well. Two and a half isn't a problem and she jumps very well so she'll jump a fence in time -  Sam Ewing, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on good to yielding; won a Navan maiden hurdle in March (2m, heavy); outclassed when pulled up in Fairyhouse Grade 1 when last seen in April; market best guide on seasonal return and chase debut.

stable_tour.quote: She's been so disappointing. We had high hopes for her early doors but she hasn't lived up to those expectations for whatever reason. Hopefully she might start to fulfil her potential now that she's strengthened up a bit. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Solid runs over timber last twice, rated 12lb lower over fences, could go well
runners.name: I A Connect

quotes.race: equuip - A Leg Up For Thoroughbred People Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: I A Connect pecked a bit at the back of second-last but he stays and probably wants further than that. I sent him on early as all he does is stay and to be fair to him he stuck his head out and battled - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Best Odds Guaranteed Hurdle
quotes.quote: I A Connect picked up again when the other horse came to him. He will be better over 2m4f - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 10yo has shaped nicely in handicap hurdles on first two starts for this yard and is rated 12lb lower over fences; no win since July 2023 but is 7lb lower than when beaten 1.5l in a handicap chase at Tramore in May and this is an easier race; could go well.

stable_tour.quote: He was running a big race at Punchestown in a hot handicap hurdle when he got rid of Adrian Heskin at the second-last. There could be a nice race in him this season off his mark in the low 130s. 18-10-22

runners.comment: 0-7 over fences but ran well at Navan on penultimate, big chance on that run
runners.name: Tell Nobody Nothin

quotes.race: Downpatrick Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tell Nobody Nothin travelled great. He had a break over the summer and I'm thrilled with him. We'll take it steady, we'll look for a rated novice with him or something like that - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-7 over fences but has run well in defeat; beaten 5l at Navan (2m4f, soft) on penultimate off 1lb higher and this is easier; has gone well here before over timber; big chance on that Navan run.

runners.breeder: S C P Ecurie Pegase & Mme S Mottier
runners.comment: Mixed bag since 3m Ayr win in March, failed to complete last twice, others preferred
runners.name: Le Grand Vert
runners.spotlight: Has been a mixed bag since his Ayr win in March (3m, soft); has failed to complete the last twice and not sure this drop in trip will suit; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Long standing maiden, beat just one rival home on latest at Haydock, hard to fancy
runners.name: Malton Groove
runners.spotlight: Long standing maiden hasn't been shaping as though his turn is near in recent starts; beat just one rival home at Haydock on latest; hard to fancy.

stable_tour.quote: This chap has a good pedigree, a three-parts brother to Minella Times. He was very backward last year but we think he is growing up all the time and you might see a different horse this season. 24-10-23

runners.comment: Beaten 26l on handicap chase debut, new cheekpieces and longer trip need to spark
runners.name: Royal Time
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Naas last December but has been struggling in recent starts; beaten 26l on handicap chase debut at Clonmel in November; new cheekpieces and step up in trip need to spark.

runners.comment: Won this in 2023 off 6lb higher, pulled up over timber latest, return to this track a plus
runners.name: Eagle Terrace

prev_owners.owner: Last One For The Road Syndicate
Last One For The Road Syndicate

runners.spotlight: Is 2-18 over fences and his last win came in this race in 2023 off 95; 6lb lower now and while he was pulled up over hurdles latest, the return to this C&D offers hope of a revival; not discounted.

runners.comment: Disappointing since close third at Downpatrick in July, this trip looks on the sharp side
runners.name: Jimlis Cave
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-5 over fences; went close when third at Downpatrick in July (23.5f, good) but has disappointed in three runs since and this trip may be on the sharp side.

runners.comment: Modest hurdles form, well beaten in beginners chase latest, watch in new headgear combo
runners.name: Walk In The Sea
runners.owner: Whose Round Is It Now Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Modest overall form over hurdles and beaten 32l in a Tramore beginners' chase latest; can only be watched on handicap chase debut in new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Disappointing since Navan fourth over hurdles in September, others make more appeal
runners.name: Another Challenge
runners.spotlight: His Navan fourth over hurdles in September suggested he can win a race but two runs since, including in a handicap chase last time, have been disappointing; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden, modest hurdles form for two former yards, watch on chase debut
runners.name: Bid Up
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden is now with third trainer; very modest form over hurdles for Ross O'Sullivan and Paul Gilligan and can only be watched on stable and chasing debut.

runners.comment: Big step forward at Naas latest, best form on heavy ground, rain would be welcome
runners.name: Duce Bigalow
runners.spotlight: Big step forward from previous Rules form when a 3l third of 10 at Naas 11 days ago (2m, heavy); this longer trip should suit but his best point-to-point run came on similarly testing ground so rain would be welcome.

runners.comment: Off since poor hurdles run in July, chase form unconvincing, probably best watched
runners.name: Rose Of Kalanisi
runners.spotlight: Won on stable debut over hurdles at Kelso in April when sent off the 3-1 favourite; didn't back it up when last seen at Downpatrick in July; chase form unconvincing and probably best watched for now.

runners.comment: 0-22 under Rules, 0-4 in chases, out of form over timber recently, hard to fancy
runners.name: Younowhatimean
runners.spotlight: Is 0-22 under Rules (0-4 in chases); unseated on last chase start at Downpatrick in May; out of form over timber recently; hard to make a case for.

runners.comment: 0-11 over fences but shaped well the last twice, worth another go at this trip, player
runners.name: Baltinglass Hill

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Baltinglass Hill was a very unlucky loser at Navan and it came up soft at Cork last time. Rachael at the last was the difference. He wants good ground. We might run him in a 2m handicap hurdle at Galway because he is tough - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time winning hurdler is 0-11 in chases but he has shaped nicely on his last two starts in this sphere at Clonmel (18.5f, gd-yld) and Thurles (18.5f, yielding); worth another go at this trip on the evidence of those efforts and he's a player.

runners.comment: Bumper winner, beaten 15.5l on chase debut on penultimate, watch on stable debut
runners.name: Feast

prev_owners.owner: R P Behan & J J Lambe

runners.spotlight: Bumper winner has yet to hit the frame over jumps; pulled up over hurdles at Fairyhouse in November and beaten 15.5l on chase debut at Sligo on penultimate; watch on debut for new stable.

runners.comment: 0-9 over fences, may have needed latest but needs to improve on previous chase efforts
runners.name: Mastermind

quotes.race: Naas RFC Supported By Profile Systems Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mastermind settled beautifully and jumped really well. He probably wants nicer ground and he will appreciate 2m4f - Robbie Power, rider.

quotes.race: Thanks To All Our Customers 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mastermind ran well at Fairyhouse but he was a bit free so we put the hood on him and he switched off well. He's not a bad horse and he will prefer better ground - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two-time hurdles winner is 0-9 over fences; well beaten at big prices on first two starts for this stable; may have needed his latest run after a break but needs to improve on previous chase efforts to feature here.

runners.comment: Saw out the 3m5f trip well to win at Downpatrick in May, others have superior credentials
runners.name: Asphalt Cowboy
runners.spotlight: No match for Fountain House at Thurles and pulled up in the Bishopscourt Cup won by the same horse; saw out the 3m5f trip well to win at Downpatrick in May; has a bit to find with Galon De Vauzelle on running at Tinahely last month.

runners.comment: Beat Its On The Line in this race last year, uneven form since then, others more reliable
runners.name: Big Interest
runners.spotlight: Caused a minor shock when beating Its On The Line in this race last year; uneven form subsequently; smart performance when beating Hollow Games at Fairyhouse in April; beaten 7l into fourth behind Carnfunnock at Curraghmore on seasonal debut; made mistakes and pulled up in Fairyhouse event won by Con's Roc; vet noted a small amount of mucus at both nostrils.

runners.comment: Dropped away after making the running when a remote fifth behind Con's Roc at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Bold Fury
runners.spotlight: 2-10 in point-to-points; finished in front of a below-par Big Interest when second over C&D in March; third in a maiden hunter chase here in May; solid effort when second in a maiden hurdle at Roscommon in August; dropped away after making the running when a remote fifth behind Con's Roc at Fairyhouse.

runners.comment: Has done well since returning to his original handler, 2-2 during the autumn campaign
runners.name: Cadoudal Saint
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in three starts for Willie Mullins after a maiden point win for Ger Quinnn; has done well since returning to his original handler; 2-2 during the autumn campaign, beat Journey With Me and Now Where Or When readily at Kirkistown last month.

stable_tour.quote: He stayed on strongly to win his point-to-point and looks another lovely, big stayer for the Mastersons. Fences will bring out the best in him in time. He looks a staying hurdling type for this season. 13-11-23

runners.comment: Sixth at 100-1 in the St James's Place at Cheltenham, good winner on return
runners.name: Carnfunnock

quotes.race: WorkPal INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Carnfunnock has strengthened up and progressed well. The plan was to go hurdling but this race had cut up so much we stuck him in it. I imagine we will go over hurdles now - Stuart Crawford, trainer

runners.spotlight: Useful sort early in his career in bumpers and over hurdles; adapted well to points last season, winning twice before running respectably to finish sixth at 100-1 in the St James's Place at Cheltenham; pulled up at the Punchestown festival; returned in good shape with a Curraghmore win, relegating a below-par Big Interest to fourth.

runners.comment: A long way behind Con's Roc when they clashed at Cragmore in January, plenty to find
runners.name: City Chief

quotes.race: William Hill Towton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: City Chief was good. I had to make plenty of use of him because he wants further really but he jumped better today. I don't know about Cheltenham as he's still got a bit of growing up to do. He'd stay the trip but he may be more of an Ayr horse. I think he had plenty left at the end - James Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Ayrshire Hospice, Building The Future Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBb Race)
quotes.quote: I thought City Chief he was going to get there easier but he got the job done in the end - James Bowen, rider.

runners.spotlight: Four wins on the track when trained by Nicky Henderson; a long way behind Con's Roc when they clashed at Cragmore in January; stepped up from that when scoring at Toomebridge in May.

stable_tour.quote: His first chase was unfortunate, but he won his next two including a Grade 2 at Wetherby. He wasn't ready for Cheltenham so we went to Ayr and he was third, but we were slightly disappointed by that. A charming horse, he jumps and stays well, and goes on easy ground, so he should progress. He's entered in the Coral Gold Cup and he's in the Grand Sefton at Aintree too, which could be a pointer to a certain race there in April. 30-10-23

runners.comment: Confirmed high standard of form when scoring easily at Fairyhouse last month, big chance
runners.name: Cons Roc

quotes.race: Masterchefs 2025 Maiden Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Con's Roc won his point-to-point really impressively last year. Ideally, we'd love to think we could end up in Cheltenham and he'll have one run before then and hope to get him in - Terence O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 2-4 in point-to-points; made an excellent start on the track when winning a maiden hunter chase at Limerick last Christmas; beaten by the very experienced Rocky's Howya at Cragmore in January; returned in fine shape to score easily at Fairyhouse five weeks ago, when an off-colour Big Interest was pulled up.

runners.comment: Prolific in point-to-points (6-11), a distant third behind Con's Roc at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Fountain House
runners.spotlight: Prolific in point-to-points (6-11); has won two of his five starts under Rules; beat Asphalt Cowboy at Thurles in March and overcame adversity to capture the confined Bishopscourt Cup at the Punchestown festival (2m4f, yielding); weakened after a mistake two out to finish a distant third behind Con's Roc at Fairyhouse.

runners.breeder: G A E C Devauzelle De Vauzelle
runners.comment: Won a Tinahely event last month, should uphold form with third-placed Asphalt Cowboy
runners.name: Galon De Vauzelle
runners.owner: J P Lane & Emma Downey & P J Rothwell

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was very heavy ground the second-last day in Fairyhouse and Galon De Vauzelle just didn't handle it. Hence he was out so wide today. I went to Cheltenham and I thought he was doing a half-speed down to the third-last and he just switched in and made a mistake at the wrong time. He did nothing wrong that day, I thought he was running a blinder. Last year Seddon beat us 10 lengths and look at what he went on to do. He was 4lb higher this year and we fitted blinkers for the first time, not because he is un-genuine, but just to sharpen him up. Going around the parade ring beforehand, he was on his 'A' game. I was very confident of a very big run. I'd love to bring him back to the UK and try him on good ground over further. It is something I have in my head. I'd love to drop him in over three and a-half miles on good ground in a good chase over there - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Philip (Rothwell) said Galon de Vauzelle needs to be ridden half-cold and leave it as late as you can. I thought jumping the third-last he was starting to roll a bit too soon under me but he jumped super, and in fairness, he was tough to the line. The cheekpieces fired him there when I needed him - Jack Foley, jockey

runners.spotlight: Won a point on debut in 2020; winner of four of his 40 starts on the track and placed ten times; has made an encouraging return to points; won a Tinahely event in which former track star Conflated flopped; should uphold form with third-placed Asphalt Cowboy.

runners.comment: Achieved remote placings in top races in this category last term, others preferred
runners.name: Hollow Games

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Hollow Games ran very well because he got stopped in his run a couple of times and he probably should have been second. He'll be a nice horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hollow Games is a nice horse, a big galloper. Davy said he wasn't doing a stroke the whole way round, he just picked up when he gave him a squeeze. He's more of a staying horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Injured Jockeys INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: This is a very good horse. He's a lovely staying prospect and it was nice to get that done today. He's still a big green horse, he's 16.3 hands and is going to improve again. He's a staying horse for the future. When you're able to do that, win two bumpers, you're more than likely going to end up being a good horse - Jamie Codd, rider of Hollow Games

quotes.race: Love Food At Rathsallagh Golf Club (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Our better winter horses are starting to come out. We have a few really nice bumper horses but this lad is right up there. He's very, very good - Jamie Codd, rider

runners.spotlight: Former Gordon Elliott-trained gelding best known for winning his first five races, a maiden point, two bumpers and two hurdle races, including a Grade 3 event; failed to add to his tally after a 2022 chase success; achieved remote placings in top races in this category last term; third on debut for Adam Lord at Borris a month ago.

stable_tour.quote: We're going to go down the hunter chase route with him in the hope that the spark will return. He's got some good back form and he's only eight, so hopefully he'll be a force to be reckoned with in that sort of grade. 28-10-24

runners.comment: The leading Irish hunter chaser of recent seasons, should be better for a prep run
runners.name: Its On The Line

prev_owners.owner: Emmet Mullins/C C R Racing Syndicate

quotes.race: Randox Foxhunters' Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: Its On The Line has got ability and Derek (O'Connor) gets everything out of him. I suppose we were thankful of the loose horses out there today as he had a bit of company and he was able to stretch out and go away, and he has done it well to the finish. He is not a natural leader by any stretch, and he likes to suss out things, and get into a rhythm, and figure it out. He is well named I think. I probably wasn't planning this race after Cheltenham. We gave him a speculative entry and once it turned up heavy ground it was always going to bring stamina into play. That was the biggest sway into running him. He takes his races very well and last season he turned up at Cheltenham, Aintree and Punchestown. He has a great constitution. I'd say he will stay hunter chasing. It is great to come to these meetings with a horse that has a big chance. Fingers crossed he will keep doing the business. He will definitely get an entry for Punchestown, but he will tell us how he is - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Its On The Line is not good for the heart. There's loads of ability, its just a matter of coaxing it out of him. He looked a sitting duck for a fast finisher but he just picked up and went away again - Emmet Mullins, trainer

runners.spotlight: The leading Irish hunter chaser of recent seasons; three-time winner of the championship event at Punchestown and also landed the Aintree Foxhunters last year; Cheltenham has been his bogey track but being three times runner-up in the hunter chase at the festival is still no mean feat; won this race two years ago and runner-up last year; just behind Panda Boy when close fourth on his reappearance at Ballindenisk.

stable_tour.quote: He's well in himself and done well for the summer break. He had an extended break and hasn't been back in long. Hopefully, he might get to Down Royal on St Stephen's Day [December 26] and start from there towards the spring targets. He's still only a seven-year-old and he's been a great campaigner for us. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Has shown plenty of ability in points, winning four from seven, stablemate of Big Interest
runners.name: My Life Be Like
runners.spotlight: Jumped badly when well fancied here in March on his only racecourse start; veterinary excuse emerged; has shown plenty of ability in points, winning four from seven; stablemate of Big Interest; a top rider for both horses.

runners.comment: Held by several of the leaders in this category on Cheltenham and Punchestown running
runners.name: Ontheropes

quotes.race: JT McNamara Ladbrokes Munster National Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: It's my first time riding Ontheropes, and in fairness he was very straightforward. He got away well, had a little peck at the first but after that he jumped super everywhere. I was always comfortable, I had a lovely position, and I was conscious not to let him try to sprint too much. I built it up from the top of the hill and he was good at the last and he was always holding on a bit - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

runners.spotlight: 1-22 record over fences is off-putting; has often run well in defeat, including when fifth in the 2024 Scottish National; failed to find his best form last season; held by several of the leading performers in this category on Cheltenham and Punchestown running.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good in the Munster National on his first start after a break. His aim is the Ladbrokes Trophy at Newbury and it's so far so good in terms of his preparation. 02-11-21

His runs have been okay and he needs to hit better form. He is another who does not appreciate the heavy winter ground. He won the Munster National well and is a proper staying chaser so these are the races I will be entering him in over the next couple of years. 09-03-22

runners.comment: Runner-up to Fountain House in the Bishopscourt Cup at Punchestown
runners.name: Squire Ohara
runners.spotlight: Point winner at Loughanmore in April after four consecutive placed efforts; improved on previous racecourse form when runner-up to Fountain House in the Bishopscourt Cup at Punchestown; failed to build on that when fourth at Downpatrick in May.

runners.comment: Point winner before a good cross-country run at Punchestown, boasts high-class track form
runners.name: The Goffer

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Goffer keeps on galloping as he showed there and with that in mind the obvious place to go with him will be the Irish National at Fairyhouse over the Easter holiday as long as he comes out of this race in good heart - Gordon Elliott, trainer.
