quotes.race: Bulmers Leopardstown Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: We thought The Goffer had a chance on the drying ground. He probably wants a bit further but he jumped great and galloped the whole way to the line. We're very happy. Davy was great on him. I told him to go out and take every chance, don't leave the paint. In those big handicaps that's what you have to do. We'll look at all those long distance races and he could be an Irish National horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Markaye Contracts Ltd Michael Purcell Memorial Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The Goffer found plenty and if something was alongside him it might have brought him on a bit more but he did it well here off a nice gallop. He's a big horse and he will improve - Jordan Gainford, rider.

quotes.race: Kilberry Pub & Kitchen Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: The Goffer had been working well. He's an improving horse and he jumped great - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four-time track winner who has shown the ability to cope with the demands of the Punchestown cross-country course; remains capable of good form over orthodox fences, as he showed when third in last season's Topham; point winner in October before a good cross-country run at Punchestown last month.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of ours that'll go down the hunter chase route. He won an open point-to-point at Umma House the other day and that'll have done his confidence no harm whatsoever. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Fine effort when only 3 1/2l behind Its On The Line at Cheltenham, flopped at Punchestown
runners.name: Willitgoahead
runners.spotlight: Second to Con's Roc at Limerick last Christmas before winning at Thurles in January on his final start for Sean Doyle; made a fine start for Gordon Elliott when staying on for third at Cheltenham, getting within 3 1/2l of runner-up Its On The Line; in contrast, a tame effort and pulled up in the championship event at Punchestown.

runners.comment: First reserve, good staying handicap chaser, just in front of Its On The Line last month
runners.name: Panda Boy

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: We only decided after Panda Boy ran here at the Festival to go chasing with him. I always felt he was a good-ground horse. His action always suggested to me that he wanted decent ground and chasing is his game. We may give him a little break now - Martin Brassil, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We think a lot of the horse. Panda Boy just needed distance and his ground - Martin Brassil, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Panda Boy is a big, weak horse and he is only starting to furnish. The more dry weather we were getting the more hopeful I was. His future is over fences but we will try and find a hurdle race before the end of the season - Martin Brassil, trainer.

runners.spotlight: A good staying handicap chaser, though hard to win with (1-15), rated in the 140s at his peak; finished just in front of Its On The Line when third at Ballindenisk last month on his point-to-point debut; first reserve.

runners.comment: Second reserve, fitness not in doubt after three runs in recent months, big task here
runners.name: Now Where Or When

quotes.race: Start Your Free Trial Now At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Now Where Or When was also in the 3m handicap tomorrow but we came here in case there was a deluge. This was plenty sharp enough for him. He was gaining lengths at every fence - Stuart Crawford, trainer

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Supporting Local Business Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Now Where Or When had a good run at Down Royal and his jumping sharpened up plenty. It was nice to see him winning over 2m. The cheekpieces helped him too - J.J. Slevin, rider.

runners.spotlight: His fitness is not in doubt after three runs in recent months; big task here following third to Cadoudal Saint at Kirkistown; second reserve.

runners.comment: Third reserve, may have needed the run in last month's Kirkistown race won by Carnfunnock
runners.name: Folly Master

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee, Never Beaten By SP Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Folly Master is a lovely horse, very straightforward and genuine. He wants proper soft ground and maybe another mile. He could be one for a bigger day in the spring - Tom Dreaper, trainer.

quotes.race: Leugh Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Folly Master is a lovely horse and is getting better for racing. He is a staying chaser for the future - Tom Dreaper, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Compiled a decent record in handicaps last season and proved trip-versatile; second in races at 2m and 3m on either side of a Punchestown win over an intermediate trip; may have needed the run in last month's Kirkistown race won by Carnfunnock; third reserve.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Neuf
runners.comment: Blue Bresil gelding; brother to 2m3f-2m7f hurdle winner Kilbarry Hill; may need further
runners.name: Blue Du Neuf
runners.spotlight: Blue Bresil gelding; brother to 2m3f-2m7f hurdle winner Kilbarry Hill; dam bumper/2m3f hurdle winner, out of maiden half-sister to dam of high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner Catch Me and bumper/smart 2m hurdle winner Cash And Go; tongue-tie on for debut; may need more of a stamina test but market support worth noting.

runners.comment: 2nd in a point and shaped with promise when 2nd on rules debut; should come on for that
runners.name: Boycetown
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point and while that form hasn't really worked out, he shaped with promise on rules debut in a Punchestown bumper last month; entitled to come on for that.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in a point-to-point and is a nice horse to look forward to. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Failed to complete in three points and best watched for now
runners.name: Brootally
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in three points and best watched for now.

runners.comment: Half-brother to winners Ballymountain Boy/Ballyvango; yard 0-7 in bumpers last 5 years
runners.name: Dark Eagle
runners.spotlight: Wings Of Eagles gelding; half-brother to winners Ballymountain Boy (bumper and 2m4f/2m5f hurdle) and Ballyvango (1m7f hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to 2m3f hurdle winner Buffalo Ballet, out of half-sister to high-class jumper Observe; yard 0-7 in bumpers last five years.

runners.comment: Hasn't shown enough in a pair of bumper starts at big prices
runners.name: Dorie Miller
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown enough in a pair of bumper starts at big prices.

runners.comment: Point winner who was too keen on rules debut and may need further
runners.name: Endless Talking
runners.spotlight: Point winner (form knocked since) and was too keen on rules debut last month when seventh of 14; pedigree suggests he may want further but worth a market check.

runners.comment: Jukebox Jury gelding; dam bumper/2m6f hurdle winner; more of long-term prospect
runners.name: Jukebox Charlie
runners.spotlight: Jukebox Jury gelding; dam bumper/2m6f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners So Fine (useful 2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase), Davids Jewel (2m hurdle) and Tens Or Better (bumper); probably more of a long-term prospect.

runners.comment: Success Days gelding; dam bumper winner; yard 0-11 in bumpers last 5 years; check market
runners.name: Kershaw
runners.spotlight: Success Days gelding; dam bumper winner, half-sister to winners Megaton (1m1f/1m6f Flat and 2m-3m hurdle/chase) and Engrossing (1m Flat/2m hurdle); runner-up to a subsequent rules winner in a point in April; yard 0-11 in bumpers last five years but worth a market check.

runners.comment: Half-brother to 2m5f/3m hurdle winner Ringdufferin; may want further but check market
runners.name: Loch Cuan
runners.spotlight: Court Cave gelding; half-brother to 2m5f/3m hurdle winner Ringdufferin; dam unraced half-sister to high-class 2m chaser Central House, out of 2m2f-2m6f hurdle winner; might want further but yard have 33 per cent strike-rate with their bumper runners here and he's worth a market check.

runners.comment: 2nd in 5-runner bumper at Thurles in October; not strong form but should improve
runners.name: Long Goodbye
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in five-runner bumper at Thurles in October; that doesn't look like strong form but entitled to improve on that.

runners.comment: Promising 3rd in Cork maiden hurdle and only beaten head since; big chance back in bumper
runners.name: Master Haku
runners.spotlight: Promising third in a Cork maiden hurdle on debut; got closer to the runner-up from that contest when beaten a head by that rival back at Cork last month, just failing to get up; should be a big player back in a bumper and we know he's fine on this sort of ground.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Taillis
runners.comment: Outran his odds in a Listowel bumper and the form looks rock-solid; likely to improve
runners.name: Moon Sky
runners.spotlight: Outran his odds in a Listowel bumper and the form looks rock-solid with plenty of those rivals either winning or finishing runner-up in bumpers/maiden hurdles since; likely to improve and one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Tailed off when 16s for 6-runner course bumper last month; hard to fancy on back of that
runners.name: Pedro The Poet
runners.spotlight: Tailed off when 16-1 for a six-runner course bumper last month and hard to fancy on the back of that.

runners.comment: Sea Moon gelding; dam placed in bumpers/2m-3m1f hurdles; yard get plenty of bumper winners
runners.name: Sharu
runners.spotlight: Sea Moon gelding; dam placed in bumpers/2m-3m1f hurdles, half-sister to useful winners That'll Do Moss (bumper/2m hurdle) and Ballymillsy (3m2f hurdle), out of bumper/2m hurdle winner; yard get more than their fair share of bumper winners and market support would be significant.

runners.comment: Jet Away gelding; twice-raced dam closely related to 2m3f chase winner Toohighforme
runners.name: Tommys Ticket
runners.spotlight: Jet Away gelding; twice-raced dam closely related to 2m3f chase winner Toohighforme, half-sister to 3m hurdle winner Let The Show Begin; yard 0-6 in bumpers last five years.

runners.comment: Third of 12 (beaten 28l) in a mares' bumper at Naas on debut, fading late
runners.name: An Lachin Beag
runners.spotlight: Third of 12 (beaten 28l) in a mares' bumper at Naas on debut, fading late; should come on for that but pedigree suggests she may want more of a stamina test.

runners.comment: Order Of St George filly; dam has middle distance Flat pedigree; may need this
runners.name: Cocos Legacy
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George filly; dam unplaced 7f-13.3f (including 2yo/AW; RPR 69), closely related to 1m4f winner Isle Of Avalon, half-sister to 1m1f winner Miners Gamble, out of 1m4f winner; 4yo who may need this.

runners.comment: Tailed off when 150-1 for a Grade 3 bumper at the Punchestown festival; sights lowered
runners.name: Six Mile Suzy
runners.spotlight: Tailed off when 150-1 for a Grade 3 bumper at the Punchestown festival; sights lowered here but probably best watched.
